name: KreuzherrenEcke
description:
City: Düsseldorf
description: Altestadt is a street full of boozers and one of them is this tiny corner pub. There are only 2 tables and a couple of bar stools for seating, yet somehow they manage to have live music here. Maybe the band take up position in the toilets.

It's fitted out in a simple, but tasteful manner with wooden fittings and a tile floor. The windows are unusual: the bottom third of each is etched with the name of a spirit, the middle third with the name of a country and the top with various coloured culinary symbols, such as corkscrews, beer taps, etc. I've no idea what the meaning of it is, but it's attractive enough. It reminds me of the sort of decoration you would see in Interhotel bars or HO restaurants built in the 1960's (if anyone can remember such things now).

name: The Nutshell
description:
City: Bury St Edmunds
description: A tiny pub in Bury St Edmunds holds the Guinness World Record for the smallest pub in Britain, measuring just 15 feet by 7 feet. In 1984 they decided to see how many people they could fit in and somehow managed to squeeze in 102 people and a dog, like a clown car. When not conducting scientific experiments, only about 10-15 people can get in here at once. There are bank notes on the ceiling, a tiny dart board, and a tiny copy of The Times. There's also a mummified cat hanging from the ceiling, if that's your sort of thing.

description: Cocktail bar with a reasonably publike décor and feel, also a decent beer selection and elevated by being a local institution, with the atmosphere that comes with it.

name: Calpe
description:
City: Santiago de Compostela
description: Walk in wine bar, pennies for a glass of wine, ultimate simplicity, no b.s, no nothing. Looks like a potential hidden gem.

name: Fraggle Rock
description:
City: Santiago de Compostela
description: A down to earth alt venue. Messy bar area, live blues, not the same see-and-be-seen vibe.

name: The New Barrack Tavern
description:
City: Sheffield
description: A true community pub with a wide range of ales, live events and other amenities.

name: The Closed Shop
description:
City: Sheffield
description: Previously a little ragged but restored to a cosy neighbourhood pub, popular with students, full range of Stancill brewery products at OK prices

name: West End Hotel
description:
City: Sheffield
description: Fantastic looking neighbourhood pub, lived in, homely and local. Pool table, wood panelled bar area. Feels like a freehouse - less generic. Likely a 9/10.

name: Sportsman Lodge Moor
description:
City: Sheffield
description: Freehold lived in country pub, no-nonsense, no generic stuff, not a beige dining room, a pub for all.

name: The Miners Arms
description:
City: Hundall
description: A true freehold country pub, low slung wooden beams, homely lived in feel, pool table.

name: The Strines Inn
description:
City: Bradfield Dale
description: Cosy freehold country pub, wooden beams, copper kettles, well reviewed, good food, neighbourly feel.

name: The Coachhouse & Olde Bar
description:
City: Glaslough
description: Superb, unspoilt and down to earth country pub retaining its character and genius loci.

name: The Unicorn
description:
City: Manchester
description: A down to earth and friendly looking pub in the heart of it all.

name: The Turnpike
description:
City: Manchester
description: Unique art-deco revival bar which of all things is a Sam Smiths pub! A true oddity and well reviewed.

name: Fox Inn
description:
City: York
description: Victorian pub purpose-built in 1878 and once a busy local for the nearby railway works. Carefully restored by Tetley’s in 1985, preserving the old corridor layout with serving hatch, the pleasingly functional front bar and the delightful ‘tramcar room’. Have visited twice and it was reasonably nice. Large beer garden under large old trees.

name: Craven Arms Pub & Cruck Barn
description:
City: Appletreewick
description: A gastropub but some careful décor has maintained a barn inn feel with a huge preserved fireplace and a more lived in feel. The bar area itself has bags of character with a cramped bar and cosy siderooms. Turn up at opening time or it will be packed

name: The Crows Nest
description:
City: Liskeard
description: Yer classic country pub - stone walls and a real fire inside, simple furniture, not too gentrified.

name: The Nobody Inn
description:
City: Exeter
description: One of the ultimate village pubs with the décor spot on. Traditional, tasteful, characterful with a very cosy feel. Almost embarrasses the competition.

name: Warren House Inn
description:
City: Yelverton
description: As yet ungentrified. A traditional country inn, low ceiling, beams, well preserved bar - everything you'd want and little you wouldn't.

name: The Great Western
description:
City: Wolverhampton
description: Wonderful cosy community pub with train memorabilia and a welcoming sense of place.

name: Hole in T' Wall
description:
City: Bowness
description: Unique cosy hideout pub, shut out the outside and embrace the gloom and the tarred walls. A classic quirky pub.

name: Minerva Inn
description:
City: Plymouth
description: Traditional pub with 'haunted' history, more telling of its age and character than any ghosts. Low ceilings and a pub of yesteryear preserved well.

name: Dipton Mill Inn
description:
City: Hexham
description: "This is what all pubs should be like" - an absolute classic - ungentrified freehold pub, cosy, real, lived-in, characterful country pub. A dying breed.

name: The Olde Wine Shades
description:
City: London
description: Preserved wine bar with one beer option, more of a pub style interior with some portioned seating and dark wooden panels.

name: Ye Olde Salutation Inn
description:
City: Nottingham
description: Extremely old pub with beams, however is being used as a fairly generic towny rock pub, and the furniture + quiz machines etc are not particularly in keeping with the surroundings. That said, it isn't awful and if you like ancient buildings and unpretentious boozing you'll enjoy this. We are keeping this as a tentative suggestion.

name: The White Lion Inn
description:
City: Barthomley
description: Thatched cottage and pub, nooks and crannies - preserved character although with 1 or 2 scars of poor interior décor choices.

name: The Coronation Tap
description:
City: Bristol
description: Low-slung, down to earth historic cider house

name: The Cornubia
description:
City: Bristol
description: Down to earth old fashioned pub stuffed, all wall and ceiling space used, snug rooms, fish tank!

name: The Gate House
description:
City: Norwich
description: Community pub, local life, impressive barn style room, and down to earth seating along a traditional bar.

name: The Palm Tree
description:
City: London
description: Charismatic venue with freestanding bar, sweeping surrounds and moody lowlit evening drinking.

name: Milecastle Inn
description:
City: Haltwhistle
description: Traditional classic freehold pub out in the wilds. An essential stop.

name: The Laurel Inn
description:
City: Robin Hoods Bay
description: Characterful cosy inn with atmospheric looking interior, traditional and authentic.

name: Sa Clau Jazz Club
description:
City: Ciutadella de Menorca
description: Rocky cavern with jazz music and cocktails. Questionable quality of drinks/value.

name: Clachaig Inn
description:
City: Ballachulish
description: Famous traditional Scottish inn, setting of several film scenes.

name: Ruin Bar
description:
City: Tirana
description: Almost self-explanatory. Looks reasonably vintage.

name: Nouvelle Vague Tirana
description:
City: Tirana
description: Colourful garden terrace of a ruin bar bent, with a pleasant inside bar area too.

name: Bunker1944 LOUNGE
description:
City: Tirana
description: Down to earth but colourful basement bar, low ceiling with a living room feel. Retro.

name: Café Heuvel B.V.
description:
City: Amsterdam
description: Characterful lived-in brown café, many framed photos on the wall and a down to earth atmosphere.

name: De Twee Zwaantjes
description:
City: Amsterdam
description: Cosy corner pub known for music sing-alongs, often crowded in the high season but a true brown café inside.

name: De Blaffende Vis
description:
City: Amsterdam
description: The best bar in many cities, here, even in the top 20? Who knows, but either way, a neighbourhood corner pub with an upstairs gallery overlooking framed photos and a plain bar.

name: Café Hegeraad
description:
City: Amsterdam
description: A truly rickety café, wood panels, ancient furniture and a place of character.

name: V.O.F. Café Chaos
description:
City: Amsterdam
description: Essential stop, preserved tiled brown café with a selection of baroque babes on the ceiling, and a focus on the quirky and elderly. A possible 9/10

name: De Blauwe Parade
description:
City: Amsterdam
description: Both cosy lived in brown café and stylish with murals and chandelier.

name: Proeflokaal De Drie Fleschjes
description:
City: Amsterdam
description: Traditional tasting house, characterful little niches, brandywine barrels, jenever and some beer.

name: Café De Gouden Florijn
description:
City: Amsterdam
description: Homely lived in pub with items attached to the ceiling and a cosy trapezoid wooden bar. Potential 9/10

name: Café Eijlders
description:
City: Amsterdam
description: Traditional, well reviewed brown café. Characterful.

name: De Zotte
description:
City: Amsterdam
description: Traditional pub with some alternative touches. Likely the best pub in some towns, here pretty much a neighbourhood makeweight. In a really good way.

name: Café Gruter
description:
City: Amsterdam
description: A mid-brown traditional pub set up for beer drinking in a quiet and cosy environment.

name: Café Berkhout
description:
City: Amsterdam
description: Traditional café, shabby grandeur, plenty in the décor and atmosphere to suggest this is good purely for drinking.

name: Cafe De Pels
description:
City: Amsterdam
description: Down to earth café-bar, a local crowd, looks atmospheric during the evening - but isn't yer usual wood panelled shabby brown café.

name: Proeflokaal In den Uiver
description:
City: Haarlem
description: Traditional and atmospheric jenever tasting house, well reviewed.

name: Nachtwächter
description:
City: Wurzburg
description: Homely, a proper pub, atmospheric and down to earth, characterful lived in décor, appealing to a younger crowd too. Or so it would seem - we haven't visited yet.

name: Schützenbruder
description:
City: Nuremberg
description: Well reviewed, down to earth and cheap. Recommended. No images online other than a promising Zirndorfer sign outside!

name: Mops of Gostenhof
description:
City: Nuremberg
description: Small alternative bar with good draft beer and great reviews. We've been here a few times and it falls under good rather than great.

name: Der Gostenhofer Dorfschulze
description:
City: Nuremberg
description: Alternative bar for young folk in a hipster district. Down to earth and friendly. On a 1st visit it didn't blow the house down but wasn't far off deserving an inclusion.

name: Old Smuggler
description:
City: Seligenstadt
description: Very well reviewed pub with some lived in character and live music. Opens at 7pm til late, closed Sundays

name: Zum Gemalten Haus
description:
City: Frankfurt
description: Traditional apfelwein bar with stained glass and wood.

name: Anglo Irish
description:
City: Frankfurt
description: What looks like a true Irish pub. I don't usually recommend these places but this looks like a good drinking hole anywhere in the world.

name: Mogk's Bierstubb
description:
City: Frankfurt
description: A neighbourhood pub, for local life and character - décor looks decent but not outstanding.

name: Gute Stute
description:
City: Frankfurt
description: Excellent ancient pub, bric-a-brac, walls covered in browning décor and a stuffed horse inside - looks like a 9/10

name: Public - M(e)ain Pub in Griesheim
description:
City: Frankfurt
description: Local's smoking bar with nice seating, odd lime green colouring and quirky title

name: Jazzkeller
description:
City: Frankfurt
description: Famous Jazz cellar bar maintaining the atmosphere, surroundings and live performances.

name: Normalkneipe
description:
City: Frankfurt
description: Atmospheric traditional pub in a British/English style but without trading on that overly.

name: Ha. ! - Ka. ?
description:
City: Frankfurt
description: Grungy neighbourhood pub with games, and amenities galore. Very well reviewed.

name: Le Kaschemm
description:
City: Frankfurt
description: Difficult to tell from the pictures (or lack of) but reviews tell of a classic quaint pub with friendly service.

name: The Blue Bell Inn
description:
City: Workington
description: Simple old fashioned saloon - upholstered seats, dart board, wooden floor and bar area. Well reviewed

name: Three Tuns
description:
City: Whitehaven
description: Rock pub, ungentrified, cosy, real fire and good reviews

name: Castle Inn
description:
City: Kendal
description: A true pub, cosy well shaped room, community feel.

name: The Riflemans Arms - Kendal
description:
City: Kendal
description: The ideal neighbourhood local. Cosy upholstered seating, down to earth interior, pool table, fire, very well reviewed.

name: The Ring O Bells
description:
City: Kendal
description: Characterful preserved bar area, homely down to earth feel like being in someone's house. Well reviewed.

name: Café België
description:
City: Utrecht
description: Brown café from a more restrained hipster-alt angle. Looks like a safe bet for good beer, perhaps a little too inoffensive though?

name: Florin Utrecht
description:
City: Utrecht
description: A pub in English style, ie standing room around a wider bar. Looks characterful and reports of handpulled cask beer?

name: Café Ledig Erf
description:
City: Utrecht
description: Riverside views, beer and chess??, stained glass but not as traditional as you'd think (or like).

name: Schateke
description:
City: Hanover
description: Traditional pub features, looks to be a good option for drinking, not just dining.

name: Gosenschenke "Ohne Bedenken"
description:
City: Leipzig
description: A simple traditional beer hall, ie food on offer, but pub stylings. Essential for Leipzig Gose and very well reviewed.

name: Stoned
description:
City: Leipzig
description: A local institution, rock music, live sports and an Amsterdam style traditional café bar look. Exceptionally well reviewed.

name: Metzer Eck
description:
City: Berlin
description: A quality Gaststatte, ie. a hospoda type affair, that's as much a pub as it is an eating place - a down to earth one at that. A relic with interesting décor and perhaps a good atmosphere in the evenings.

name: Bar Boca
description:
City: Oslo
description: A simple but fairly stylish looking bar with an art deco/slight jazzy feel. Popular.

name: BarBarista
description:
City: Bergen
description: Twee but characterful décor with upturned umbrellas and psychedelic features. It presumably serves beer of some description.

name: Boadas Cocteleria
description:
City: Barcelona
description: Stylish understated wood panelled sweeping bar with framed artwork. Classy and old-time. Cocktails, probably a beer or two at a push.

name: The Confession Box
description:
City: Dublin
description: One of Dublin's historic + well trodden venues. While the small size is quite cute it wasn't overly apparent what the whole fuss was about. Certainly nothing special in terms of decor. Did we miss something?

name: Peruke & Periwig
description:
City: Dublin
description: Cocktail bar with a Dickensian look, very heavily stylised but just the right side of tacky. It didn't quite win us over on our visit but wasn't far from an inclusion.

name: The Ship Inn
description:
City: Dunswell
description: Traditional pre-gentrification pub. Kept and preserved with a cosy atmosphere. Low ceiling, wooden panels. Well reviewed.

name: Bonny Boat
description:
City: Hull
description: Small traditional boozer with a cosy lounge and redolent of Hull's Georgian and Victorian heydays.

name: Old English Gentleman
description:
City: Hull
description: Traditional olde world pub with trad cask ales and a good atmosphere. Well reviewed.

name: Tigh Neachtain
description:
City: Galway
description: Fantastic traditional pub with bookshelves and wood panels. Preserved and as yet ungentrified. Popular though.

name: O'Loclainn's Irish Whiskey Bar
description:
City: Ballyvaughan
description: Bottles lining the back wall, bookshelves and wood panels, Irish folk, cosy atmosphere. Exceptionally well reviewed.

name: O'Riada's
description:
City: Kilkenny
description: Tiny, often crowded, strangely labyrinthine and plastered with local GAA announcements and other such community services. Needless to say, the Guinness is exceptional.

name: M O'Shea
description:
City: Borris
description: The interior of O’Shea’s is basically a museum. Think of it not as drinking, but as cultural enrichment. And thank your lucky stars they didn’t go nuts during the Celtic Tiger and replace it with a superpub.

name: Nancy's
description:
City: Drumbaran
description: Nancy’s has been owned by the McHugh family for seven generations. Eat the smoked mackerel on toast, have a pint, watch the regulars betting on the horses on the big family TV in the front room. Done.

name: Henry Downes
description:
City: Waterford
description: Venerable preserved old boozer with a no-phones policy.

name: Matt Molloy's
description:
City: Cahernamart
description: True character and homeliness, everything you're looking for from a pub.

name: The Lord Edward Bar And Lounge
description:
City: Dublin
description: All good, but try upstairs for the best of it.

name: O'Connell's Bar
description:
City: Galway
description: We can’t put it better than this Yelp reviewer: “Like all pubs of good standing and character, it has a horrifically inefficient lay out. A warren of cubby holes, secret passages, old cookers and confusing signposting. Brilliant.”

name: Morrissey
description:
City: Knocknamoe
description: A classic - black pillars and tarred walls, clutter, no gentrification, and apparently staff wearing lab coats?

name: De Barra's
description:
City: Clonakilty
description: Looks like a good allrounder - characterful bar area, beer garden, live music, not all gentrified yet.

name: Martin B. Slattery
description:
City: Rathmines
description: Crimson paint, down to earth venue, no airs and graces.

name: Railway Tavern
description:
City: Camp Junction
description: AKA O'Neills. Trainsets and memorabilia in a country pub, with great cheer and atmosphere.

name: Roches Pub
description:
City: Donadea
description: Country pub with traditional leather banquettes and cosy rural atmosphere.

name: O'Connor's Famous Pub
description:
City: Galway
description: Lanterns and items fixed to the ceiling, a somewhat studied old-worlde décor but nevertheless an effective one, piano in the bar area to boot.

name: J.J.Hough
description:
City: Banagher
description: Beautiful cosy freehouse pub with comfy seats, live music and local life. Dying breed.

name: Falvey's Pub
description:
City: Dromavally
description: Hard to tell from photos alone, but the write-ups all tell of a terrific old-time Irish pub. The real kind.

name: McCarthys Pub Restaurant and Undertaker
description:
City: Spitalfield
description: Probably the only time you'll have a drink in an undertakers. I expect they do well for Wakes. The reviews all tell of 'stepping back in time', though the furniture in the pictures looks rather more dining-room esque, albeit dark.

name: The Sky and The Ground
description:
City: Whitewell
description: Red banquette seats, retro signs and mirrors, and ancient wood fittings. Also a generic beer garden. Exceptional reviews.

name: McCollam's Public House
description:
City: Ballymena
description: Uncommonly old fashioned pub with a kitchen-diner type performance room for folk music and all around authentic experience.

name: Lucas Bar
description:
City: Ennis
description: Wood panels, a bit of a 'den' feel. Live music. Exceptional reviews.

name: Gaffney's Pub
description:
City: Dublin
description: Neighbourhood drop in pub with live music and no tourists. Down to earth and cosy.

name: Teach Hiudai Beag
description:
City: Bunbeg
description: An authentic Irish pub with live performances, cosy ungentrified décor and real atmosphere.

name: Cronin's Pub
description:
City: Cork
description: Characterful bar area and interesting shape, tasteful art on the wooden panelled walls. Good reviews.

name: Brennan's
description:
City: Drumacrin
description: Change of speed, this one is a drop-in shop. No-nonsense, plain and down to earth for a chat. Simplicity.

name: Lynott's Pub
description:
City: Cashel
description: Local spot in a stone house, corner bar and cosy huddled together

name: Greens Bar
description:
City: Kinvara
description: Looks like a solid spot - atmospheric in the evenings, lots of the typical stuff with little of the b.s

name: GARTLAN'S BAR
description:
City: Lisasturrin
description: Quintessential folk music pub with a small performance room and totally down to earth cosy feel.

name: the seven wonders
description:
City: Fore
description: A quirky local place, simply a drop in, simple homely tables, totally ungentrified, got to be worth a look - what may this be like in the evenings?

name: Frenchs Pub
description:
City: Gorey
description: Tarred fixtures, characterful décor with live music performances, looks like a strong all-rounder.

name: Kölner´s
description:
City: Cologne
description: – exceptionally well reviewed, largely on account of atmosphere, one of those schlager places, perhaps not to everyone's tastes. I visited early afternoon and it was dead, so I'll give it another chance.

name: Einstein
description:
City: Cologne
description: Cheap prices, Einstein themed, possibly past its best but worth a look

name: Das Who's
description:
City: Cologne
description: Neighbourhood dropin pub mixing old and new, v well reviewed. AKA 'Schulz'

name: Heimathirsch
description:
City: Cologne
description: Live jazz and a ramshackle neighbourly feel

name: Alt Neppes
description:
City: Cologne
description: looks like a proper pub – low ceiling, football memorabilia, down to earth feel, wooden panels

name: Kuen
description:
City: Cologne
description: 50s style vintage retro chic pub, a neighbourly down to earth feel, certainly some hipster involvement though

name: Braustelle
description:
City: Cologne
description: Brewpub with amazing reviews and a kitchenette interior – it’s in Ehrenfeld. More modern but looks homely too, perhaps in a retro way

name: The Signal Box Inn
description:
City: Cleethorpes
description: Not every day you drink in a pub that's a converted signal box, probably for good reason. For novelty value however, this must be investigated.

name: The Highwayman Inn
description:
City: Okehampton
description: Looks amazing in design - quirky atmospheric lamplit niches inside, and interest features all-round/

name: Trappistenhuis
description:
City: Ghent
description: A 7/10 on the last occasion but enough there to suggest an upgrade may be possible. Wooden, slavish devotion to Belgian beer ephemera. Arcadia-style décor.

name: Hotsy Totsy
description:
City: Ghent
description: Peculiar atmospheric place with table lamps, a twenties style appearance and a pool table?

name: Minor Swing Slijterij
description:
City: Ghent
description: Jazz bar, with a potential brown café type feel, fairly student from reviews.

name: De Spinnekop
description:
City: Ghent
description: Extremely well reviewed atmospheric traditional pub, sadly apparently closed Fri/Sat/Sun!

name: Carp
description:
City: Ghent
description: Wooden fittings, atmospheric candle lit place, looks like a good all-rounder.

name: Lou's Bar
description:
City: Liege
description: Cramped, atmospheric bar with ephemera on the walls, blues and rum, good beer selection too. Potential.

name: Warzone
description:
City: Liege
description: arcade games, sci-fi movies, great music and glorious beers - sounds good!

name: Café De Wolthoorn
description:
City: Groningen
description: Stunning looking brown café, great reviews, a possible high score!

name: De Pintelier
description:
City: Groningen
description: Brown café with a pub feel. Solid choice with some character.

name: Café Mulder
description:
City: Groningen
description: Well reviewed, especially the 'cosy' element of the pub, though there is live music too and a focus on Jenever.

name: Café de Keyzer
description:
City: Groningen
description: Quirky and fairly unchanged interior with chandeliers and open space among a characterful - in a worn out way - bar area.

name: Café De Toeter
description:
City: Groningen
description: Super brown café, beams, traditional décor and some real character about the place.

name: Eva Pritsky
description:
City: Paris
description: Bar that's a flea market - make a bid for anything you like, and it could be yours. Then turn up next week to find the place looks totally different. A novel idea.

name: The Red Baron
description:
City: Paris
description: Quintessential, down-to-earth and still local wine bar, a neighbourly feel, rows of barrels, bench seating, not glitzy.

name: 10 BAR Odeon
description:
City: Paris
description: Super traditional art nouveau venue in Paris with posters, mirrors etc. Looks good!

name: Wirströms Pub
description:
City: Stockholm
description: Traditional boozer with an irish slant but not obnoxiously so. Has some history about it now. Looks like a safe bet.

name: Stampen
description:
City: Stockholm
description: Fun looking jazz bar, full of antiques and with live performances. Some character by the look of it.

name: Pharmarium
description:
City: Stockholm
description: Quirky yet stylish décor at this cocktail bar. Rugs lining the walls and ceilings, rather exotic feel yet with an art deco style melded in.

name: BLUES BAR, PIJALNIA PIWA TYSKIEGO GOLD FASSL
description:
City: Przemysl
description: Characterful decor, every inch of wall space used, looks cosy and popular, probably a local haunt.

name: The New Inn
description:
City: Coleorton
description: Fabulous looking place - low ceilings, bric-a-brac, community character, ungentrified.

name: The White Swan
description:
City: Sileby
description: Cosy local retaining some traditional features, upholstered seating and an all-round decent place to be, by the looks of things! On CAMRA's national inventory of interiors.

name: In de Verzekering tegen de Grote Dorst
description:
City: Lennik
description: Amazing historic cafe with the best collection of Lambic beers in the world . Open only from 10am-8pm on Sundays

name: KROEGSKE Streekbieren-Eethuis
description:
City: Izegem
description: "Nadine and Danny and their Kroegske café. I will admit that this is one of the hardest bars to find but well worth the search. The dimly lit bar is home to over 450 beers including many vintage cellared beers. There is antique brewerania all around the bar as well as potted plants and candles. It has a very homey feel. They do not allow cigars, pipes, dogs, babies, and pilsner or wheat beer. Children are allowed but only if they are quiet. Kroegske also offers traditional Belgian dishes including some prepared with beer. Kroegske is not open Monday through Wednesday and in the evenings only the other days."

name: L'Amère à boire
description:
City: Brussels
description: Pleasant pubby looking brown cafe attracting a young crowd and a progressive beer menu

name: La Porteuse d'Eau
description:
City: Brussels
description: One of the on-the-radar cool places in Saint Gilles with an interesting central feature. Looks a bit more of a brasserie/estaminet than a bar though.

name: Zoigl Am Eck
description:
City: Waldassen
description: Traditional zoiglhaus with home brew and family kitchen. Visit before they disappear for good. http://zoiglbier.de/zoigltermine/ Check if itll be open

name: Zoiglstube Zum Adler
description:
City: Grafenwohr
description: Homebrew + family pub, a fast-dying tradition. Go now while you still can.

name: Zoiglwirtschaft Zum Posterer
description:
City: Windischeschenbach
description: Home brew in a real family run pub. Go now while you still can. http://zoiglbier.de/zoigltermine/ Check if it'll be open

name: Lingl-Zoigl
description:
City: Windischeschenbach
description: Home brew in a real family run pub, one of the Echter (real) Zoigl pubs open once per month. Check the calendar http://zoiglbier.de/zoigltermine/ 

On our first visit the beer was not too good, but there was some life and atmosphere in the taproom. Not quite enough to tip the balance to a guide entry, but one to be aware of. (Added October 2024)

name: Teicher Zoigl
description:
City: Windischeschenbach
description: Home brew in a real family run pub, a fast-dying tradition. Go now while you still can. http://zoiglbier.de/zoigltermine/ Check if it'll be open

name: Hartwich Zoigl
description:
City: Mitterteich
description: Home brew in a real family run pub, a fast-dying tradition. Go now while you still can.

name: Zoiglstube Lugert
description:
City: Mitterteich
description: Home brew in a real family run pub, a fast-dying tradition. Go now while you still can. http://zoiglbier.de/zoigltermine/ Check if its open

name: Zoiglstube Schwoazhansl Falkenberg
description:
City: Falkenberg
description: Home brew in a real family run pub, a fast-dying tradition. Go now while you still can. http://zoiglbier.de/zoigltermine/ Check if it'll be open

name: Eslarner Zoiglstum
description:
City: Eslarn
description: Home brew in a real family run pub, a fast-dying tradition. Go now while you still can. Refer to the Zoigl Kalendar to ensure it is open on your visit. https://zoiglbier.de/zoigltermine/

name: Manfred Punzmann
description:
City: Windischeschenbach
description: Home brew in a real family run pub, a fast-dying tradition. Go now while you still can. http://zoiglbier.de/zoigltermine/ Check if it'll be open

name: Getränke Oppl
description:
City: Mitterteich
description: Home brew in a real family run pub, a fast-dying tradition. Go now while you still can. http://zoiglbier.de/zoigltermine/ Check if its open

name: Zum Sprea´n
description:
City: Waldsassen
description: Traditional zoiglhaus with home brew and family kitchen. Visit before they disappear for good. http://zoiglbier.de/zoigltermine/ Check if itll be open

name: Mutzi's Zoiglstube
description:
City: Nabburg
description: Home brew in a real family run pub, a fast-dying tradition. Go now while you still can. http://zoiglbier.de/zoigltermine/ Check if it'll be open

name: Zoiglstube Zum Gogerer
description:
City: Flossenburg
description: Traditional family brewhouse - visit while it still exists!

name: Buchwalder Zoiglstub'n
description:
City: Selb
description: Traditional zoiglhaus with home brew and family kitchen. Visit before they disappear for good. http://zoiglbier.de/zoigltermine/ Check if itll be open

name: Tobie Norris
description:
City: Stamford
description: Beams, brickwork, real ale, low ceilings and plenty of character, by the look of it. Recommended by a member of our team.

name: Zeezicht
description:
City: Antwerp
description: Preserved brown café with a pub style layout.

name: 'T Half Souke
description:
City: Antwerp
description: Full on brown café, but unsure if it is still open!

name: 't Fonteintje
description:
City: Kortrijk
description: Popular traditional brown café with a more pub style layout and wider use. Popular, varied crowd

name: Cafe De Penge
description:
City: Turnhout
description: Splendid-looking traditional brown café with the usual features, looks lived-in. 126 years old. And it contains a secret - the first floor houses a transplanted interior of a historic café, which can be visited in Winter months.

name: In Den Spytighen Duvel
description:
City: Turnhout
description: Beer-focused venue but some traditional touches with exposed beams and arches in a historic building.

name: café : de Kluis
description:
City: Halle
description: Lambic focused roadside pub with a traditional interior and down-to-earth atmosphere.

name: In de Linde
description:
City: Dilbeek
description: Something truly traditional and down to earth about the look of this pub, a venerable crowd and cosy, rustic décor.

name: The Merchant's Inn
description:
City: Rugby
description: Superbly decorated barn with traditional ephemera, beams, and amazing beer selection. Seems slightly blandified by some generic signage at the bar, but very well reviewed.

name: Man of Kent
description:
City: Rochester
description: Very well reviewed traditional pub with a great beer selection and what looks like great atmosphere. Historic, lived in, rough around the edges, local and neighbourly. A possible 10/10.

name: The John Bull Inn
description:
City: Alnwick
description: Traditional boozer with surprisingly large Belgian ale selection - ungentrified and slightly quirky venue.

name: Mort Subite
description:
City: Altrincham
description: A step away from traditional pubs to something quite odd. Money lavished on this plush comfortable, candlelit Belgian pub. Most unexpected. Look out for Bier Cell, the off license, next door.

name: Hemelvaart Bier Cafe
description:
City: Ayton
description: Truly outstanding looking place - pub restored into a Belgian brown café with extra space for gigs.

name: Wellington Arms
description:
City: Bedford
description: Clutter-filled traditional pub with some cosy atmosphere and large selection of Belgian ales. Superbly reviewed.

name: The Evening Star
description:
City: Brighton
description: Huge range of ales and an attractive enough almost completely wooden strip interior. Worth a look.

name: The Globe
description:
City: Dunstable
description: The archetypal community pub - ungentrified, characterful and cosy. Apparently a great selection of Belgian ales too.

name: The Anderson
description:
City: Fortrose
description: Traditional pub, a bit of an outpost, some community activities too. Not exactly wild and ungentrified, but a good all-rounder by the look of it.

name: The Old Cross Tavern
description:
City: Hertford
description: Rustic pub with saloon type partitions and stripped back décor. Looks well worth a look.

name: The Red Lion
description:
City: Histon
description: Traditional rustic pub with historic ephemera and breweriana. Fairly open plan but enough going on to feel cosy and characterful.

name: Prince of Wales
description:
City: Ledbury
description: Looks like a nailed on 9 or 10 out of 10 pub. Located in a photogenic cobbled street in the Herefordshire market town, The Prince of Wales is a 16th century pub with a dozen or so Belgian beers, including Zot and Rochefort. Crosshatch beams, tarred wood, all you'd want from a pub.

name: The Malt Shovel Tavern
description:
City: Northampton
description: An ideal destination, traditional pub in a medieval end of town, with real ales and Belgian beer. Very well reviewed.

name: La Caravelle
description:
City: Marseille
description: Characterful rickety bar by the shore, great views and a simple worn-in interior.

name: Cafe Antonius
description:
City: Naantali
description: Interesting antiquey café, possibly with some drinks. Worth a visit for the décor and atmosphere. Some complaints about the service and cleanliness.

name: Rab Ráby Vendéglő
description:
City: Szentendre
description: A restaurant pub but unmissable traditional décor, packed with musical instruments and seats upholstered with sigils and so on. Quirky rather than kitsch.

name: Zetor
description:
City: Helsinki
description: Quirky farm décor, a pub-restaurant but with some areas that are more pub-like.

name: School Pub
description:
City: Kharkiv
description: For those living in or just visiting Kharkiv Schoolpub presents a unique opportunity to feel culturally superior as it is the only pub in Ukraine where speaking any language other than English is strictly forbidden. Looks like a decent down to earth spot with fitted leather seats, pub layout and games.

name: Marshal's Pub & Bar
description:
City: Kharkiv
description: Looks like a safe bet. Minimal design but most of the main pub bases covered. Debate to be had whether there's enough character/atmosphere, but that will be settled by visiting. It's exceptionally well reviewed.

name: Zum Jennerwein
description:
City: Munich
description: Excellent reviews, lively at night, noted for its down-to-earth atmosphere, sensible prices.

name: Stadion an der Schleißheimerstraße
description:
City: Munich
description: Football-den, which may not be your thing but is a quintessential part of German pub life. The place itself is well decorated and looks traditional, down to earth and atmospheric kneipe

name: Holy Home
description:
City: Munich
description: Atmospheric crimson-shady dive bar with a relaxed 30-something crowd and reasonable prices.

name: Brocante Cafe
description:
City: Bruges
description: Bric-a-brac café and antique shop with oddities and quirky design. It was appealing on our 2022 visit but veered more towards café than bar. (Added 2022)

name: De Kelk
description:
City: Bruges
description: An old-fashioned pre-In Bruges destination run by an enthusiast, albeit not an always pleasant one. Narrow bar with upturned barrels.

name: The Crash
description:
City: Bruges
description: Atmospheric looking pub, well-reviewed and a bastion for those who want to listen to rock and metal.

name: Stoker House (T)
description:
City: Bruges
description: Extremely atmospheric looking brown café with a narrow layout and slight brasserie feel. A potential.

name: In De Reisduif
description:
City: Bruges
description: Interesting down to earth brown café, slightly off the tourist track and likely to be quiet and for locals.

name: Au Vieux Spijtigen Duivel Restaurant Estaminet - Cuisine belgo-bruxelloise Bruxelles
description:
City: Uccle
description: Famous traditional surviving brown café/brasserie with rustic décor, but some lost traditions. Still highly recommended, apparently.

name: Clachan Inn
description:
City: Drymen
description: Centuries old country inn, still ungentrified home comforts and a traditional inn, without ladling on the pathos too much.

name: The Royal Standard of England
description:
City: Forty Green
description: One of the oldest pubs in the country, still some character remaining despite the attempts to gentrify it to please the upper-class locals.

name: Rock & Blues Cafe
description:
City: Zaragoza
description: Reasonably put-together bar/pub with decent music-oriented décor and a nice looking environment.

name: Café Iruña
description:
City: Bilbao
description: Ornate tiled décor and just enough facilities to function as a food-focused bar.

name: Street of Crocodiles Pub & Cafe
description:
City: Kraków
description: Another dark ramshackly wooden Kazimierz bar which looks atmospheric. Well reviewed.

name: The Plough
description:
City: Worcester
description: Extremely well reviewed, cosy Fat Cat-style community pub, comfortable lounge seating and totally ungentrified.

name: The Cardinal's Hat Inn & Hotel
description:
City: Worcester
description: Some nice Tudor-like rooms, but other areas gentrified and bland. Worth exploring though, and in an old building.

name: The King Charles House
description:
City: Worcester
description: Tudor beams, low ceiling, cosy and atmospheric. Town-trade though.

name: Oil Basin Brew House
description:
City: Worcester
description: Craft and cask, beer-focused but some nice exposed beams and a sociable place, lively and busy. Reviewed currently exceptionally good.

name: The Mug House
description:
City: Worcester
description: Graveyard-located pub in an old building, characterful and cosy enough interior, retains the genius locii.

name: The Bulls Head
description:
City: Lymm
description: Individual character very much of the traditional pub groove. Ungentrified. Well reviewed.

name: The Phoenix
description:
City: Portsmouth
description: Nicely decorated pub with a theatre crowd and appropriate decor, also beer ephemera. Pool table and ungentrified but tastefully designed.

name: Northcote Hotel
description:
City: Portsmouth
description: A community pub, comfortable upholstered seating, pool, darts etc, well reviewed

name: The Hole In The Wall
description:
City: Portsmouth
description: Seems to fit the bill nicely - decorated beams, cosy surroundings and well-thought through drinks choices. Exceptionally well reviewed.

name: The Eclipse Inn
description:
City: Winchester
description: Reviews tell of a fantastic venue but issues with atmosphere, service, food, value? Make your own mind up, it comes recommended from a friend of mine.

name: The Red Lion
description:
City: Aberdeen
description: Unreconstructed, atmospheric place, small and cosy with interesting bar area and ceiling decor.

name: St. Machar Bar
description:
City: Aberdeen
description: A neighbourhood joint with long upholstered seating opposing the bar area. Small, cosy, and likely characterful.

name: The Bulls Head
description:
City: Stoke-on-Trent
description: Terrific looking community pub, comfortable cosy, pool, darts Titanic beers. Very well reviewed.

name: George Orwell
description:
City: Dundee
description: Bookish decor, as may be expected. Looks cosy, popular and friendly. Well reviewed.

name: Halfway House
description:
City: Edinburgh
description: Another tiny pub, simply a corner bar and upholstered seats around the other 3 sides. On our visit it was decent with good ale selection but didn't quite do enough to tip the balance. (Added February 2024)

name: Applecross Inn
description:
City: Strathcarron
description: Small mid-brown wood panelled bar with comfortable seating. Picturesque setting.

name: Moulin Hotel
description:
City: Moulin
description: Ignore the hotel elements and head straight for the low-ceiling, wood and tarred black pub area for a traditional pub experience, including an on site brewery.

name: The Steamboat Inn
description:
City: Dumfries
description: Genuinely peculiar decor, idyllic location, well reviewed.

name: Toone
description:
City: Brussels
description: Another impasse pub - bar in an old puppet theatre, characterful traditional place with marionettes - looks like a great option.

name: Hummel & Quiddje
description:
City: Hamburg
description: Small, rustic pub in a traditional style.

name: Urknall
description:
City: Hamburg
description: Bookish, studenty pub with a brown café style, affordable drinks.

name: The Hope
description:
City: Carshalton
description: Perennial pub of the year winner, a community pub with timber frame exterior and ungentrified interior, a quintessential England pub. Looks great.

name: The Broken Drum
description:
City: Sidcup
description: A community feel - ungentrified simple room with a focus on drinks. Exceptional reviews.

name: Chesham Arms
description:
City: London
description: Great beer options and great comments regarding the place, wide range of positive reviews. Homely enough interior with fireplace and partions, perhaps a little plain.

name: Eleanor Arms
description:
City: London
description: All elements in place - wood panels, cosy carpeted bar area and fireplace, widely commended. Looks good.

name: The Wenlock Arms
description:
City: London
description: A typical London corner pub with a mind on a preserved traditional interior. Ungentrified, simple, wood and red leather.

name: Speicher
description:
City: Erfurt
description: Interesting fachwerk venue, barn style with live music and atmospheric lighting.

name: Hinkelstein
description:
City: Marburg
description: Smoky traditional cellar bar with rustic hidey-hole atmosphere.

name: Die Schlucke
description:
City: Marburg
description: 'The real pub in Marburg', limited info except the great reviews. Down to earth and student-friendly

name: King's Arms Hotel
description:
City: Askrigg
description: Historic venue, still characterful, cosy and down to earth.

name: George & Dragon
description:
City: Dent
description: Classic pub layout with pool, dartboard, leather upholstered, dark wood, cosy and ungentrified.

name: Angel Inn
description:
City: Alston
description: One of the highest situated pubs in England, traditional and ungentrified, a classic Northern hideaway from harsh weather. Small and cosy.

name: The Black Bull Inn
description:
City: Bishop Auckland
description: Victorian, authentic refurb, food-focused but a large bar area and intact pub feel. Rustic.

name: The Queens Larder
description:
City: London
description: Compact and characterful little pub with preserved features, remaining ungentrified. Good reviews mention excellent friendly service.

name: The King & Queen
description:
City: London
description: Fairer prices, traditional ungentrified dark wood panelled bar and old-school saloon. King and Queen portraits along the wall and a cosy feel.

name: Parazzar
description:
City: Bruges
description: A real pub with a bit of a camp/soul leaning. Dark and brooding, well reviewed, fair prices.

name: Mleczarnia
description:
City: Kraków
description: Another vintage antiquey Kazimierz bar worth a poke at

name: The Quiet Woman
description:
City: Buxton
description: 2021 Update: Potentially now PERMANENTLY CLOSED
Fabulous freehold pub maintained and run by the same chap for decades. No food except pies and snacks, pool table and darts, real fire, an old school establishment.

name: Halʹba
description:
City: Lviv
description: A real pub with nice wooden seats and framed artwork on the walls, purportedly extremely cheap food and a good range of Ukranian beer

name: Flyashka Klyayna
description:
City: Lviv
description: Looks like the most interesting pub so far – cabinets and medicine draws, stained glass bar area and decent pub layout – brilliant reviews

name: Order of Beer
description:
City: Lviv
description: down to earth popular pub

name: Pab 47
description:
City: Lviv
description: underground bar with local brews, modern but decent enough design

name: Libraria
description:
City: Lviv
description: Bookshelves, plenty of wood but fairly new – this place is hidden up a staircase and the other side of a false bookcase

name: Cross Keys Temperance Inn
description:
City: Cautley
description: Cosy old pub with real fire and large armchairs. Relatively ungentrified and family run.

name: Sherlock Holmes Pub
description:
City: Aarhus
description: Almost so chintzy as to be unreal English pub/Victorian themed bar. Well reviewed.

name: Highlanders Bar
description:
City: Aarhus
description: Cosy looking pub with communal tables and upturned barrels. Fairly simple layout but looks like this could get lively with a few people inside it. Well reviewed.

name: Sketch
description:
City: Novi Sad
description: Bookish pub/brown café type affair with shelves, gramophone, tall plans and a sedate feel. Looks like a well-executed concept.

UPDATE: On a visit in 2023 there isn't anything particularly dramatic about this cafe bar other than its reasonably studied pubby appearance. A safe fallback option

name: Lazino Tele
description:
City: Novi Sad
description: A densely decorated night-bar with plenty to look at. We took a visit but it was extremely towny on the nightlife strip. Possibly a Marmite love/hate experience. Not quite worth of the guide (Added May 2023)

name: STEIRERPUB
description:
City: Graz
description: Cellar pub with a slight rock-leaning. Down to earth but not too scratty. On our first visit we aren't fully convinced. It has a Highlander theme but really it's a down and dirty drop in Kneipe. We'll give it another try though.

name: Na 7. schode - pivotéka
description:
City: Zilina
description: A down to earth pivoteka, small and cosy with taps on rotation. Unflashy but seems to be the place to go in town.

name: Barbakan
description:
City: Kiev
description: Hidden-away down to earth pub with an art gallery. Other amenities such as games are on offer. Looks very good.

name: AM Bar
description:
City: Kiev
description: Very small bar with mezzanine floor, exposed brick and generally down to earth.

name: Pinguim Café
description:
City: Porto
description: According to reports: "A classical bar of Porto"s scene, with some cultural background and a certain "leftist" atmosphere. It's a genuine place, anti-fashionable, with a high-light - on Monday's night, the poetry sessions (created by the mythical diseur Joaquim Castro Caldas, and after his ethilic death brilliantly reborn by the "Ruis", which introduced live music in this remarkable literary event). PS: the hot sandwichs are special"

name: Guindalense Football Club
description:
City: Porto
description: Low key Footy themed bar with a terrace boasting terrific outdoor views. Has become a local legend. Unfortunately has been closed on both our visits, but looks good. (Added 2018)

name: Capela Incomum
description:
City: Porto
description: It's a wine bar with a baroque chapel inside. Must be worth a look.

name: Book House/Casa do Livro
description:
City: Porto
description: Brooding atmospheric venue with slanted ceilings, lamplight and antique furniture.

name: Café Lusitano
description:
City: Porto
description: Stylish dark wood bar with impressive bar area, a tasteful spot by the look of it. Modern but in an older style.

name: Pipa Velha
description:
City: Porto
description: Since 1981, a cosy cavern type club with an indie old-world feel. Ungentrified, at least. A comment says:
"t has a cozy atmosphere perfect for a friendly chat or a happy group gathering. For decades it has been been the perfect spot, where different generations cross along, always with the same intention: feel welcome and well served in a special place.

Pipa Velha has a classy decoration, and it is has 3 main room: the entrance hall, the main room with the bar, and the outside on the back, which is open during Summer and closed during Winter. There are vast options to drink but also to snack, which is always pleasant in late night going outs."

name: Enigma
description:
City: Cluj-Napoca
description: “Steampunk” pub. We visited but it was so quiet it was difficult to tell - also the kinetic décor wasn't moving.

name: p'Art One Pub Szczecin
description:
City: Szczecin
description: Interesting looking bunker type pub with varnished wood, dart board and wooden adornments on the walls. Well reviewed.

name: Taverna Cutty Sark
description:
City: Szczecin
description: Potentially really good venue here. A strangely convincing looking sailor's type pub. Dark wood and beams, homely décor. Very good reviews.

name: The Old Fishing Shack Pub
description:
City: Paphos
description: Homely and old fashioned looking pub, perhaps not exactly the kind of thing you'd think of as Cypriot but doesn't seem tacky in any way. Worth a look.

name: Rat Race Ale House
description:
City: Hartlepool
description: Characterful looking micropub. Compact and cosy, surrounded by beer ephemera as décor.

name: Just Beer Micropub
description:
City: Newark
description: Small micropub with dartboard near the entrance and narrow bench seating bar area. Interesting underlit brickwork bar. Quite characterful and exceptionally well reviewed.

name: Conqueror Alehouse
description:
City: Ramsgate
description: Ultimate back-to-basics micropub, an exercise in Luddite pubgoing - perhaps not to everyone's tastes, but may be worth a look?

name: The Just Reproach
description:
City: Deal
description: An atmospheric little micro-pub, one room special, well-decorated, almost like a brown café. New and yet traditional. Looks great.

name: Bake & Alehouse
description:
City: Westgate-on-Sea
description: Traditional micropub, almost like drinking in someone's front room, save for some nice recovered pub signage. Looks excellent.

name: The Door Hinge Ale House
description:
City: Welling
description: No mobiles? Luddites. However the rest of the pub looks good. Cosy, down to earth and miminalist micropub. Interesting stuff.

name: Hail to the Ale
description:
City: Wolverhampton
description: Micropub with a stage. Cosy community-focused venue. Ungentrified and down to earth - looks good. Exceptionally well reviewed.

name: Yard of Ale
description:
City: Broadstairs
description: Micropub in a stone house rather than the more common 70s shopping arcade. Looks cosy and traditional, non-corporate at least. Very well reviewed.

name: Prior's Oven
description:
City: Spalding
description: Remarkable venue for a micropub with octagonal bar and impressive ceiling. Ecclesiastical, suitably.

name: Gas Lamp Lounge
description:
City: Louth
description: Real fire, exposed beams and smallish venue towards being a micropub. Very well reviewed.

name: The Stratford Alehouse
description:
City: Stratford upon Avon
description: One-room micropub. Bar mats stuck to the walls. Small bar and craft cider to boot. Successful formula and very well reviewed.

name: Bald Buzzard
description:
City: Leighton Buzzard
description: Micropub with a brewery association. Looks like a very tidy and characterful place. Very well reviewed.

name: Rutherfords Micropub
description:
City: Kelso
description: Scotland's first micropub, a fairly arbitrary achievement, but nonetheless looks like a characterful place. Red paint, live music, a cosy spot for late night drinks.

name: Arvon Ale House
description:
City: Llandridnod Wells
description: Micropub with a cosy atmosphere and folk music sing-alongs. Looks pretty much like what a pub should be. Supposedly sensible prices.

name: Courtenay's
description:
City: Tiverton
description: Micropub with events and local character. Very well reviewed.

name: The Barrel at Bude
description:
City: Bude
description: Hugely characterful little spot. A micropub with a slightly different layout and local character, very well reviewed.

name: Pilchard Press Alehouse
description:
City: St. Ives
description: Interesting entrance down a little alley, then a minimalist micropub inside with local chitchat and a community feel. A safe haven by all accounts.

name: Boyce's Barrel
description:
City: Colne
description: Micropub with traditional pub/country ephemera. Tasteful and old-time décor, minimalist but characterful. Exceptionally well reviewed.

name: The Barlick Tap
description:
City: Barnoldswick
description: Outstanding reviews for this husband/wife run micropub. Best of European beer on offer and a cosy little space to drink in.

name: The Ale House
description:
City: Clitheroe
description: Almost unsuitably small venue, wooden cabin style walls, local events and popular venue. Very well reviewed. Micropub.

name: The Cobblers Arms
description:
City: Filey
description: Micropub with a solid if not outstanding décor, but uniformly good reviews. Minimalist and for the better. Looks worth a try.

name: The Tailor's Chalk
description:
City: Goole
description: Remarkably tiny micro-pub with red cushioned seats and individual character. Looks well worth a try.

name: Chesterfield Alehouse (Micropub)
description:
City: Chesterfield
description: Minimalist community micropub with some interesting non-traditional beer options. Cosy in terms of size, looks down to earth.

name: Burnt Pig Ale 'Ouse
description:
City: Ilkeston
description: Looks like a cracking traditional pub on a microscale. Incredibly well reviewed.

name: Marlpool Brewing Co.
description:
City: Heanor
description: Looks like an exceptionally executed alehouse concept. Traditional in format and décor, characterfully done, and very well reviewed.

name: Karrusellen
description:
City: Copenhagen
description: Old school Copenhagen 'bodega', with a 1970s pub feel. Renowned for being better value and down to earth. Smokey and raw.

name: Borgerkroen
description:
City: Copenhagen
description: Old school 'Bodega', down to earth lived-in old pub.

name: Wessels Kro
description:
City: Copenhagen
description: Down to earth pub, no glitz or glamour, real people. Dates back over 150 years.

name: Byens Kro
description:
City: Copenhagen
description: Grafitii-strewn dive bar with affordable drinks and cosy no b.s atmosphere. Very smokey.

name: The Moose
description:
City: Copenhagen
description: Characterful locally famous spot for down-to-earth drinking. Alternative sensibility and interesting décor, a tad cheaper than some spots.

name: La Chiesetta
description:
City: Milan
description: Interesting looking bar set in religious building with original features, and central bar area - looks like a pub at the same time.

name: Kiosk der Bergmann Brauerei
description:
City: Dortmund
description: Locally famous and reputed beer kiosk with outdoor seating. A slightly different format and worth a look.

name: Black End
description:
City: Dortmund
description: Vaguely gothic looking bar, well reviewed and alternative in style.

name: The Fiddler
description:
City: The Hague
description: Brown café style but slightly more open plan, leaving the impression of a pub. Looks characterful and has a famous history.

name: Volunteer Arms
description:
City: Dunbar
description: Cosy coastal pub, ungentrified and no-nonsense. Looks very intimate space with wood panelling and low ceilings.

name: Casa Emilio
description:
City: Madrid
description: Tiled exterior, classic Spanish aluminium bar top/lager + tapas set up. Old school

name: La Dolores
description:
City: Madrid
description: A hundred years old, local character. Marbled counter, tiled façade and wooden fittings inside. A historical classic.

name: Arsch & Friedrich
description:
City: Nuremberg
description: Amusingly titled down-to-earth dive. Off-beat sounding, could be interesting.

name: krypt.
description:
City: Vienna
description: Relatively interesting looking subterranean bar. Cocktail-focused but quite characterful with the crypt theme.

name: Pyvnyy Sad
description:
City: Odessa
description: Pub decorated in English style, looks fairly faithful and the focus is on drinking, and a quite social surroundings.

name: PRL Lux
description:
City: Białystok
description: The now commonplace socialist-nostalgia pub. Chequered tablecloths and retro fittings. Well reviewed.

name: ALCHEMIA PUB
description:
City: Białystok
description: Well reviewed rock pub - atmospheric looking and several comments about venetian mirrors in the toilets.

name: La Mécanique des Fluides
description:
City: Toulouse
description: Small bar with mechanical theme (thankfully quite a mild application of that theme) - looks atmospheric, very popular

name: Breughel l'ancien
description:
City: Toulouse
description: Stylish modern place but in a traditional style. Nice warm colours and cosy feel. Well reviewed. Most people sit out on the square in warmer months. Very good beer selection. It didn't quite tip the balance for a full recommendation but is worth bearing in mind. (Added June 2024)

name: Txus
description:
City: Toulouse
description: One of the more characterful places in the city. Cluttered, tiny and alternative. Well reviewed.

name: Bar L'Autan
description:
City: Toulouse
description: One of the funkier bits of décor in Toulouse. Dark, twisty design. Worth a look, surely.

name: Hasenstall
description:
City: Linz
description: Rabbit-hutch. A small down to earth pub. Plenty of wood, table football. Simple and popular.

name: Dworek Artystyczny
description:
City: Opole
description: Atmospheric pub with occasional live music. Chunky wooden seats and cosy surroundings in a historic building.

name: Biała Dama Multipub
description:
City: Swidnica
description: Craft beer in a medieval cellar, combining the old and the new. Very well reviewed, so just depends on if there's any atmosphere...

name: Tristeza
description:
City: Berlin
description: Punk pub with a legacy.

name: Zum Tönnchen
description:
City: Berlin
description: Retro kneipe a la 1975 - however friendly, local and popular.

name: Bierhaus Sunrise
description:
City: Berlin
description: A coherent pub layout, plenty of wood. A cosy, ungentrified venue

name: Alter Roter Löwe Rein
description:
City: Berlin
description: Arch-trad kneipe, almost like a German version of Sam Smiths in its simplicity. Worth a try.

name: B-Lage
description:
City: Berlin
description: Brooding shady venue with alt/left-leaning style and an underground reputation.

name: Laika
description:
City: Berlin
description: Classic trad/alt/student/left pub.

name: BruchBerg Bar
description:
City: Berlin
description: Boudoir neighbourhood bar with Belgian ales. Less touristy, well-regarded.

name: Mahlower Klause
description:
City: Berlin
description: A truly down to earth smokey local's pub with an older crowd. Where to go to find the real district.

name: Königs Fritze
description:
City: Frankfurt an der Oder
description: The archetypal neighbourhood kneipe.

name: Comicaze
description:
City: Cottbus
description: A down and dirty pub with live music, near universally well reviewed.

name: Urpiner Pub
description:
City: Bratislava
description: A solid small pub with the Urpiner range on tap – a bit of local life too. On our first visit we thought it deserved a 7/10 but didn't quite make the grade, likewise 2nd time around. Worth having up your sleeve though.

name: Hostinec U Justína
description:
City: Bratislava
description: a bit out of town but the ‘last old school Bratislava pub’, so they say

name: Le Petit Bougnat
description:
City: Liege
description: cosy, atmospheric café with high ceiling/mural (opens 5.30) – beyond the normal pub

name: Aux Olivettes
description:
City: Liege
description: historic 60s café with piano sing-alongs - perhaps not everyone's cup of tea, but supposedly an institution

name: La Cuve à bière
description:
City: Liege
description: looks like a decent pub

name: Le Vaudrée 1
description:
City: Liege
description: large pub, and the local ‘classic’ - however mediocre reviews suggest this may have peaked?

name: Le Lion D'Or
description:
City: Liege
description: red leather, traditional tables, perhaps a café brasserie feel to a point - we shall see if it is pubby enough

name: Café-Zaal 't Kölke
description:
City: Maastricht
description: a superb looking brown café with some pub elements thrown in

name: Im alten Zollhaus
description:
City: Aachen
description: A typical traditional German bierhalle, though time will tell if it has atmosphere or character worth writing home about.

name: Kapellchen
description:
City: Aachen
description: Traditional wooden bierstube - very well reviewed and looks like a nice option.

name: Am Knipp
description:
City: Aachen
description: Although predominantly for food, the amazing tiled décor and space at the bar for a drink make this a potential candidate. Supposedly the oldest pub in Aachen

name: Uwe Klein Qutoqi Bar
description:
City: Aachen
description: Live music, sometimes dance performances, otherwise a downtempo alt bar with interest drinks choices, so it says.

name: Meisenfrei
description:
City: Aachen
description: Board games and Belgian ales

name: Hotel Europa
description:
City: Aachen
description: Retro-furniture and brooding red lights. A club downstairs but free bar area. Looks quite good. Well reviewed.

name: Schlüsselloch
description:
City: Aachen
description: Trad Rock-pub of local renown. Worth a look for the atmosphere, and some live shows. Reportedly good for an "after work" pint - no fassbiere, only bottles

name: Café De Knijnspiep
description:
City: Maastricht
description: superb old brown café - looks characterful

name: Café Hallo Mestreeg
description:
City: Maastricht
description: brown café with framed artwork, upturned barrels and plenty of wood

name: Café In Den Ouden Vogelstruys
description:
City: Maastricht
description: brown café with a restaurant slant, but the interior looks legit, reportedly the oldest in maastricht

name: Alt Bremerhaven
description:
City: Bremerhaven
description: A suitably old-time pub with wooden fitting and lamps, looks atmospheric and a solid choice.

name: Die Gartenlaube
description:
City: Bremerhaven
description: Looks like a charming old pub, long established and great feedback regarding service and atmosphere.

name: Gaststätte Stresemann Silke Behr-Hempel
description:
City: Bremerhaven
description: Cosy quaint corner bar with friendly service - looks very promising.

name: Bull's Head
description:
City: Glossop
description: Historic building, stooped ceiling and cosy bar area. The kind of character you can't create from scratch - don't expect food without making a booking though.

name: Ex Salumeria
description:
City: Naples
description: Atmospheric looking bar focused on rum based cocktails. Barrels fixed to the walls and a stowaway type vibe.

name: Il Birraiuolo - Craft Beer Bar
description:
City: Naples
description: Good beer without the cookie-cutter craft branding rubbish? Seemingly. This is a cosy narrow bar with a shelf full of beers and a few taps. Upturned barrels and a small backroom. Worth a look, surely?

name: "Vinyl" Kneipe Zittau
description:
City: Zittau
description: Vinyl records, jazz instruments as décor, and a retro kitsch style. Supposedly kind, inexpensive and the place to be in the city.

name: Im Alten Gässchen
description:
City: Bielefeld
description: Reports of an old, yet tiny kneipe, perhaps the smallest in Bielefeld. No kitchen, just pils traditionally tapped, and a tapster cum racounteur owner.

name: Potemkin
description:
City: Bielefeld
description: Very well reviewed venue popular with punkrockers - alternative type venue with some trad fittings and a beer garden. Looks to have potential. But we shall see..

name: König-City
description:
City: Duisburg
description: Apparently a chain but some stylish features in this pub, with a round bar area, interesting light fittings and dark wood. Well reviewed

name: The café designed by Eckart Graefen
description:
City: Duisburg
description: Individual alternative pub with messy décor and a crowd of locals. Antiquey furniture and cluttered look. A long standing local institution.

name: König-Haus
description:
City: Duisburg
description: Institution from the 1970s, a gaststatte/pub serving pub grub and traditional pils. Looks characterful and has a host of good reviews. Will it be too food focused though?

name: Bierlokaal Locus Publicus
description:
City: Rotterdam
description: A quintessential brown café with all of the features and ambience that involves. Very much looking forward to coming here.

name: Boudewijn
description:
City: Rotterdam
description: Relatively atmospheric looking bar with fairy lights, plenty of Belgian ales and mezzanine section at the back

name: Melief Bender
description:
City: Rotterdam
description: Old-time bar, one of the oldest in the city. Warm welcome, and very well review. Excited to visit this place.

name: Proeflokaal De Riddert
description:
City: Rotterdam
description: Superb brooding pub/tasting room. Uniformly well reviewed - old fashioned and a rarity in Rotterdam vs. Amsterdam

name: Rijke & de Wit
description:
City: Rotterdam
description: Slightly modernised but character still intact at this airy but narrow bar.

name: Stadsbrouwerij De Pelgrim
description:
City: Rotterdam
description: Brewery tap and also nice traditional pub with a vague seafaring theme. Has a similar appearance to many east coast English pubs.

name: Café de Oude Sluis
description:
City: Rotterdam
description: Hugely character appearance. Classic brown café décor with wood carvings, glass panels and the sense of history seeping from the walls. Not to mention a beautiful terrace.

name: Tapperij Vanouds 't Kraantje
description:
City: Rotterdam
description: Another superbly preserved brown café with a long bar area, pool table and plenty of beer ephemera. Excellent choices of drinks, and a pub you'd die to have on your corner.

name: Café de Bel
description:
City: Rotterdam
description: A brown café that has leaned towards being a music bar - interesting décor and instruments hung on the wall, great reviews and a pool table?

name: Café Verschoor
description:
City: Rotterdam
description: An authentic brown café in purpose and appearance. Cosy, creative decorations, neighbourhood crowd. The interior has a maritime theme, with steering wheels, ship bells, nautical paintings and exotic overseas souvenirs. It is as if you are in a museum.

name: Proeflokaal Faas
description:
City: Rotterdam
description: Plenty of wood and character in what is an airy corner pub. Local crowd, and apparently excellent beer selection

name: Café De Postbank
description:
City: Rotterdam
description: An institution in this area of the city. Short on details but there is a multi-angled bar area and darts/billiards, and a host of fantastic reviews.

name: Café De Tagrijn
description:
City: Zwolle
description: Intact brown café with live music and some cosier features

name: Café De Hetebrij
description:
City: Zwolle
description: Award winning brown café with a range of framed artwork, vaulted beams and of course, excellent beer.

name: In de Blaauwe Hand
description:
City: Nijmegen
description: Brown café with a town house style layout, wooden stairs, but nice pub touches like leaning posts, inset tables and so on. Looks great.

name: Café Jos Meesterschenkerij
description:
City: Nijmegen
description: Super coherent brown café stylings, but fundamentally a well done pub. Excellent reviews - very much looking forward to visiting.

name: Café St Anneke
description:
City: Nijmegen
description: A recent refit but arranged in brown café style. Looks interesting and certainly very pubby. Interesting to see if there's enough character there.

name: 't Floere Foefke
description:
City: Ghent
description: Looks like a down to earth corner pub with some  brown café features. Off the tourist trail.

name: Kutak
description:
City: Banja Luka
description: Interesting looking bar, by Yugoslavian standards. Antique objects, local life. Well reviewed.

name: Dikkenek Café
description:
City: Lyon
description: Belgium beer, happy hour between 6-9pm, wooden furniture. Not the ultimate brown café exactly but looks like a decent option.

name: Overcraft Café
description:
City: Lyon
description: Gaming café but with an interesting historic layout. Looks intriguing and is very well reviewed.

name: Betty's Bar
description:
City: Lyon
description: Cosy little bar caught between US style/Belgian style. Looks like a fun friendly hangout spot.

name: Les Clameurs, bar fédératif
description:
City: Lyon
description: Left leaning bar with token membership fee. Looks friendly, ramshackle and full of events as these places tend to be.

name: AFK Bar
description:
City: Lyon
description: Neighbourhood pub with a nice pub atmosphere downstairs, and games/TV upstairs. Plenty of bases covered but in a down-to-earth and non-corporate way.

name: L'Atenium
description:
City: Lyon
description: Plain décor but excellent reviews in this 'boardgame and chat' locals pub where it's apparently very easy to meet new people.

name: The Golden Fleece
description:
City: York
description: A historic pub with coherent fixtures and fittings, sympathetically furnished. However, is this spoilt by the churn of pub food + tacky additions?

name: Schankwirtschaft Marlene
description:
City: Wuppertal
description: A very individual pub with lived-in décor and that peculiar Germanic cross between the quaint and the macabre. Looks very interesting.

name: King's Head Pub
description:
City: Wuppertal
description: Does a good English pub turn into a bad one if it's in Germany? We don't know the full answer to that but this looks great. Homely, lived-in, plenty of events, drinks and food. Not done in a tacky way.

name: Wirtschaftswunder
description:
City: Wuppertal
description: Ein Kneipe mit Charakter! - so the reviews mainly say. It must have something extra when you visit in person - atmosphere, perhaps. Lots of amenities with live music, table football, pub quiz etc, and clearly a community, neighbourly feel.

name: ANNO - the nostalgia pub
description:
City: Wuppertal
description: Your cosy, characterful kneipe from times past. Need to visit in person to find out if this is well done, but the style befits a quality traditional pub.

name: Brand Bar
description:
City: Varna
description: Craft beer, cocktails and so forth in a pleasingly retro environment with old TV, bookcases and balcony level. Looks like a potential addition. Very well reviewed.

name: Friends Pub
description:
City: Varna
description: Basement level has a cosy and very interesting design incorporating the natural stone with some stylish wooden trips. Looks like a good all rounder in other categories, aside perhaps price.

name: Indian Bar
description:
City: Varna
description:

name: Incognito
description:
City: Debrecen
description: Community pub with live events and late opening hours. May charge a small sum on the door.

name: Mob
description:
City: Debrecen
description: Serving local Debreczeni Sor for very competitive prices, this place offers simple bench seating and a slice of local life. Popular in evenings. Some work to do before it merits an inclusion.

name: Pivnica Semizburg
description:
City: Sarajevo
description: craft ales and cosy pub. 10 bosnian beers on tap – incredible reviews

name: Đet Set
description:
City: Mostar
description: interesting two storey bar with distinctive antiquey lounge décor and a few steps ahead of the usual café bar crowd

name: OKC Abrašević
description:
City: Mostar
description: alternative concerts and art events, ethically focused on ethnic reintegration and anti-nationalism

name: On The Road
description:
City: Thessaloniki
description: Nautical wood panelling and a surprisingly pub-like atmosphere for this part of the world - well reviewed - it may work out to be worthy of contention.

name: The Hoppy Pub
description:
City: Thessaloniki
description: Sells every type of beer under the sun and has a recognisable pub layout - need to explore whether it has the atmosphere to elevate it.

name: Berlin bar
description:
City: Thessaloniki
description: A famous late bar inspired by the bars of Kreuzberg and Neukolln in Berlin. Atmosphere and ambience is all important however, this could go very badly.

name: Birreria Accademia
description:
City: Bergamo
description:

name: Variokas
description:
City: Vilnius
description:

name: The Bay Horse
description:
City: Burythorpe
description: Slightly too food oriented but the pub interior has an old fashioned Yorkshire feel, simple and rural.

name: Three Stags Heads Inn
description:
City: Wardlow
description: Characterful free house pub with a taxidermy-slanted decor, low stooping doorways and a historic building. Very well regarded.

name: The Olde Ship Inn
description:
City: Seahouses
description: Ignore the hotel + food elements and head to the bar, a truly characterful old place stuffed with nik naks and with a truly enjoyable atmosphere.

name: Atomic Garden
description:
City: Palma di Mallorca
description: Well reviewed bar with eclectic decor and an off-beat, if still fairly hip theme. Craft beer to keep things interesting surrounded by the bland tapas bars with 1 awful lager choice.

name: Guirigall
description:
City: Palma di Mallorca
description: Beer oriented bar decorated with Belgian beer ephemera but featuring brews from all over. Down to earth and for now unpretentious, it looks like a nice space.

name: The Boat Inn
description:
City: Penallt
description: Beautiful riverside pub with simple rural furniture and exposed beams inside.

name: Hole In The Wall
description:
City: Bodmin
description: Beautiful timberframe interior with pewter jugs hanging from the beams. An old school ungentrified venue

name: Admiral Benbow
description:
City: Bodmin
description: A one-off, pub/restaurant situated in what appears a ships galley. Quirky and unique.

name: Kings Head
description:
City: Bristol
description: Beautiful and well preserved pub with a narrow bar, characterful venue.

name: The Merchants Arms
description:
City: Bristol
description: Neighbourly boozer with a community feel - very well reviewed.

name: The Plough Inn
description:
City: Bristol
description: Characterful little spot with live music but plenty to keep you occupied when that isn't on. Lived in and with a distinct identity - this looks like the kind of thing worthy of our attention.

name: Paraíso perdido
description:
City: Santiago de Compostela
description: Trinkety cafe bar with cosy atmosphere and individual character

name: The Blisland Inn
description:
City: Blisland
description: Characterful country pub of a distinctive, not gentrified quality.

name: The Little Prince
description:
City: Margate
description: Another 'tiny pub' this one is one small taproom in an arcade, but it looks like a characterful effort

name: The Ship Inn
description:
City: Porthleven
description: A lived-in pub worn in with plenty of character. Well-reputed

name: The Nursery Inn
description:
City: Stockport
description: Interesting floor patterns and cabin style bar hatch. Stylish + distinctive

name: The Ship Inn
description:
City: Alnwick
description: Unvarnished wooden benches and simple seating, exposed beams and classic pub character. As yet ungentrified

name: Lamb Hotel
description:
City: Eccles
description: Victorian fittings and ornate elements, with cosy neighbourhood lounge rooms too. A Holt's pub and so there are some tacky elements although good value for money. It was close to an inclusion on our first visit in December 2022 but I think it would warrant another go at a different time of day to be sure.

name: The Drewe Arms
description:
City: Drewsteignton
description: While food-focused, the historic buildings character remains on the inside, while the decor brings a home kitchen vibe that looks authentic rather than contrived

name: Duke Of York Wink
description:
City: Winkleigh
description: Ignore the hotel and bedroom photos - look at the bar area. A superb bunker-like pub strewn with decor and 'lived-in'. Simple unvarnished tables in the side room.

name: Dyffryn Arms
description:
City: Fishguard
description: A one-off operation. No bar, just a serving hatch, some cafe + pub decor spilling into each other. A venerable server and owner. Living room style lounge. They really don't make them like this any more.

name: Rose & Crown
description:
City: Ludlow
description: An archetypal English town-centre pub. Exposed beams, rows of bench seats, and some fairly impress feature lighting at the bar. As usual, slightly diluted/baffled by modern touches and food service.

name: The Nelson Inn
description:
City: Ludlow
description: 'Quirky' pub that falls into the 'proper boozer' category. Unsure whether it will make the grade but worth a look.

name: Dewdrop Public House
description:
City: Ilkeston
description: Down to earth boozer from the old-school, locally known for its cheese and onion cobs + real ales. A dying breed.

name: Drapers Arms
description:
City: Bristol
description: Micro-pub with a cast of regulars and well-reviewed beers and ciders. Looks homely and down to earth.

name: La Taverne du Westhoek
description:
City: Quaedypre
description: Beautiful traditional tavern with exposed beams, pewter jugs, open fire and grill, plenty of beers.

name: LA TAVERNE PAILLETTE
description:
City: Le Havre
description:

name: Majestic Café
description:
City: Porto
description: Art Nouveau styled cafe, elegant and grand. Unsure on the alcohol options but is not taken over with food.

name: Café Américain
description:
City: Amsterdam
description: A different thing from the brown cafes. Huge grand curved ceilings and unique style. An open plan central bar for cocktails.
