name: Taverne Saint-Géry
description:
City: Aubechies-Beloieil
description: Beautiful pub in a farmstead building. Rustic with a charming cluttered feel, this is rural Belgium

name: Shahrzad
description:
City: La Spezia
description: Peculiar and very interesting looking pub with dark wood and walls festooned with instruments and nik-naks. We could not find it on our visit.

name: Bar Piccolo Mondo
description:
City: Genoa
description: Cult pub that opens very late (10pm), short on info

name: One Eyed Jacks
description:
City: Genoa
description: Twin Peaks themed pub with boudoir type decor + burgers. Opens 6pm.

name: Old Troll's Pub
description:
City: Genoa
description: Beer + music focused pub, down to earth and friendly looking. Well reviewed

name: Fitz
description:
City: Genoa
description: A beer focused pub with a young crowd and port-like flair. Opens from 7pm

name: Birreria Taverna di Paola
description:
City: Brescia
description: Beautiful venue with brown and gold pub hues and a true beer focus.

name: The Jovial Sailor
description:
City: Carlisle
description: Quirky name and big signage, a cult local pub, v well reviewed.

name: Lamus
description:
City: Wroclaw
description: Good drinks selection, Czech and Polish and atmospheric railway arch venue with exposed brick. Looks pretty good.

name: Taberna Can Margarit
description:
City: Barcelona
description: Old fashioned taberna with wooden seating. While not drinks focused there is a certain heritage here that might warrant an inclusion.

name: The Last Post, Derby
description:
City: Derby
description: Characterful little pub - micro-pub style. Lived in, some individual character. Great reviews.

name: The Bulls Head
description:
City: Solihull
description: Country pub with a retained lived in feel and attractive beer garden. While some elements appear to have been gentrified, the bar area and its offerings stay pretty old-school.

name: Taberna La Carmencita
description:
City: Madrid
description: Tiled taberna, set up for food at various points of the day (this is Spain) but a social pub like element grows as the evening progresses.

name: The Oddfellows Arms
description:
City: Falmouth
description: Another to file under 'proper pub'. Wooden bench seating, trad bar with darts and pool.

name: The Punch Bowl & Ladle
description:
City: Truro
description: A classic thatched cottage country pub with rustic furniture and warm hues. Unspoilt and well reviewed.

name: The Royal Oak
description:
City: London
description: Simple pub with victorian fixtures, looks a cut above due to the stripped back nature of its offering, which distinguishes it from usual chain fare.

name: The Stag Inn
description:
City: Dufton
description: Country inn - positively reviewed, cosy furnishings. Unsure to what extent it veers over into dining rooms but be warned that they will not serve food on-spec to anyone who arrives. On Fri/Sat/Sun you will need to book ahead.

name: Kirkstile Inn
description:
City: Cockermouth
description: Beautiful setting and a historic farmhouse that is still pub rather than dining room. Stone walls and wooden beams, simple fare and good value.

name: The Bear at Hotwells
description:
City: Bristol
description: Truly old fashioned boozer with simple frontage and a bar facing the entrance. A small-time institution.

name: The Bull - Beaumaris
description:
City: Beaumaris
description: Trying to have its cake and eat it. Old fashioned pub out front bears little relation to the gentrified bland dining room at the back.

name: Penllwyndu
description:
City: Llangoedmor
description: An isolated pub with great reviews, seemingly a good sense of community. Unspoilt inside.

name: Harbour Inn Southwold
description:
City: Southwold
description: Ignore the dining room and head to the bar room with wooden furniture, tiled floor and decent pub atmosphere. An Adnam's pub, of course.

name: Hed'On Inn
description:
City: Hedon
description: Micro-pub. Simple format, good drinks, community atmosphere. Very well reviewed.

name: New Rock Vallée
description:
City: Brussels
description: A brown cafe and simple pub with a neighbourly unpretentious feel.

name: supra bailly
description:
City: Brussels
description: Interesting bar with some character, brown cafe features rather than being a full blown historic place. Well reviewed.

name: La Pharmacie Anglaise
description:
City: Brussels
description: Cocktail bar with large wood pannelled first floor balcony. Looks stylish and is well reviewed.

name: La Closerie Des Lilas
description:
City: Paris
description: Interesting historic cafe bar.

name: Jama Michalika
description:
City: Kraków
description: A highly styled cafe restaurant. Tavern like in places, drawing room like in others.

name: Beveren
description:
City: Antwerp
description: 50s style cafe bar with large Wurlitzer - not what you expect from the trad exterior! A colourful change of scenery and great beer selection.

name: Café Bruintje
description:
City: Alkmaar
description: Looks a potential 9/10. Exceptionally put together brown cafe.

name: Proeflokaal de Boom
description:
City: Alkmaar
description: Wonderful looking cafe bar with cream painted wooden panels, and historic features.

name: Proeflokaal De Kleine Deugniet
description:
City: Alkmaar
description: Not so much historic feature, but looks like a solid choice with a very good drinks selection.

name: Café 't Kooltuintje
description:
City: Almaar
description: A 'proper pub'. Some brown cafe features but plenty of space for darts and other more recognisably contemporary pub stuff. Working class, by the look of it.

name: Café De Beugel
description:
City: Arnhem
description: Narrow bar with lamp light wooden bar area. Beer focused.

name: Café 't Moortgat
description:
City: Arnhem
description: Looks like the most 'pub like' pub in Arnhem. Pool table, beer ephemera, cosy surroundings. Plenty of wood.

name: Heeren Van Aemstel Arnhem
description:
City: Arnhem
description: Wonderfully characterful looking cafe bar with trinkets hung from the beams, wooden floor and elegant brass light fittings and table rims. Looks great.

name: Cafe de schoof
description:
City: Arnhem
description: Well designed bar set up for later drinking fun. Cosy and characterful.

name: The Cavern Café
description:
City: Arnhem
description: Basement bar with curved brick ceiling. Small and cosy. Looks like a local institution.

name: Unibar
description:
City: Arnhem
description: Drab name, but one of the closest things to a brown cafe around here. Lovely homely furnishings and cosy surroundings.

name: Café Het Bolwerk
description:
City: Enschede
description: Beautiful cosy brown cafe with funky light fitting over the bar, and plenty of wood.

name: Proeflokaal België
description:
City: Enschede
description: Reasonably historic and venerable looking operation. Well reviewed, and of course Belgium beers.

name: Cafe Old Pub
description:
City: Emmen
description: It does what it says on the tin. 70s style decor, crimson paint, ceiling tiles and a working class atmosphere inside. Provincial and neighbourly.

name: Café De drie Paardjes
description:
City: Emmen
description: A long room with framed artwork and brown cafe type wooden tables. Popular and well reviewed.

name: Café Bar le Duc
description:
City: s'Hertogenbosch
description: Small old pub with naval decor and an attached brewery operations. Looks characterful to say the least.

name: Stadscafe de Basiliek
description:
City: s'Hertogenbosch
description: Quirky pub-bar with a bit of clutter and character. Well reviewed.

name: Café 't Bonte Palet
description:
City: s'Hertogenbosch
description: Old fashioned little pub with bags of character and what little wall space there is crammed with stuff. One of those pubs you hope to find everywhere in Netherlands.

name: De Graven van Leuven
description:
City: s'Hertogenbosch
description: Good pics slightly thin on the ground but this appears to be a good option for those seeking a proper dutch pub and decent all-rounder. Well reviewed.

name: Beyerd Café-Restaurant-Brouwerij De Beyerd
description:
City: Breda
description: Wonderful old-school establishment. Faded brown cafe with some 70s stylings. A local institution.

name: De Vriendin Eten en Drinken
description:
City: Breda
description: A pub with a long wooden row opposite the bar with small tables along it. Chandeliers, looks fairly characterful and could be an interesting one to try.

name: 't Tapperijke
description:
City: Breda
description: Trad dutch tavern in the dead centre, and in a historic building.

name: Het Nieuws Van Apeldoorn
description:
City: Apeldoorn
description: While the seat layout and use of space could be better, it looks like there are some areas of character and it is a wooden brown cafe

name: Café Restaurant De Posthoorn
description:
City: Epe
description: While this place does do food, the decor and atmosphere is close enough to your usual wooden trad Dutch pub.

name: Proef-Locaal Het Achterom
description:
City: Apeldoorn
description: A tasting house with - from appearances - that format. A central tasting table with smaller tables surrounding it, a living room type atmosphere.

name: de Grolschbar
description:
City: Apeldoorn
description: Self-identifies as a brown cafe. Details are thin on the ground but it looks like a noble effort at a community neighbourhood boozer.

name: café de Vrijheid
description:
City: Dordrecht
description: A small pub that seems to be a concentrated expression of working class pub culture. Cosy with brown cafe features, but also pub amenities. Cluttered decor.

name: Café Weemoed
description:
City: Tilburg
description: 'Melancholy'. The central brown cafe.

name: Stoffel
description:
City: Tilburg
description: Typical historic brown cafe with an angular layout, wood panels, hooks and brown old wallpaper.

name: 't Buitenbeentje
description:
City: Tilburg
description: Characterful venue with glass panels above the bar. A local institution with 'fair' prices, purportedly.

name: Café Kandinsky
description:
City: Tilburg
description: A true Dutch/Flemish style corner pub. Typical decor and atmosphere. Well reviewed.

name: Cafe Brandpunt
description:
City: Tilburg
description: A stylish bar with red walls, large wooden fittings and seemingly plenty of space. Some traditional stylings in places.

name: Café de Strohoed
description:
City: Leeuwarden
description: Well reviewed brown cafe with extensive beer menu - pictures are mainly from night time, so difficult to tell the quality of decor.

name: Bierhuis Lampie
description:
City: Leeuwarden
description: Possibly a hidden gem. Living room style brown cafe  - old school style. Great reviews. "‘Small and cosy like the living room of a single man on age’ is how the local newspaper (LC) once described the atmosphere in this pub. The light above the door, with the Amstel beer logo and the word lampie (small light), gives away that this is not just a regular house. Since the 1920′s, this place has been the local pub for people in the neighbourhood. In those years, it was the place for rough sailors and labourers who liked to drink and sometimes even got paid in the pub. Those times are long gone, but some of those customers are still there. It makes Bierhuis Lampie one of those local pubs that you just have to visit once. You can find it just outside the canals that surround the inner city. Location: Oostersingel 32, Open: Monday – Saturday 16:00 – 0:00"

name: Het Wapen van Leeuwarden
description:
City: Leeuwarden
description: A more towny brasserie type pub, with traditional leather fittings, plenty of wood and interesting glass panel lights.

name: Speciaalbier Café De Markies
description:
City: Leeuwarden
description: Beer focused, of course, but a simple wooden cafe pub in the regional style. Highly reviewed too.

name: Café 't Lieverdje
description:
City: Leeuwarden
description: A little brown cafe, another well reviewed one. Distinct details thin on the ground, but worth a look.

name: Doele Bar
description:
City: Leeuwarden
description: Saloon style pub with painted wood, retro signage and large wooden beams. Looks a fun, atmospheric venue.

name: Café Bar de Welp
description:
City: Reduzum
description: Another one with limited info but great reviews. Sometimes these small town cafes have to be attempted.

name: Herberg 't Plein
description:
City: Meppel
description: A town pub, when you look at the unusually spacious layout, but fairly lived in and characterful, certainly worth a look.

name: Janscafe
description:
City: Meppel
description: A little brown cafe with an attractive central bar. Well reviewed.

name: Café De Toeter
description:
City: Groningen
description: Highly attractive looking brown cafe

name: Café Marktzicht
description:
City: Drachten
description: A true brown cafe, with two floors. Looks great. They clearly know what they're doing.

name: Café Lobbes
description:
City: Amersfoort
description: A brown cafe with some quirky touches, a popular local option. Extensive beer choice.

name: Kafe van Zanten
description:
City: Amersfoort
description: While the fixtures may be relatively new, it is already acquiring character with light brown bench seating and a quarter circle bar. Looks cosy.

name: Café De Kersenbaan
description:
City: Amersfoort
description: A neighbourhood brown cafe with pool table. Popular and well reviewed.

name: Sint John
description:
City: Middelburg
description: While set up for coffee and cake during the day, the ancient decor and furniture and beer options (yes!) make this of immediate interest.

name: De Vliegende Hollander
description:
City: Middelburg
description: Slightly different appearance. While wooden, there is a sort of artificially aged, crimson red hue, but the rest of the pub seems to be in order in terms of our criteria for a trad Dutch place.

name: Café 't Fust
description:
City: Middelburg
description: Cosy brown cafe with a young/alt crowd.

name: Café-Biljart "De Concurrent"
description:
City: Vlissingen
description: Fab looking cluttery brown cafe. Old wood, local atmosphere. Lived -in character. Excited to visit it.

name: Cafe Hoppit
description:
City: Vlissingen
description: Small cosy brown cafe of local renown, fair prices mentioned too.

name: Café "Vanuus"
description:
City: Vlissingen
description: Another well rated bar in trad style.

name: Café 't Archief
description:
City: Vlissingen
description: Characterful pub-cafe with pool table and old brown-cafe style furniture, on or two distinctive touches too.

name: Les Vedettes
description:
City: Bergen op Zoom
description: Artsy little pub with an alternative crowd.

name: Biercafé 't Locomotiefke
description:
City: Bergen op Zoom
description: Central pub with a high beamed ceiling, chandeliers and large bar area. Looks reasonably characterful.

name: Café de Schorre
description:
City: Bergen op Zoom
description:

name: Café De Drie Weesgegroetjes
description:
City: Roosendaal
description: Extraordinary pub adorned with religious iconography. A stand-out.

name: Cafeetje Heeeurlijk
description:
City: Gouda
description: Brown cafe, Amsterdam style with some elements seeping over to a London pub appearance

name: Eetcafé Vidocq
description:
City: Gouda
description: Brown cafe/Jazz cafe stylings in this pub-restaurant. Set up for food but on our tentative list to see if this can sneak in on a lunchtime or late evening.

name: Biercafé De Goudse Eend
description:
City: Gouda
description: Small corner bar stuffed with beer options and decorated in the charming cluttered fashion that gives a place a lived-in feel.

name: Café de Klep
description:
City: Venlo
description: Core brown cafe with tiled floor, chandeliers and lots of wood. Two rooms, one of which is more like a kitchen. Looks fabulous.

name: Café De Baek
description:
City: Venlo
description: Exposed brick, wooden leading posts and looks like a reasonable all-rounder.

name: Café Bierlokaal Engel
description:
City: Oldenzaal
description: A very well put together cafe, brown hues, candle light and plenty of room. Characterful.

name: Tapperij De Bierelier
description:
City: Eindhoven
description: Finally, a characterful Eindhoven option? You're kidding. This one has a quirky layout, some old tarred black wooden fittings and furniture, studded leather seats.

name: Café-Bar "De Locht"
description:
City: Veldhoven
description: Well reviewed brown cafe reputedly unchanged for 2 decades. Unsure of any further details other than the fact the frontage looks very promising.

name: De Heks
description:
City: Deventer
description: Brilliant looking pub, halfway brown cafe halfway beer geek pub. Plenty of character and identity on show.

name: Eetcafe Huiskamer
description:
City: Deventer
description: This place looks plenty pubby enough to count, though clearly some food for lunch. Trinkets on the ceiling, ceramic tiles, wooden curved bar top. Excellent reviews.

name: Eetcafé de Sjampetter
description:
City: Deventer
description: Eetcafe it may but this is a brown cafe by all appearances, indeed would not look out of place in Amsterdam. Plenty of space for drinking only.

name: Café "De Herberg"
description:
City: Deventer
description: Crimson painted wooden fittings, picture frames and a brooding ambience in this not so much brown, as trad evening bar

name: Café Het Glas In Lood
description:
City: Deventer
description: A post-grad feel, some traditional features, boardgames but some - albeit tasteful - modern touches too. Looks well worth a look.

name: Feestcafé Bubbels
description:
City: Doetinchem
description: Feestcafe? Me neither, but check the care that's gone into the design. Bespoke fixtures and fittings in wood and brass. Beautiful light fittings and brown cafe style beams and mustard wallpapered ceilings. Looks characterful and one that will probably only gain more with age.

name: Café Tramhalt
description:
City: Weert
description: Looks an authentic and characterful enough pub with old-time floral wallpaper and dark wooden panels. Mixed crowd. Good reviews.

name: Café De Gruyter
description:
City: Weert
description: A brown-ish cafe worth an inspection.

name: Microbar
description:
City: Weert
description: Interesting looking venue - details thin on the ground. Some event space but looks like a very cosy pub offering too.

name: Lighthouse Champagne Bar
description:
City: Folkstone
description: A unique, quirky, but fairly middle class option. Nevertheless, it's your lifetime opportunity to get pissed in a lighthouse that still has people inside.

name: The Waggon & Horses
description:
City: York
description: A well-reviewed traditional pub. Partly gentrified but some nice partitions, good beer selection and bits and pieces which add to the character. We visited once in 2022 and weren''t fully sold on it as the atmosphere was a little bit lifeless, but ready to try again soon. (Added July 2021)

name: Bay Horse Inn
description:
City: Pickering
description: A market place pub, images look a bit hodge podge but the potential of being a nice market town pub. Has a real fire, pool table, some characterful bits. Jury's out though.

name: Spread Eagle, Wandsworth
description:
City: London
description: A London pub with victorian fittings, partions and frosted glass. Visually, a gem.

name: Osteria del Sole
description:
City: Bologna
description: A beautiful proper pub with many frames hung on the walls, and a curved arch by the bar - bring your own food and enjoy their selection of beers and wine. Looking forward to visiting.

name: Shoulder of Mutton, Hallfieldgate
description:
City: Shirland
description: Images thin on the ground but looks like a decent village pub with a large beer garden and uncomplicated interior.

name: Bar Amadeu
description:
City: Barcelona
description: An archetypal Spanish bar. Tiled walls and simple elegant design, unpretentious in the extreme. Foody, naturally.

name: Devonshire Arms
description:
City: Burton on Trent
description: A classic station pub with Bass. Bunker-like with brick and wood panels, bar mat type design. Homely and a bit of history.

name: The Coopers Tavern
description:
City: Burton on Trent
description: A 'proper pub'. Core CAMRA territory, with some nice heritage touches, effectively an operation that knows well what they're doing.

name: The Sweffling White Horse
description:
City: Saxmundham
description: A proper country pub, ungentrified, low ceilings, folk music, candle light, brickwork. Looks fab.

name: The Square & Compass
description:
City: Worth Matravers
description: "Beautiful location, completely unique experience, excellent beer, little book shop/swap shop out of a shepherds hut, a fossil museum, dogs on the roof and great staff"
Incredibly highly rated country pub with very nice cosy decor, and quirky features. Can't wait to visit.

name: The Eels Foot Inn
description:
City: Leiston
description: Perhaps a bit too dining room/hotel bland, but wooden beams, real fires and some original furnishing in the pub/bar area.

name: The Paul Pry
description:
City: Worcester
description: Victorian bar area with clock face/wood panels. A stately appearance, looks pleasant, not too towny.

name: Goldhopfen - Craft Beer Bar Leipzig
description:
City: Leipzig
description: Craft beer bar with reasonable prices and non-too arch décor. A simple, slightly worn away set of rooms. Looks decent.

name: Liquid Bar
description:
City: Luxembourg
description: Brown café/English pub hybrid. Cosy, a little bit shady. Well reviewed.

name: Café des Artistes
description:
City: Luxembourg
description: Brooding artsy bar with lamppost, frame artwork and crimson paint. Looks intriguing.

name: Gaststätte Karateklub Meier
description:
City: Saarbrucken
description: Locally known punk pub, mixed crowd, terrific reviews.

name: Stube 8
description:
City: Saarbrucken
description: An interesting option. Modern take on the beer stube. Some craft beer, some modern decor but generally a pleasant looking mix of that with trad pub features and amenities.

name: Gaststätte Biermichel
description:
City: Kassel
description: Trad pub with old time atmosphere, well reviewed. Set up for drinking over eating. Which is a plus.

name: Bierakadmie
description:
City: Kassel
description: Trad gaststatte with wooden bench seats, a cosy quaint appearance, simple format.

name: Cafe in de oude Marenpoort
description:
City: Leiden
description: A brown café with resurrected popularity among youngsters - perhaps over popular judging from the reviews. Still, it looks like there are plenty of original features and a good chance of an interesting evening!

name: De Bonte Koe
description:
City: Leiden
description: Beautiful looking pub with painted tiles and an interesting artsy mixture of brooding art bar and brown cafe cosiness. Intrigued. Looks like an absolute must visit.

name: Café ´t Lisser Veerhuis
description:
City: Leiden
description: Info a little thin on the ground, but hey ho. This one may be worth a visit. Neighbourhood local crowd, friendly and potentially characterful décor.

name: Café de Spijkerbak
description:
City: Leiden
description: Curved old time bar with stained glass. Looks cosy and local with pub games.

name: Eigenzorg
description:
City: Leiden
description: "At the moment you enter the door, the date on your mobile phone automatically goes back fifty years. That is exactly how long nothing has changed and it is nice that it is. The billboards, neon lights, smoking room, bar, furniture, fake plants, wooden wall panels and picture tube remind us of a Jiskefet scene. The coat rack is crooked, but that is because the floor is also crooked everywhere. You can tell from this that this place has lived. And it still does!" - Warning: some negative reviews about a rude old lady server.

name: Café Scaldis
description:
City: Antwerp
description: A bar with its heyday behind it, which formerly served seamen working at the old port. Featured on 'Belgian Café Culture' by Regula Ysewijn as an example of fading nostalgia. Looks the part.

name: Petra's Café
description:
City: Antwerp
description: Petra is no more but her name live's on at this dockworker's pub. Historically significant and authentic, with a local crowd and cheap beer. If you are into seafood, keep a close eye on any local offerings going around.

name: De Ware Jacob
description:
City: Antwerp
description: Not as old as it looks, with fixtures salvaged from other venues. Features a pagaddertrappen staircase and is owned by people with a love of nostalgia and preservation. Extensive beer list, poetry recitals.

name: Café De Koophandel
description:
City: Boom
description: An old brickworker's pub, this brown café has history and character, and is family-owned and run.

name: De Zates
description:
City: Branst
description: Historic cafe founded in 1838. Painted tiles, wonderfully preserved fixtures and fittings. It looks supremely beautiful.

name: De Kroon
description:
City: Lommel
description: Over 100 years old, a beautiful preserved brown café, even the floor was rediscovered after a refurbishment and brought back to life. It looks fabulous.

name: Café - In den Hengst
description:
City: Brakel
description: A café with no bar, more of a living room feel. An old fashioned stove and outhouse. Popular with card playing. A superb throwback.

name: Cafe De Zavelput (bij Lea)
description:
City: Den-Oss
description: A beautiful café with aging owner and clientele. A true homely interior with tiles and faded glow.

name: Speleers Monique - Bij Moniqueske
description:
City: Kluisbergen

description: Monique's old time café, true character from every pore. It would be a pleasure, no doubt, to visit this place.

name: In Den Bouw
description:
City: Kalken
description: A cafe with some art exhibitions in the nearby barn. An artful eye has been trained on the interior of the pub too, with a wonderful ruralist nostalgia and simplicity that is truly attractive and endearing. This place is run by Christine, very much keeping alive a dream.

name: Café Posthotel
description:
City: Wetteren
description: A simply sublime historic venue with wooden beams, stained glass and tiled floor. A former hotel, restaurant and coach service, this was restored and its neo-renaissance appearance brought back to life.

name: De Harmonie
description:
City: Renaix
description: Founded as a cafe and ballroom for a union, its grandeur remains on show today. A listed building with painted tiles, mirrors and dark wood fittings.

name: Local Unique
description:
City: Renaix
description: And unique it certainly is. Baroque painted tiles, mirrors and simple seating, this brings back the 1920s belle epoque charm. Watch out for billiards tournaments, musical performances and of course the old fashioned savings cupboard. Young and old share the tables.

name: In de oude smis van Mekingen
description:
City: Sint-Pieters-Leeuw

description: A historic charming rural pub with typical Belgian pub features. Patterned tiled floor, yellow stained walls, wood and living room décor. Bottles only. A freehold operation, which is why it hasn't yet gone extinct.

name: Cafe Op 't Hoeksken
description:
City: Wemmel
description: A well renowned geuze café  popular with students from the nearby campus. Charming, homely and democratic. There seems much to love about this place!

name: Gambrinus Exploitatie
description:
City: Leuven
description: Unfortunately the exploitation appears to be due to the pricing, but the decor and atmosphere may still justify a visit. High ceilinged, this grand cafe has preserved features, and a touch of class without feeling exclusive or stuck-up.

name: 't Snuitje-Stips
description:
City: Testelt
description: Famously popular pub with democratic prices, a family run affair and everything feels like the home you never had. Wonderful.

name: Vaffalluppolo Birroteca Gastronomica
description:
City: Campiglione
description: A surprising find in the sticks, a beer focused bar with plenty of decent atmosphere from the tasteful decor and local life. Looks interesting.

name: The Poachers Inn
description:
City: Ide
description: A terrific, distinctive and lived-in pub that looks as cosy and characterful as that might lead you to expect. We look forward to trying this place out.

name: Old Tom's Bar
description:
City: London
description: Fabulous victoriana market hall setting, this basement bar has been gentrified to the nines, however the tiled walls and general ambience mean the character has not quite yet been extinguished.

name: Wharf Tavern
description:
City: Stalybridge
description: A lived-in old school community neighbourhood pub. Its appearance brings that clearly into view. Characterful, cosy and cheap. Community events, Landlady's word goes. Didn't quite tip the balance on a first visit but would return to try again. (Added August 2023)

name: Dyfi Forester Inn
description:
City: Machynlleth
description: "Halfway between railway station and town centre, this basic down-to-earth single-bar drinkers' local shows a renewed commitment to real ale (ignore the large Carling sign outside!).Quirky exterior with some original stained glass leads to the welcoming bar where the beers turn over quickly (another Wye Valley beer may replace Butty Bach on occasion). Enter as a stranger, leave as a friend."

name: Café Boerenhol
description:
City: Geraardsbergen
description: Interesting looking kitchenette brown café. Not so much historic but retro touches and good reviews about service.

name: The Preacher
description:
City: Geraardsbergen
description: A well reviewed 'gezellig' (cosy) brown cafe. Looks reasonable and clearly hosts community events such as chess nights.

name: Herberg De Drie Koningen
description:
City: Houtave
description: Another brown café transporting you back in the time. Pots hung from wooden beams. Plates, floral prints, dark aged wood. Handpainted wallpaper. A freehold owned pub so hopefully will remain alive for a while yet/

name: 'T Hof van Commerce
description:
City: Stavele
description: Vintage collections and rescued fittings from an old butchers, almost a living museum. Also, in there somewhere, a bar. Fantastically well reviewed.

name: De Leute
description:
City: Alveringem
description: A classic cafe with red chequered tablecloths. They serve food to survive, as drink alone will no longer pay the bills. A characterful historic venue.

name: Chez Bertrand
description:
City: Ster
description: A traditional café that still has a working shop, the proximity to Spa Francorchamps motor racing circuit means it is decorated accordingly. A retro venue in safe hands.

name: Le Saint Charles Brasserie
description:
City: Brussels
description: A true pub with some brasserie/grand café elements, a pool table and local crowd. Talk of democratic prices. In Brussels?!

name: Le Chapître
description:
City: Namur
description: A wonderful, intact brown café beaming with character and charm.

name: Le Café de la Fontaine
description:
City: Namur
description: Information thin on the ground, and apparently absent from google, yet some sources show this place to still be open. Recommended in Regula Ysewijn's 'Belgian Café Culture'.

name: Taverne L'aigle d'or
description:
City: Liège
description: How did we miss this? A fun brown café with pub games, characterful fittings and stained glass. Looks great.

name: De Hovenier
description:
City: Antwerp

description: A popular brown café with a younger crowd and more fun feel.

name: In de stad Aalst
description:
City: Antwerp
description: Brown café with a dinky bar and a very local working class crowd.

name: Den Witten Hert
description:
City: Antwerp
description: Authentic brown café with terrific reviews. Local crowd and more democratic prices.

name: Café De Pelikaan
description:
City: Halle-Dorp

description: Original authentic café with what looks to be some cycling, sporting interest. Wood panels, quite 60s from what we can gather.

name: St-Vadde Café
description:
City: Bornem
description: It just looks like the most fabulous pub. Tiled floor, wooden beams, fireplace, and cosiness.

name: Oude Poort
description:
City: Bornem
description: In this canal side 'bootcafé' exposed brick, and venerable bar area provides the charm and character by the look of it. Recommended by Regula Ysewijn in her book Belgian Cafe Culture.

name: Polydoor
description:
City: Tessenderlo
description: Dive deep into nostalgia - and obscurity with this authentic Belgian café.

name: Cafe De Voermansrust
description:
City: Kruibeke
description: A proper country pub with rustic Belgian flair, popular with two-wheelists of the motor and non-motor variety. Ungentrified, homely and - judging from the reviews - adored.

name: Cafe De Reisduif
description:
City: Bazel
description: An authentic brown cafe with typical tiled floor and wooden fittings. Looks great.

name: Den Hert
description:
City: Dendermonde

description: Brown café and sports affilated pub in superb medieval building.

name: Cafe Den Dikken Eik
description:
City: Lebbeke
description: A brown café that changed ownership in 2019, however good reviews are coming in. The skeleton of the pub looks idyllic in the way many of these do.

name: the Carillon
description:
City: Oudenaarde
description: Looks surprisingly distinctive. A narrow, wood panneled bar with upturned barrels and an off-square rabbit hole type appearance.

name: Café Den Babbelaer
description:
City: Aalst
description: A good quality pub-tavern rather than brown café. Exposed beams and brickwork, candlelight, and cosy side areas. Looks good.

name: In den Grooten Moriaen
description:
City: Wervik
description: Information thin on the ground but meant to be a decent refuge and is features in Regula Ysewijn's Belgian Café Culture.

name: de avonden
description:
City: Zulte
description: Definitely a pub-tavern rather than brown café but exposed brick, beams, candle light and cosy ambience seems to be the way of it. I wouldn't complain if it was down my street.

name: Puur Genot ('T)
description:
City: Diest
description: An authentic Belgian café with what looks like a loyal set of locals, information thin on the ground but recommended in Regula Ysewijn's book Belgian Café Culture.

name: De Sigaret
description:
City: Diest
description: Looks like an utterly superb pub. Retro signage, faded browns, and bags of charm.

name: De Pollepel
description:
City: Reninge
description: Information is thin, so we are relying on the so far impeccable judgement of Regula Ysewijn, author of Belgian Café Culture.

name: De Helleketel
description:
City: Watou
description: A beautiful farmstead cafe with common traditional belgian pub features, tiled floors, net curtains, old fogeys.

name: Het Witte Paard
description:
City: Vleteren
description: Typical rustic Belgian country pub tavern with authentic features and a well kept together ensemble

name: the Barber
description:
City: Dranouter
description: Border café with retro signage and original fixtures. A roadside stop, no doubt, but a good one.

name: Christen Volkshuis
description:
City: Poperinge
description: Another café shout we are leaving in the trusty hands of ruralist, epucurist and fan of preservation Regula Ysewijn. Recommended in her book Belgian Café Culture.

name: De Zoete Inval
description:
City: Oostduinkerke
description: Looks like an authentic Belgian café, all the traditional features one might expect. An understated gem.

name: ZEEGEUZEN
description:
City: Ostend
description: Looks unmissable. A secret 'house drink' Zeegeus, and a true seaside pub with tavern fittings.

name: Robin Hood & Little John
description:
City: Bexleyheath
description: Looks to all intents and purposes an atmospheric and cosy neighbourhood pub with some community feel.

name: The Jolly Sailor Ramsey
description:
City: Ramsey
description: Traditional interior and as such, retains the character that would be lost if a husband and wife were let loose with their inane Laura Ashley/Farrow & Ball design choices. Looks like a good 'un.

name: Long Pond
description:
City: Eltham
description: Micropub that manages to drum up a simple neighbourly feel. Stripped back to an extent, and run on a budget, this seems only to increase its appeal to us.

name: White Lion
description:
City: Sawley
description: A genteel-looking rustic, ungentrified pub without too much corporate rubbish and uninspired copycat decor. Looks welcoming and lived in. Well reviewed.

name: The Old Moseley Arms
description:
City: Birmingham
description: An attractive bar area and Edwardian type saloon bar atmosphere, a popular courtyard beer garden. Well reviewed.

name: The Plough
description:
City: Nottingham
description: A Nottingham Brewery pub with fair prices, old school pub decor and community of locals.

name: The Chapel House
description:
City: Gornal
description: A traditional homely community pub with a local atmosphere and cosy simple appeal. Very well reviewed.

name: Hill House Happisburgh
description:
City: Happisburgh
description: An inn with rooms, but the pub area looks homely, cosy and characterful.

name: La Mayor Cervecería
description:
City: Madrid
description: A beautiful lived in beer bar with a pub  like appearance without becoming a tacky Irish pub. Popular and renowned for its selection.

name: Volunteer Arms
description:
City: York
description: A well reputed neighbourhood local, with typical community pub decor, uncomplicated and potentially atmospheric in the evenings. Have visited a couple of times but a little quiet on both occasions to get a true sense. Similar vibe to The Ackhorne nearby. Lacking a certain something in comparison to sister pubs The Swan and The Slip Inn. Last visit in 2024.

name: Imperial Arms Pub & Courtyard Bisro
description:
City: Chislehurst
description: A pub with an ornate Victorian lounge, plush leather seats, curtains, sadly fairly tacky fake book wallpaper ruining the effect.

name: The Stocks Inn
description:
City: Furzehill
description: Pleasant looking coaching inn pub with exposed beams, ungentrified decor, good reviews.

name: Wallace Arms
description:
City: Rowfoot
description: We are pleased to announce, a real pub, a proper pub, a hikers pub one with a local community and not turned into a middle class dining room yet.

name: Crown & Mitre
description:
City: King's Lynn

description: A pleasant riverside pub without corporate trappings, and a homely, distinctly English feel. We are excited to try it.

name: The Stork Hotel
description:
City: Birkenhead
description: Beautiful preserved Victorian pub with glass panels, ornate wood, tiled floor. Characterful and local.

name: Pivnice U Pražského Groše
description:
City: Hradec Králové
description: Small pub with good regional beer and cosy atmosphere, well reputed in town.

name: Pivnice u Peruna
description:
City: Hradec Králové
description: A proper pub focused on beer and a fair selection of regionals in trad style.

name: Divadelni Club
description:
City: Hradec Králové
description: 'Theatre Club', this is in fact a cosy, clandestine pub set up for drinking. Extremely well reviewed and seemingly Poutnik on tap. The most appealing looking venue we have found so far in Hradec Kralove.

name: "Pumpe" - Gasthaus Zum Großglockner
description:
City: Klagenfurt 
description: A traditional pub/gaststatte with plenty of room for a drink, not just food. Wood beams, traditional decor and impressive old bar area.

name: The Eagle Vaults
description:
City: Worcester
description: Attractive Victorian pub worth a look, however perhaps a little too lacking personality for its own good? We will see

name: House Without A Name
description:
City: Bolton
description: A pub with a very definite name.

name: The Packhorse Inn
description:
City: Little Longstone
description: Looks a lovely ungentrified country pub.

name: Le Jacques Coeur
description:
City: Bourges
description: Beautiful pub in half-timbered building, Belgian and local french ales on offer

name: La Cave a Vin'ce
description:
City: Bourges
description: Tiny wine bar with democratic prices, very well reviewed.

name: 't Goed Voorbeeld
description:
City: Lier
description: Brown cafe with parquet floor, mannequins and religious iconography. A proper bar as well. Looks very good.

name: Cafė De Mort
description:
City: Lier
description: Gloomy (in a good way) brown café specialising in higher end Belgian ales and well reputed. A few comments about being OK value, too.

name: De Tramstatie
description:
City: Ranst
description: A lovely well-done pub with wood panels, retro signage, pub games, classic furniture. Large enough to occasionally host live music.

name: Sint-Gummarus
description:
City: Lier
description: A traditional tavern/brown café with a beautiful riverside terrace and historic setting.

name: 't Kelderke
description:
City: Geel
description: Beer café with some distinctive touches and Belgian character but we are on the fence as to whether there's really enough going here.

name: K-Trolle VZW
description:
City: Roeselare
description: A bit more of an alternative city bar with some old time influences, more of an all-rounder, anyway. Looks like it has potential

name: The Salehurst Halt
description:
City: Robertsbridge
description: Timber framed pub with engagingly dark wooden beams and enough in the shape of the building to resist the attempts to gentrify.

name: The Rose & Crown
description:
City: Clayhill
description: A surprisingly distinctive venue with an eye for the old fashioned. Plenty of character and cosy interior. If only there were more of these around in the countryside.

name: Einstein. Die Bierkneipe
description:
City: Magdeburg
description: Cosy pub-like drinking hole, albeit smokers friendly. Social and well-reviewed.

name: Le Stanze
description:
City: Bologna
description: Le Stanze. A bar inside a chapel. We visited in 2014 but it didn't make a profound impression. However the interior does look outstanding, so worth closer inspection.

name: Harvest Pub
description:
City: Bologna
description: Neighbourhood beer bar with wood panels, a fairly distinctive independent effort, not too craft-cookie cutter.

name: eKoiné ri-pub
description:
City: Bari
description: Strangely named, this alternative hangout spot is a tad ramshackle - in a nice way - and offers extremely good beers.

name: L'Orabeffa
description:
City: Brindisi
description: On our first visit, we were not totally convinced. High prices as well as a cover charge, along with sneaky extras for snacks. Otherwise a decent all-rounder with good drinks options. May be worth returning.

name: Windigo Saloon
description:
City: Bari
description: Lots of wood, as you may imagine from the name. Another bar with good beer and pub credentials in the Bari backstreets.

name: Pinky Pub di Ricci Michele
description:
City: Martina Franca
description: Looks an excellent pub with strong beer credentials and cosy wodden bench seating.

name: Tausend Pub
description:
City: Martina Franca
description: Surprisingly interesting looking backstreet pub considering the location. Beer, down to earth decor, cosy seating arrangement.

name: Osteria All'antico Vinaio
description:
City: Florence
description: Stunningly historic, well kept osteria. Certainly food-focused but with a pub-like atmosphere and informality that welcomes drinking.

name: The Four Alls Inn
description:
City: Ovington
description: Attractive, cosy looking country inn without too much modernisation or attempt to appeal to only one class of person.

name: Langdon Beck Hotel
description:
City: Forest-in-Teesdale
description: Attractive, cosy looking country inn without too much modernisation or attempt to appeal to only one class of person.

name: Entlas-Keller Biergarten GmbH
description:
City: Erlangen
description: Gardens don't feature all too commonly on our guide but here is a great looking pub and a fun-looking garden - neither tacky nor stuffy.

name: House of Beer
description:
City: Kraków
description: A venue that hasn't quite done it for us yet, however you can't deny the beer range, and they have some nice exposed wooden beams in what does really feel like a house taken over. Maybe a few more visits will convince us to add this one.

name: Non Iron. Pub
description:
City: Kraków
description: One of the genuinely local places in the city, this one specialises in live sport and Czech beer, with several low-key regionals on tap. Missing something to make it truly lovable, but we are convinced it could be on the fringes of an inclusion.

name: Gaststätte HARR
description:
City: Siegen
description: Old fashioned Gaststätte set up for drinking over eating from what we can see. A decent ausschenk at least. Looks homely and characterful.

name: De Zeeduif
description:
City: De Haan
description: Fun-looking bar with some cafe features, funky stylings, interspersed with pub-like parts.

name: The Star Inn
description:
City: Bath
description: One of the true highlights of bath. Preserved pub interior with a cosy bustling feel. Wood panels and red cushions, a classic.

name: The Green Tree Tavern
description:
City: Broxburn
description: A homely drop-in pub with lived-in appearance and character as a result.

name: The Old Fox
description:
City: Gateshead
description: A local institution, information thin on the ground but live music, large beer selection and local character is to be expected.

name: Alibi Creative Club
description:
City: Lecce
description: – one of the more interesting décor wise. Cavern like but with verdant hanging plants. Some food focus but enough latitude for evening drinks

name: Quanto Basta
description:
City: Lecce
description: Reportedly the best cocktails in the city. Decor is down to earth, mostly it is about the product.

name: Gusto Vinile
description:
City: Brindisi
description: Interesting concept - a vinyl bar stuffed with records, some live music too. Extremely highly rated, even if the decor looks a bit dated now.

name: The Halfway House
description:
City: Brenchley
description: Characterful venue with exposed beams, dangling hops and barrels strewn with beer ephemera. Distinctive and seemingly heroically well reviewed.

name: Johnnie Fox's Pub
description:
City: Glencullen
description: Somewhat touristy due to being the highest pub in Ireland, but the venue itself has much to recommend it. Historic and has the character you'd expect. A little chintzy but non-corporate and all the better for it.

name: The Glenmalure Lodge
description:
City: Glenmalure
description: A country inn with plenty of preserved rustic charm by the looks of it.

name: The Cartoon Inn
description:
City: Rathdrum
description: A somewhat distinctive pub from the inside (the gaelic script signage is a bit drab), a fireplace and plenty of hanging artwork provide the cosy atmosphere you're seeking.

name: Tochar House
description:
City: Roundwood
description: Another rustic country inn with local life and character that's not yet been extinguished

name: The Blue Light
description:
City: Sandyford
description: Roadside pub with stone walls and a coastal type decoration. Visited by those seeking a good view of Dublin city and a bit of a day out.

name: The Cumberland Inn
description:
City: Alston
description: An inn with rooms, this one looks to have kept the concept of a cosy bar and lounge going.

name: Café De Vriendschap
description:
City: Terneuzen
description: Venerable brown café with a few seasidey elements. Nevertheless very brown, and well reviewed.

name: Luwak
description:
City: Terneuzen
description: Lucky to have a place like this - a cosy pub with exposed beams, high ceiling and antique decor, some mixing of old and new. Exceptional reviews.

name: Cafe "Bij Jean en Tinneke" ("Bij Voghel")
description:
City: Brussegem
description: Very characterful looking brown cafe with home kitchen stylings thrown in. A venerable establishment.

name: Karrewiel
description:
City: Merchtem
description: Characterful brown café enjoyed by young and old. Looks distinctive and individual.

name: Het Obstakel
description:
City: Opwijk
description: Not the average brown cafe, this bar has more individual styling with marble bar top, quirky plant based decor but plenty of dusky candle lit atmosphere in the evenings, mainly well reviewed except for music volume.

name: Prince of Wales
description:
City: Foxfield
description: Despite some dud old design choices you can't criticise this pub for its community feel. It looks to have local character and individuality which is worth a lot more in the long run.

name: The Kings Arms
description:
City: Barrow-in-Furness
description: A true neighbourhood pub owned by a local rugby player. Traditional pub amenities and cosy seating. Uniformly well reviewed.

name: The Wellington Inn
description:
City: Loppergath
description: A homely inn with a local, as well as countryside flavour. Down to earth appearance and very well reviewed.

name: The Junction
description:
City: Castleford
description: Famous local pub for music gigs, with a few cask ales. WARNING: Cash Only. On our first visit we didn't quite see it at its best but willing to try again. (Added February 20240

name: The Drovers Inn
description:
City: Inveraran
description: A locally-famous pub with interesting low-slung ceiling and stuffed animals. Quite corporate in its presentation but seems like it will be effective in its execution of a country pub.

name: The Hairy Lemon
description:
City: Dublin
description: Perhaps unbearably tacky and touristy,  but this is a very well known venue for its decor and atmosphere in the evening

name: The Crafty Baa
description:
City: Windermere
description: Tiresome name, but plenty of thought (and money) in the execution, straddling modernity and cosy traditional values. Good drinks are presumably available.

name: Black Bull
description:
City: Coniston
description: A pleasantly homely pub with a delicate touch, of the kind you often get with inns offering rooms. Looks reasonably good and offers a beautiful riverside view.

name: Tower Bank Arms
description:
City: Sawrey
description: Characterful, upright but traditional pub trying to attract diners, potentially losing some of its cosiness in the process. However given the location it merits a closer look.

name: The Eagle & Child Inn
description:
City: Staveley
description: Majestic pub with steep beamed ceiling, plush furniture and an array of carefully positioned bric-a-brac. Looks genuinely fab.

name: Warthe-Eck
description:
City: Berlin
description: Looks like a quality 'Eck', corner pub, with darts, retro (original) signage and no-nonsense service. A format that is increasingly alien, even in German cities.

name: Up´n Prüfstand
description:
City: Varel
description: One of the smallest bars in Europe, based in what seems to be a fishing hut or little chalet. Opening hours seem erratic, so this may be a labour of love. Some people enjoy it for the cosiness.

name: Schlappen
description:
City: Freiburg
description: Recommended by a friend...

name: Cztery Pokoje
description:
City: Legnica
description: Very well reviewed bar with a few different areas. Seemingly quite versatile, with a pub dog.

name: Bimbeer
description:
City: Legnica
description: A decent range of beers and somewhat clandestine looking interior. Reviews thin on the ground.

name: Gaststätte Madhouse
description:
City: Augsburg
description: Highly personalised and lived-in features, live music, and a bit of a local legend. Also looks very different from a lot of other Augbsurg bars (in a good way)

name: The Blue Mugge
description:
City: Leek
description: Studded red leather bench seating and other Victorian/Edwardian features in this traditional down to earth boozer that is outstandingly well reviewed.

Edit - On a 1st visit the layout was very distinctive but the floral wallpaper and slightly sterilised feel meant it didn't quite make the cut.

name: Britannia Inn
description:
City: Elterwater
description: A 500-year old building, it looks like a cosy country inn with exposed beams, stone fireplace and ungentrified feel. A genteel setting looks to make outside seating in summer enjoyable too.

name: Black Swan Hotel
description:
City: Kelso
description: A hotel pub with an attractive and welcoming ungentrified downstairs that plays host to local life.

name: The Three Tuns
description:
City: Alcester
description: A suitably old building with exposed beams and a stone floor, one or two nik naks which are in tune with the design, and it's a popular venue. We are ready to be convinced.

name: The Grey Horse
description:
City: Consett
description: Fabulous looking local gem, traditional neighbourhood corner local that's been kept as cosy as it should be. Looks a classic.

name: The Falcon Inn
description:
City: Arncliffe
description: A frankly beautiful cosy looking old in which just to look at recalls the pubs of times past, the best bits anyway. We look forward to visiting.

name: 't Schrijverke
description:
City: Temse
description: Cosy looking cafe with night atmosphere as well. Seems personalised and characterful in its own way.

name: Blue Cow Cafe
description:
City: Bornem
description: Characterful venue, well decorated with a lived-in feel. Seemingly well known in the area and well thought of. Brown cafe design but a little bigger than usual. Popular.

name: Cafe De Paling
description:
City: Ninove
description: Beautiful interior with tiled floor and plenty of aged local life

name: Sint-Annakamer
description:
City: Ninove
description: Beautiful tiled floor and rustic furnishings. Mirror panels, wooden fittings, the lot.

name: Gonzo
description:
City: Ninove
description: Highly rated pub that aims to be a live music rock pub and cosy cafe when live acts aren't on. Very well rated and looks good for either occasion.

name: Café Mombasa
description:
City: Antwerp
description: Belgian-style corner cafe with retro signage and wooden seats, some art nouveau touches. Looks cosy and authentic.

name: Bierkroeg Den Hulst
description:
City: Herselt
description: Roadside cafe with authetic/nostalgic decor, nik naks up the walls and very strong beer offerings, as could be predicted. Looks fantastic.

name: Kaffee Den Afgrond In De Swa(e)nekelder
description:
City: Heist-op-den-Berg
description: Details thin on the ground but this has previously been listed as one of the best brown cafes in the area. Some recent reviews (2019)

name: La Pisici Cafe
description:
City: Timisoara
description: Unclear on drinks options but this cafe bar looks after stray cats, the decor is very individualistic with a twee living room style.

name: Willoughby Arms
description:
City: Kingston upon Thames
description: A down to earth boozer with occasional live music and events room upstairs. Seemingly unconcerned by the concept of pretentiousness which can hardly be a bad thing given the location.

name: The Masons Arms
description:
City: Teddington
description: Beautiful octagonal bar area with bench seating around it. Looks to be very well reviewed and rated for its beer selection in addition to local atmosphere.

name: The Grill
description:
City: Aberdeen
description: Somewhat of an oddity, this is a local institution. No food. Art deco appearance with varnished wood fittings and sleek ceiling. Leather bench seats but quite open plan. Cast iron tables, lamplight and whiskies galore.

name: Swan with Two Necks
description:
City: Pendleton
description: A slightly twee country inn with comfortable seating and rustic decor. A working fire helps of course. Excellent reviews and award winning. (Added 2020)

name: The Bell Inn, Aldworth
description:
City: Aldworth
description: Beautiful unspoilt country pub that hasn't gone too beige to appeal to diners. Some nice retro signage and mid-brown wood fittings with a low ceiling make it look pretty cosy. We would like to visit!

name: The George & Dragon
description:
City: Hudswell
description: Perpetual CAMRA chart-topping pub, an early community-owned venture with an established reputation for the back-to-basics first principles of how to run unpretentious pubs.

name: U Krajčů
description:
City: Pozlovice
description: A true village pub with pajzl (dive) type elements as well as rustic community elements.

name: The Drovers Rest
description:
City: Monkhill
description: Given the location, this looks to have a great beer selection, roaring fire and lots of other homely country inn features. The bar area is small but with a characterful cluttered collection of items pinned to the ceiling. Whoever put THAT thing above the bar deserves sending back to school.

name: The Hope
description:
City: Carshalton
description: A frankly fantastic looking community owned pub. Red leather, cosy carpets, exposed beams. Exceptionally well reviewed.

name: The Kings Head
description:
City: Bonsall
description: A slightly gentrified but still tasteful and rustic country in which looks comfy and warm, without too much emphasis on dining.

name: Barley Mow Ltd
description:
City: Bonsall
description: Cluttered and characterful pub with character. Some of the decor is downright awful (chicken patterns anyone?), but overall it seems to be terrific. A potential 9 or 10?

name: Fishermans Arms
description:
City: Hartlepool
description: A very atmospheric looking coastal boozer with live music performances, nautical theme and cosy surroundings. Highly rated online.

name: De Karper
description:
City: Ghent
description: Corner bar with some modernisation, but still looking characterful.

name: Victoria Inn
description:
City: Rugby
description: A beautiful preserved little corner pub with cosy decor in 'flat iron' type building on the corner.

name: The Ship Inn
description:
City: Portishead
description: A throwback 1970s era pub with a notoriously brusque landlord Vic. Cash only. But it does look charming in its own way.

name: Restaurace Chata Tesák
description:
City: Rajnochovice
description: Country pub with decor throwing back to the socialist era. A bit of a timewarp, but fondly thought of.

name: The White Hart
description:
City: Shifnal
description: Wooden beams and mock tudor appearance, it's a traditional pub with low ceiling, and looks a cosy choice.

name: The Vine Inn
description:
City: Brierley Hill
description: Enticing looking neighbourhood boozer with leather upholster seats, dartboard and friendly communal appearance. AKA The Bull & Bladder

name: Sandbrook Vaults
description:
City: Market Drayton
description: Old fashioned pub with nice wood panels and vaulted beams in a mock tudor building. Some live music events and a fairly neighbourly look despite the central location.

name: Salopian Star
description:
City: Market Drayton
description: Market town pub with old fashioned furniture and a cosy feel. Unsure quite what to make of it but seems like it would have potential.

name: Old market inn
description:
City: Douglas
description: Cosy coastal pub with an intimate atmosphere. Looks really good.

name: The Harp Inn
description:
City: Neston
description: Fringe of the countryside with a hint of the neighbourhood about it. Old fashioned homely looking inn with a local crowd. Especially the simple unreconstructed bar area.

name: Park Inn
description:
City: Mumbles
description: Cosy neighbourhood pub with light wood fittings, some bric a brac and live music

name: The Red Lion Inn, Penderyn
description:
City: Penderyn
description: While some of the furniture is bland, there are some characterful elements such as exposed brick, wood panels and beams. Looks a bit of a hybrid but surely worth a look.

name: The Goose & Cuckoo Inn
description:
City: Abergavenny
description: Looks like a lovely pub, ungentrified and homely, unspoilt, cosy and lots of those things a country pub ought to be.

name: The Eagles Inn
description:
City: Bala
description: Looks like a true throwback! Ungentrified and unpretentious country pub with a local crowd.

name: The Royal Oak Inn
description:
City: Rhandirmwyn
description: A lovely country inn with a dark wooden appearance, particularly at the bar area, in stark contrast to the rooms it offers upstairs.

name: Brynffynon Hotel
description:
City: Llanwonno
description: Details thin on the ground but this stone house with 70s arcade signage casts a striking figure, and the reviews tell of a rustic country experience inside.

name: Tafarn Jem
description:
City: Lampeter
description: A ...gem of a pub according to all and sundry. Old fashioned country inn with long standing owners.

name: Cwmdu Inn
description:
City: Cwmdu
description: A really down to earth looking pub with no airs and graces. Small club style bar hatch, simple seats and old fireplace.

name: Roast Ox Inn
description:
City: Builth Wells
description: Looks set up for food, but nevertheless characterful low ceilinged pub in a historic building, with a country appeal.

name: Literatka
description:
City: Wroclaw
description: Bookish cafe pub with atmospheric smoking section. Reportedly still the traditional casual meeting place for artists, politicians and so forth.

name: Salvador
description:
City: Wroclaw
description: A longer standing alternative bar with 'upside down' furniture and plenty of people remarking on the decor. Could be interesting.

name: Golden Lion
description:
City: Lancaster
description: Enticing looking trad pub with small old fashioned tables and cushioned stools. Some live music by the look of it.

name: Priory Arms
description:
City: London
description: Neighbourhood local with attractive exterior and belgian beer ephemera. Slightly plain when empty, which would be the only concern. Has potential.

name: The Railway Inn
description:
City: Upper Killay
description: A potential 9/10 or higher? Small cosy wooden interior stuff with decoration. Ungentrified with local character and folk nights. Looks fantastic.

name: The Old Friends Inn
description:
City: Ulverston
description: Highly popular pub with some home beers. Frequently described as a 'proper' pub with comments on great value drinks. Looks like a good all-rounder too.

name: Cutlers Arms
description:
City: Rotherham
description: Something of value in Rotherham? It looks like it. This beautifully wooden-fittings traditional town boozer has attractive decor, a cosy feel and some up to date beer options.

name: The Shinnon
description:
City: North Wingfield
description: An isolated neighbourhood local well reviewed for its interior, live music and community character.

name: Crown Inn
description:
City: Beeston
description: A well-known local pub that is a strong all-rounder. While it didn't knock our socks off, there is little to dislike. Good range of drinks, nice enough decor and cosy interior, along with some effort put into the beer garden. Worth another try.

name: The Surtees Arms
description:
City: Ferryhill
description: Microbrewery and friendly local in one, this looks every inch the community boozer. Extremely well rated.

name: The St Mabyn Inn
description:
City: St Mabyn
description: A slightly eclectic pub lurching from contemporary touches to very nostalgic ones in an old stone house. Looks curious enough to be worth a try.

name: The Dolly Peel
description:
City: South Shields
description: Local seaside boozer with plenty of the character you'd expect from that. Generally unvarnished looking. Could be good...

name: The Ship Inn
description:
City: Shaftesbury
description: A pleasingly ancient looking boozer in a stone house. Looks pretty good!

name: The Bricklayer’s Arms
description:
City: London
description: A pub from 1826 with some late Victoria features and not ruined by gentrification or pubco nonsense yet. Looks reasonably good with a distinctive ceiling.

name: The Virgin Queen
description:
City: London
description: An attractive wooden bar and shady wood panelled interior seem to create some good atmosphere in among the unwelcome clattering of fish and chips plates. Remains to be seen if it will qualify, but worth a look.

name: Hemingford Arms
description:
City: London
description: Famous for hanging baskets and a highly eclectic interior. Distinctive, nonetheless there's a hint of the middle class about it. We are prepared to give it a try.

name: Restaurace "Zelená"
description:
City: Rusava
description: A classic village Czech boozer with decor not updated for god knows how long

name: The Olde Sun
description:
City: Nether Hayford
description: Beautiful old house with low beams, a fire and distinctive selection of decorative plates. Looks cosy. Potentially overly foody, we will see...

name: Panda & Sons
description:
City: Edinburgh
description: Cocktail bar with a pub style layout, cosy looking with lounge seats, strikes a halfway house. It didn't quite do enough to persuade us on our visit. Low ceilings and towny, but the drinks are good, service is very attentive (as it should be for the price) and the concept is relatively fun. (Added February 2024)

name: The French House
description:
City: London
description: Famous Soho pub focused on wine, with only half pint measures of beer, and a no-tech policy. Long literary (ie. boozy) history.

name: Chequers Inn
description:
City: Doddington
description: A country pub that hasn't yet decided to turn into a middle aged persons dining room. Quaint and genteel, perhaps, but with the beams and age of the building plenty of character remains. It looks like it wouldn't throw you out if you just ordered beer.

name: Montefiore Arms
description:
City: Ramsgate
description: Cosy community boozer with simple decor, and straight forward approach.

name: Blood Bay
description:
City: Ludlow
description: Cool name, and a conscious throwback to the old ale houses of the past. Everything's banned, you suspect, except talking and drinking. It looks like a one-off though.

name: Spotted Cow
description:
City: Holbrook
description: Perhaps a little too open-plan and food focused. Wooden beams and struts, exposed brick and rustic furniture provide the character. It looks like it has a little something, so may be worth a try.

name: Valentin - Curious Bierkneipe
description:
City: Volos
description: A smartly designed pub restaurant with dark wood, plenty of space to just drink, and high quality European beers.

name: The Dog Inn
description:
City: Whalley
description: A traditional drink-first boozer with cushioned bench seats. Refurbed rather than old, there is still a little something to the place that makes it look appealing. Well reviewed.

name: The Vine Inn
description:
City: Pamphill
description: A country pub with a lovely garden and distinctive interior decor, with a flamboyant touch. Looks different and yet also cosy and familiar, making it appealling.

name: Pils Doktor
description:
City: Munich
description: Popular local kneipe where schnapps is delivered with a toy train. Everything else is wooden and trad.

name: Ungewitter
description:
City: Munich
description: Owners in their 70s, this longstanding 'Boazn' is a slice of old Munich life. A Pilsbar with a distinctive 3 sided bar decorated with framed artwork and photos. Looks interesting. Service may be a little on the salty side.

name: Bierschuppen
description:
City: Munich
description: One of the famous 'boazn' Muncih is known for. Small wood panelled interior. Looks really nice. (Added February 2025)

name: Zur Gruam
description:
City: Munich
description: Quirky little pub by the tracks. Interesting design and down to earth. Slightly punky/bookish.

name: Bahnwärter Thiel
description:
City: Munich
description: Club-cultural venue with free entry before 9pm. Bohemian ruin-bar type hangout spot. Interesting decor and very well reviewed.

name: Cafe Schau ma moi
description:
City: Munich
description: One of Munich's famous and disappearring 'boazn'

name: Schrott
description:
City: Brno
description: Steampunk/micro-brewery with a different feel to sum. Not totally craft-generic or hospoda-generic. Distinctive, looks to be well reviewed.

name: Restaurace U Průmyslovky
description:
City: Brno
description: A pub from 'Old Brno', if you like. From the 1980s and on into the past. Austrian-era decor on the ceiling. A simple no-nonsense interior. No airs and graces. Cheap. One for rubbernecking. 'Fourth grade'. Featured on Czech TV program 'Tales of Old Pubs'. We have been twice but not yet convinced it deserves an inclusion.

name: Blues Bar Garch
description:
City: Olomouc
description: Basement cellar pub with a down-n-dirty blues rock theme. Reportedly good value with decent atmosphere.

name: Gaststätte Schnerpfl
description:
City: Pegnitz
description: The bar in Pegnitz, extraordinarily well reviewed for service and atmosphere. Seems to be reasonably cosy decor too. In Franconia it's a dead cert there will be good beer, pictures show a dark, candlelit interior with chunky wood fittings. (Added 2021)

name: LEIKA, baras, UAB ONI GRUPĖ
description:
City: Klaipeda
description: Down to earth bar with a lived-in appearance, memorabilia and eclectric decor, red paint. Well reviewed.

name: Royal Oak Inn
description:
City: Dacre Banks
description: This village has been the starting point for many walks and the car park faces this pub. It looks like a decent country pub with an attractive dark wood bar and simple rustic seating, doing the genre justice by the look of it. We look forward to visiting.

name: Trappentreustüberl
description:
City: Munich
description: Cosy looking lived-in pub with distinctive decor and plenty of amenities. Generally well reviewed and on the 'boazn' list.

name: Ubier Schänke
description:
City: Cologne
description: Beautiful trad boozer with stained glass and wooden interior. Some live music events. Generally well regarded. Stays open late (3am)

name: Jadrošova Krčma
description:
City: Olomouc
description: Backstreet pub with a very good list of beer on rotation from Jadrnicek pivovar, a de facto taproom for the village brewery west of Olomouc. Unpromising exterior but inside safe and friendly.  Cosy ruralist decor of pine wood and greens. On our visit in November 2023 we didn't see it at its busiest that may have firmed up the recommendation to a full inscription, but enjoyed it and will keep the recommendation live. (Added November 2023)

name: Hospoda U Beníšků
description:
City: Melnik
description: An old time classic Czech hospoda by the look of it, but with some personal touches on the walls and ceilings. Set up for drinking and good reviews concerning the standard of the Pilsner Urquell.

name: Zum Freischütz
description:
City: Schwerin
description: Nicely brown, old and candle-lit. This is a well reviewed venue with a mixed crowd. Looks good.

name: White Star
description:
City: Liverpool
description: Cosy Victorian pub with leather seats, many a framed photo and lamp lights. Very central and despite a couple of visits we haven't quite been convinced yet, there is a trashiness that let's it down.

name: The George Inn
description:
City: Norton St Philip
description: Impressive stone house, with magnifient bar area and cellar like surrounds in some side rooms. Looks like a decent country inn that still retains some space for drinking.

name: Union Vaults
description:
City: Chester
description: A reported classic corner community local. Bar billiards and darts, old school atmosphere.

name: Fendstüberl
description:
City: Munich
description: A reported classic boazn, their term for a trad boozer.

name: Graf Arco Stub'n
description:
City: Munich
description: Well reviewed 'boazn', an old time boozer with dark wood panelled bar. On our first visit we loved the gloam, the friendly service and the hazy vaporwave experience but it didn't do quite enough to reach the threshold. Maybe give it another try! They do free crisps too (added August 2023)

name: The Three Greyhounds Inn
description:
City: Great Asby
description: Country inn with a more toned-down and lived-in pub feel. Looks like a very decent spot. Terrifically well reviewed.

name: Scotch Piper Inn
description:
City: Lydiate
description: A pub that has an interior that suits the thatched building outside. Cosy with nooks and crannies. Very well reviewed and at a glance you can see why.

name: Luppitt Inn
description:
City: Honiton
description: Very little information, we hope the place is still open! A historic pub of national importance, unspoilt farmhouse. Go before it vanishes.

name: Tap and Spile
description:
City: Pity Me
description: Looks like a classic boozer with some Durham community to it as well.  Folk music, etc. Highly reviewed.

name: The Star Inn
description:
City: Salford
description: An elderly community pub with a cult following. Information is scattered but it seems to have plenty of character and looks to be lived-in.

name: Traditionsgaststätte "Bei d'r Tant
description:
City: Cologne
description: A simple looking gaststatte with a local following. Space for drink and food. The bar area looks reasonably pubby too.

name: The Alma Pub Islington
description:
City: London
description: An airy but down to earth and lived-in pub with maori artworks and a non 'city' feel.

name: Kavarnica Rokaj
description:
City: Maribor
description: A riverside bar with an extensive drinks menu. The decor seems down to earth, lived in and characterful enough. A local favourite, seemingly.

name: Bierbaron Bierspezialitäten
description:
City: Graz
description: One of Graz's bautsatzlokale, rustic pubs with cheaper fare aimed at a younger crowd.

name: Restaurace Nádraží Jedlová
description:
City: Jiretin pod Jedlovou
description: Your classic train station pub, by the looks of things. Lovely genteel pre-iron curtain appearance, lived in with personal touches. Well reviewed.

name: Black Lion
description:
City: Leighton Buzzard
description: From what can be seen, this is a local treasure. Expansive drinks menu and a mixture of old and new stylings. Some old fashioned panels and insets give the place a characterful look. Very well reviewed.

name: St Johns Hotel
description:
City: Hull
description: A 'hotel' pub, down to earth decor, with a good rep for real-ale. Seems to be home to a few 'characters' without being overly rough, though that rather depends on your point of view.

name: Donald's pub
description:
City: Angers
description: Small atmospheric looking beer bar in the historic centre. Medieval signage, perhaps a little more modern inside, but still following a rustic wooden theme. Looks like it has potential.

name: The Aliane, Café Boutiquo-Games
description:
City: Colmar
description: Board games and brews - hipsterism arrives in the Alsace. Still, it's well reviewed and worth a look

name: DEER AND BEER
description:
City: Colmar
description: Info thin on the ground, but a beer focus bar by the canal, exceptionally well reviewed. The Deer is a reference to Jagermeister, which is less of a draw, to be honest. Worth a look.

name: CHECKPOINT
description:
City: Colmar
description: Videogames bar, very well reviewed. Worth a look given it's so far outside the norm for a town like this.

name: Bar Saint Ulrich
description:
City: Ribeauville
description: Very nice looking old wooden bar with a hybrid of French tavern/Belgian cafe dynamics. Hops on the ceiling which is more redolent of Czech and German places. No doubt beer is the focus here.

name: T Kabouterke
description:
City: Eeklo
description: Seems to be the best brown cafe in town. Nostalgic reviews and a cast of regulars. Looks reasonably trad from the limited info we can find.

name: Café Meng
description:
City: Genk
description: One of the last brown cafes in Genk. Looks legit with some worn out wooden fittings and attracting a mixed crowd in the manner you'd expect.

name: Café Sonja
description:
City: Genk
description: One of the disappearring Belgian brown cafes still run by a lady of advanced years in a suburban location. Looks authentic and as such it should be visited as often as possible.

name: 't Kont van het Paard
description:
City: Brielle
description: A pub in an old stables, one of the eldest buildings in the town. A step back in time venue, which aims to be an brown eetcafe, ie they rely on food to prop up the pub. All the same, the beer selection looks excellent, they do different community events and it's very well reviewed.

name: Tapperij 't Sloepje
description:
City: Zierikzee
description: A small rustic brown cafe with a simple format.

name: Nu 't Moment
description:
City: Sommelsdijk
description: Amazing looking dark wood shady boozer with the usual nautical bric a brac on the walls. A must visit for the area.

name: La Pompe Benoit
description:
City: Mons
description: One of very few interesting looking venues in Mons. A narrow 'classical' look to this belgian bar which makes use of all the merchandise and ephemera in a stylish fashion.

name: Het Zevende Zegel
description:
City: Ottenburg
description: What a pub to be out in the middle of nowhere like this! Barn type event space which has been lavishly decorated and appears to be very cosy for bar drinking. The reviews are uniformly positive.

name: Velvet
description:
City: Zagreb
description: Possibly too twee and cafe-like but the effort put into the decor and availability of alcoholic drinks make this interesting, we shall see

name: Kulturni centar Mesnička (Mesnicka Cultural Center)
description:
City: Zagreb
description: A music venue/bar with an antiquey appearance and near uniformly well review. Looks like one of the top options in the city. Jam sessions on Mondays.

name: Tolkien's House
description:
City: Zagreb
description: EDIT - CURRENTLY CLOSED
Looks like it just treads the line between gimmickry and functionality. Certainly lived in, cosy looking and atmospheric. The public appear to approve.

name: Veliki Tolk
description:
City: Zagreb
description: An extension of Tolkein's House next door. More space, still well reviewed.

name: Carpe Diem
description:
City: Zagreb
description: Looks like a solid all-rounder option with a pretty extensive beer menu

name: Caffe bar "Legend Riders"
description:
City: Zagreb
description: We try to give the Caffe Bars a chance but so many are so bland. This one at least has a distinct theme. Rock music and biking. Fairly extensive drinks selection too.

name: Vintage Industrial Bar
description:
City: Zagreb
description: An attempt at a ruin bar, perhaps not spontaneous enough in design, but nevertheless spacious and atmospheric looking.

name: Hendrick's garden
description:
City: Zagreb
description: Already a cult venue, this twee wonderworld focuses on the outdoor attractions with a treehouse, hedges and plenty to explore. Looks very distinct.

name: Sunshine Inn
description:
City: Zagreb
description: Caffe Bar, for sure, but this one has an integral 1960s design, darts and pool, and overall v highly rated for a neighbourhood type pub of this kind.

name: Mátra Borozó
description:
City: Budapest
description: All information indicates this is an old-school wine bar, a throwback to the past. Simple, homely and affordable. Unchanged despite the chaos around it. Wonderfully well reviewed - who would have though it? Beer also available

name: Möve im Felsenkeller
description:
City: Berlin
description: Venerable and cool-looking little pub, the kind Germans like to call Laden (or shop), some nice original features.

name: Libo Café
description:
City: Malaga
description: A cafe in an extraordinary baroque venue.

name: The Magazine Hotel
description:
City: Wallasey
description: An atmospheric-looking coastal hotel-pub with some trad features, cosy surroundings and occasional live music performances. Down to earth, don't expect anything flash.

name: Trädgården
description:
City: Stockholm
description: Ruin-bar/clutterful designed club/party venue.
