description: Pleasingly ungentrified rustic country pub with tiled floor and chunky wooden furnishings. Pleasant exterior in rural setting. Very recently attached to a working farm. Timeless taproom. Robinsons beers.

name: The Ale House
description:
City: Horwich
description: Well executed looking Ale House specialising in Bank Top Brewery beers. A simple effective format with plenty of keg/bottle options as well. Good reviews.

name: The Beehive Inn
description:
City: Maplebeck
description: A potential 10/10 here. Looks absolutely wonderful. Smaller than normal country inn with intimate feel, classic exposed beams and personal touches. Very well reviewed.

name: The Swan & Railway
description:
City: Wigan 
description: Grade II listed historic pub with recent sympathetic refurbishment. Ale focused with late Victorian stylings. Leather upholstered bench seats, cut glass, varnished wood, etc.

name: The Victoria Arms Worton
description:
City: Worton
description: Currently unclear as to its future, but this looks like one of the final dying breed of unchanged country inns in Yorkshire. Naturally, it looks homely, rustic and magnificent in that way only places that have clearly been lived in and love for a long time can have.

name: Ring O' Bells Inn
description:
City: Lower Stretton
description: Attractive ungentrified village pub with low ceiling, exposed beams, leather upholstered seating, carpets and real fire.

name: The Exeter Arms
description:
City: Derby
description: While someone tarted up, this pub retains a degree of its historic character and what new decoration there is has been reasonably sympathetic. While foodie it is clear there are several side rooms and a drinks-focused bar area all of which look very good. Well reviewed.

name: Malt Shovel
description:
City: Spondon
description: Unspoilt village pub with some rustic touches and a homely layout. Very well reviewed for the food, ales and genteel atmosphere. On CAMRA's national inventory of interiors.

name: The Wheatsheaf
description:
City: Sutton Leach
description: Known as 'The Wheaty', the walls are filled with rugby/football memorabilia, plates and trinkets creating quite a distinctive impression. The interior is homely with upholstered bench seating and carpets. Well reviewed both for ales and food.

name: The Anchor Inn
description:
City: Kegworth
description: Riverside pub that has retained its character and kept its drinking/old school pub features despite introducing meals.

name: Limeburners Arms
description:
City: Nether Kellet
description: A really smashing looking country pub with simple homely decor, not trying to impress some foodies or out of towners. Authentic. Occasional live music, dartboard, fire.

name: The White Swan
description:
City: Melbourne
description: Characterful village pub with attracting red seating and low slung beams. The odd negative Reviews seem to concern the Landlord. On CAMRA's national inventory of interiors.

name: Travellers Rest, Alpraham
description:
City: Alpraham
description: A survivor, in the same family for decades, friendly and welcoming, traditional offerings in period surroundings listed on CAMRA's national inventory. Bowling green garden. Unspoilt and one of a near extinct species of country pub. Usually open evenings only.

name: Chequers Inn
description:
City: Ticknall
description: Must go down among many of the great unspoilt pubs in England. Carpets, fireplace, exposed beams, cosy looking. Real ales (including Bass). Local life. Very well reviewed.

name: Kings Arms
description:
City: Haskayne
description: Gloriously unspoilt small town boozer with carpets, brasses, exposed beams, fireplace and attracting bar area. Looks homely and cosy. Very well reviewed. Occasional live music.

name: The Guest House
description:
City: Southport
description: Attractive and well executed backstreet pub with mock tudor frontage, tiled walls and stained glass. Some nice side rooms and leather seating. Well reviewed.

name: The White Lion, Rempstone
description:
City: Rempstone
description: Community pub brought back to life. On CAMRA's national inventory of interiors with a sympathetically decorated interior. Modern and pleasant looking patio. Clearly run with lots of passion and excellent reviews. Looks interesting, though photos are thin on the ground.

name: Dew Drop Inn
description:
City: Hathern
description: Revived pub with heritage features on CAMRA's national inventory of interiors. Looks to be a drinks-focused alehouse with a timeless stripped back appearance.

name: The Prince Arthur
description:
City: Liverpool
description: Looks like a very cosy drinking den with cosy tiled bar on CAMRA's inventory of interiors, though also very likely to be uber-local. Some mixed reviews on that front.

name: Wheatsheaf
description:
City: Louth
description: Typically small and quaint Lincolnshire pub that has retained some character. Please note during Covid there have been closures.

name: The Three Horse Shoes
description:
City: Whitwick
description: Unclear information whether it is open but a couple of recent reviews suggest it is back. Unspoilt local in a coalmining village.

name: The Red Lion
description:
City: Rudgeley
description: Very popular 3 room pub focused on ales and drinking generally rather than dining. On CAMRA's national inventory and reviews confirm a cosy homely interior.

name: Masons Arms, Strawberry Bank
description:
City: Strawberry Bank

description: While the exterior has been well and truly ruined by THE GREY PAINT and the pub mainly relies on food and the beautiful views on the terrace, inside you'll find a not yet ruined bar area with a thick carpet, fireplace, chunky tables, blackened beams and real ales.

name: The Swan
description:
City: Newport
description: Old fashioned small town pub with preserved rustic charm. Upholstered seating, fireplace, communal layout. Naturally frequented by elderly domino players.

name: Turf Tavern
description:
City: Bloxwich
description: Preserved and intact boozer 'like stepping back in time' that has remained in the same family for generations. Looks a one-off. Unlikely to be everyone's cup of tea but we are interested.

name: The Dog & Gun
description:
City: Earl Shilton

description: Mock Tudor pub from the 30s which has retained many fittings and its original layout. These days well loved despite its old-timer appearance. Could be worth a look.

name: Spring Cottage
description:
City: Bloxwich
description: Pictures thin on the ground but seems to be a very traditional old pub/ale house and one that's in CAMRA's national inventory of interiors.

name: The Manor Arms
description:
City: Rushall
description: Canalside pub that looks like a must-visit. Blackened beams, red upholstered seating and period bar area that seems to be without a counter. Quirky. On CAMRA's inventory of national interiors.

name: The Queens Head
description:
City: Barwell
description: Cracking looking market town inn with original siderooms off a central bar. Tiled floor, heritage hung artwork, upholstered seating. Communal feel.

name: The Pretty Bricks
description:
City: Walsall
description: Named after its glazed brick frontage, original features remain in this survivor of a pub that seems to have the community at its heart.

name: The Vine Inn
description:
City: Wednesfield
description: Exceptionally well reviewed pub featuring an interior of quote "National importance" according to CAMRA. Certainly an old fashioned well preserved ale house with a good selection. Looks good.

name: Colomendy Arms
description:
City: Cadole
description: A simple small 2-roomed ale house focused on drinking and chatting. Everything is quite stripped back with some stone features and a preserved bar area. Looks social with local life. Exceptionally well reviewed.

name: White Lion Inn
description:
City: Glan-yr-afon
description: A throwback, barely changed and well lived in old cottage with real fire, comfy seating and all the ungentrified comforts and welcome. Reviews speak of local life, and perhaps not appreciating this as much as they ought to be. Open evenings during the week.

name: Fox Inn
description:
City: Ysceifiog
description: Beautiful country inn with much of the rural charm intact, not turned into a dining room.

name: The White Horse Inn
description:
City: Cilcain
description: Very pleasant looking village pub that hasn't turned itself into a bland grey or beige dining room just yet. Plenty of charm, a historic cottage that's on CAMRA's national inventory of interiors. Well reviewed.

name: The Stile Inn
description:
City: Wolverhampton
description: Some charm in this backstreet boozer with the odd preserved fitting and a nicely done up beer garden. Polish dishes on offer and a mixed community crowd. Well reviewed.

name: The Rose & Crown
description:
City: Graianrhyd
description: Beautiful and cosy with open fire, traditional unspoiled pub. With a friendly, welcoming landlord. Very well reviewed. Looks excellent, a dying breed. Open late afternoons and evenings during the week.

name: The Old Dungeon Ghyll
description:
City: Great Langdale

description: Incredible clifftop backdrop to this hotel, but for drinkers, head to the Huker's bar converted from an old cow shed and on CAMRA's national inventory of interiors. Think exposed beams and uncomplicated furniture for hikers to get refreshed.

name: Waggon & Horses
description:
City: Oldbury
description: Looks the archetypal 'proper pub' with preserved wooden fittings and bench seating.

name: The Woodman Inn
description:
City: Shrewsbury
description: Well-reviewed and reputed ale house with some preserved fittings, but clearly a hub for the community and strong social ties here too. Update - Visited February 2025. A brewer's Tudor style 1960s refit is characterful with segregated bar, lounge and fireplace, friendly service and wide range of ales. Need to go back another time when busier in order to determine a full inclusion. (Added February 2025)

name: Bell Harborne
description:
City: Harborne
description: Overlooking a church green and old tower, the exterior is one of the most typical English scenes you could wish to see. Inside much seems to remain with blackened timber beams, albeit slightly opened out. Looks a decent option though.

name: The Jolly Sailor
description:
City: Whitburn

description: The grey exterior misleads as to the preserved CAMRA inventory-inscribed interior inside that remains homely and cosy by the looks of things. A well loved 'olde worlde' pub.

name: The White Swan
description:
City: Greenside
description: Information thin on the ground other than it being in CAMRA's national inventory of interiors for preserved features and being a 'cracking traditional old pub'.

name: Red Lion Hotel
description:
City: Llansannan
description: The parlour bar looks a must visit with a cured settle around a range fireplace. Service via a hatch. The scene looks positively medieval - in a good way.

name: Case Is Altered
description:
City: Hatton
description: Possible 10/10. Outstanding example of a country inn with low beamed bar, fireplace and preserved features and arrangement noted on CAMRA's national inventory of interiors. Looks great and is terrifically well reviewed.

name: The Crown Inn
description:
City: Llanfihangel
description: Grade II listed country inn. These pubs are vanishing quick so visit while you can. Concentrates on beer and conversation, albeit the setting outside is distractingly idyllic.

name: The Somerville Arms
description:
City: Leamington Spa

description: Lovely looking understated pub with warm colours and a social setting. Some live music. CAMRA noted.

name: Cain Valley Hotel
description:
City: Llanfyllin
description: An unchanged hotel bar that has lasted since the 60s with full height wood pannelling reputedly from a ship.

name: Bowling Green Inn
description:
City: Stoke Prior

description: Adjoined railway cottages near a canal form the buildings housing this traditional, rather genteel pub that seems to specialise in the social and communal aspect - all the better. On CAMRA's national inventory of interiors.

name: Albion Hastings
description:
City: Hastings

description: An old fashioned bar that has had the full works done to it. Sympathetic renovation but it remains to be seen if some of the charm has washed away in the process.

name: Cinque Ports Arms
description:
City: Hastings
description: Still plenty of charm remaining in this mock tudor pub, with attractive cosy hues, wooden panels and leather seating. Some classic ales from the region too.

name: The Star Inn
description:
City: Old Heathfield

description: Beautiful and distinctive old country inn with standout inglenook fireplace and some personal touches that are quirky without being tacky.

name: The Red Lion
description:
City: Snargate
description: Visit before it's gone. One of the vanishing truly traditional unspoilt village pubs left in the UK. On CAMRA's national inventory as a pub of national importance. For how much longer though? (Added July 2021)

name: Blackboys Inn
description:
City: Blackboys
description: Terrific unspoilt inn with candlelit tables, upholstered red leather bench seats in niches, and an intimate feel with plenty of wood, red and warm candle light. On CAMRA's national inventory of interiors. (Added July 2021)

name: The Plough & Harrow
description:
City: Litlington
description: While the place has gone foody, they have spared the famous snug, kept a characterful bar area and overall inside does not look too ruined at all. A potential option. (Added July 2021)

name: Prince of Wales
description:
City: Newhaven
description: Spectacularly preserved faineced frontage, and thankfully the interior of the pub lives up to it on this occasion. A well preserved long bar with stools and bench seating opposite the long room. Well reviewed, drinks focused boozer.

name: The Lewes Arms
description:
City: Lewes
description: While clearly foodie, the small 3 room layout with snug seating appeals and there is some visible character remaining that has a Georgian ale house feel to it.

name: The Hatch Inn
description:
City: Coleman's Hatch

description: Certainly foodie but an undeniably beautiful setting with slate fronted cottage, climbing ivy, moving into a black beamed pub with chunky tables. Perhaps a couple of more pubby areas in and around the bar. Perhaps one for after a hike.

name: The Coach and Horses
description:
City: Danehill
description: Thankfully the bar area and immediate rooms remain intact and unspoilt with a simple rustic country charm. Of course, the place heavily relies on food.

name: Old House
description:
City: Ightham
description: Be warned, there is no pub signage, but this is well worth seeking out for a timewarp of a country pub with an almost classic combination of decor, layout and focus. Visit before it goes for good (Added July 2021)

name: Bear Inn
description:
City: Faversham
description: One of the historic survivors. Grade II listed. A relatively unspoilt town boozer with retro frontage leading into a small pub. 3 drinking spaces and plenty of pieces of decor and old fittings to enjoy, even if they have started slightly positioning this towards the moneyed set.

name: Ship Inn Southwick
description:
City: Southwick
description: Not a pub that will appeal to all, but with its intact 1960s interior, a sort of ship-like cabin with wooden panels and lamps keeps every super intimate. Worth a look for those who like that sort of thing. (Added July 2021)

name: Half Moon Inn
description:
City: Cheriton Fitzpaine

description: A rare treasure, unspoilt village pub exuding character from times passed. Wonky fittings, exposed beams, homely additions, the works. Go before it vanishes. Added (July 2021)

name: Bridge Inn
description:
City: Topsham
description: When we say homely and unspoilt British pub, this is an archetype. Run by the same family for over a century, this grade II listed pub looks a classic and hasn't been given wholly over to food. Excellent reviews. (Added July 2021)

name: The Blue Flame Inn
description:
City: Nailsea
description: Terrific country inn that has focused on homespun charm rather than dining room mediocrity. Skittles, books, boardgames and calm local life in a fabulous looking spot. (Added July 2021)

name: The New Inn
description:
City: Llandewi-Brefi
description: An unspoilt timelessness to the place. A true village boozer and community hub. Good reviews tell of a warm welcome and local life. Appearance shows a 40s style corner bar, stone walls and simple furniture.

name: Bluebell Inn
description:
City: Llangurig
description: A throwback pub that evokes post-war pubgoing with simple seating, a communal layout, low ceilings and bags of local life. Notable fixtures such as wood pannelling and settles listed on CAMRA's national inventory. (Added July 2021)

name: The Mount Inn
description:
City: Llanidloes
description: Ungentrified village pub with low ceilings, blackened beams, pool table, carpets, cushioned bench seating, some original settles, fireplace, Bass signage out front, almost as though time stopped. (Added July 2021)

name: Y Llew Coch - The Red Lion
description:
City: Dinas Mawddwy

description: Fantastic views to be had out front, while inside you'll find an unspoilt, if unspectacular warm welcoming country inn that's terrifically well reviewed. Popular with hikers and bikers. (Added July 2021)

name: Tafarn Y Plu
description:
City: Llanystumdwy
description: Terrific looking pub that has married well preserved homely character with good quality up to date drinks selection. (Added July 2021)

name: New Cross Inn
description:
City: Court Henry

description: Very very unprepossessing and almost derelict looking pebbledashed exterior makes way for an absolutely classic frozen in time isolated pub that's close to 1 in 10,000. (Added July 2021)

name: Etxeberria
description:
City: San Sebastien
description: An eclectic bar with handwritten notes, old bottles and personal touches. Chaotic and thus charming. 22 taps of beers covering Basque, Spanish, Belgian and German, not to mention cider, vermouth and cocktails

name: Bar Desy
description:
City: San Sebastien
description: Twinning tapas with craft beer, not a bad idea. But wait, this isn't a brand new squeaky clean soulless venue. Enjoy a classic wooden counter and some trad fittings with a bit of history and charm. Very well-reviewed (Added July 2021)

name: Corner House
description:
City: Barnstaple
description: An appropriate name for this corner boozer. Preserved wood fittings in this drinking den, good reviews for its friendly atmosphere. On CAMRA's national inventory of interiors. (Added July 2021)

name: Ye Olde Globe Inn
description:
City: Berrynarbor
description: Unspoilt homely country inn with rustic seating, personal touches. A free house, naturally. Visit before it disappears forever. (Added July 2021)

name: The Thatched Inn
description:
City: Chambercombe
description: This pub name can be taken literally! Beautiful inside, tastefully and carefully restored and maintained while still allowing the historic character to shine through. Interesting layout, wood fittings, carpets, warm glow, intimate space. (Added July 2021)

name: The Castle Inn
description:
City: Lydford
description: A very good example of an unspoilt country inn with the bar and dining areas nicely personalised with rugs and hung artwork, off-centre beams and low ceilings. Rustic, personal, looks very good and well reviewed (Added July 2021)

name: Eliot Arms Square and Compass
description:
City: Tregadillet
description: If only these pubs didn't need food service to make a living! Despite that, the blackened interior with brasses fixed to the bar area is impressive, and wall space is filled up with framed artwork, clocks and niknaks. Very evocative looking venue. (Added July 2021)

name: Napoleon Inn
description:
City: Boscastle
description: A historic feel to the place with blackened beams and preserved bar area with some interesting siderooms. Looks reasonably atmospheric and rustic, genteel in places. Very well reviewed. (Added July 2021)

name: Black Horse Inn
description:
City: Cranham
description: Rustic 1600s village pub with log fires, real ale, cider and a genteel mid-brown look to the small rooms. The poor reviews of 2017ish seem to have died away and better reviews lately. Worth a look, we think (Added July 2021)

name: The Lamb Inn
description:
City: Devizes
description: The typical 'olde worlde' reviews stem from preserved interior listed on CAMRA's national inventory. No food, a drinks-focused town pub with a degree of character to it and die-hard local fans. Looks interesting. (Added July 2021)

name: The Plough in Prestbury
description:
City: Prestbury
description: Some truly classic country inn features in this 1700s thatched cottage with large stone fireplace, blackened beams and pewter tankards hung above the bar, simple genteel furnishings. Well reviewed, worth trying. (Added July 2021)

name: The Locomotive
description:
City: Wellingborough
description: Simple backstreet boozer with benches opposite a fine bar with interesting fittings and classic tankards hung above. Plenty of ales and local life to be found. Near the train tracks, hence the name. Very well reviewed. (Added July 2021)

name: The Old Cherry Tree
description:
City: Great Houghton
description: Looks to be a strong example of a well preserved and as yet unspoilt village pub with personal homely touches, fireplace, rustic furniture, blackened beams and on CAMRA's national inventory of interiors. Well reviewed. (Added July 2021)

name: Savile Arms
description:
City: Eakring
description: Rare example of a drinks focused village pub still operating, though that has much to do with the Sam Smiths ownership. Inside is a familiar super stripped back historic pub. WARNING: Sam Smith's pub, so love-or-hate it. Quite well reviewed for a pub under this ownership. (Added July 2021)

name: The Coach & Horses Inn
description:
City: Tilney St Lawrence
description: Reasonable-looking unspoilt pub out on its own. Decent reviews.  (Added July 2021)

name: The Star Inn
description:
City: Harbottle
description: Stone Inn that has diversified to stay alive, acting as a newsagents and post-office as well as a pub. Slight doubts whether it has had its historic core ruined by GREY PAINT but inconclusive, and the fantastic reviews tip the balance. (Added July 2021)

name: The Grey Bull Inn
description:
City: Wark
description: Not to be confused with the differently shaded Bull directly next door, this is a drinking den and not a foodie pub, that has wood panels and a well-preserved core of some character. Well reviewed for local life and atmosphere, though not going to be everybody's cup of tea. (Added July 2021)

name: The Star Inn
description:
City: Netherton
description: WARNING: Very restricted opening hours. You will need to enquire locally regarding when to visit.

A classic near-extinct throwback pub in a timewarp. Building also serves as a post-office and shop like so many dying rural communities. (Added July 2021)

name: Railway Tavern
description:
City: Jedburgh
description: A potential love or hate pub, this has kept its 60s era fittings and ensemble well. Basic local's boozer focused on drinks. Very popular with locals, only come if you have the nerves and are up for an experience. (Added July 2021)

name: Ancrum Cross Keys
description:
City: Ancrum
description: Despite some pretentions to foodiness, the central appeal comes from its classic intact tavern fittings with fireplace, wrought iron-legged tables, mirror panels and local life. well reviewed. (Added July 2021)

name: Victoria Hotel
description:
City: Great Harwood
description: Looks a neat little boozer with Victorian/Edwardian tiles and wood fixtures, simple upholstered bench seating, live music, some personal touches, a bit of character. (Added July 2021)

name: The Heaton Tap
description:
City: Newcastle
description: Small but attractive little craft beer bar with wooden tables and a row of fridges, along with some tap options. (Added July 2021)

name: Waggon and Horses
description:
City: South Reston
description: Well maintained 'brewer's tudor' style pub with wood panels, exposed beams and carpets, with some stained glass. Old features such as a 'smoke room' . In CAMRA's national inventory of interiors. Looks a decent roadside inn. (Added July 2021)

name: Coach & Horses Hotel
description:
City: Greasby
description: A village boozer attractive in its simplicity. Popular with musicians. Well preserved interior with settles and exposed beams. Very positively reviewed. On CAMRA's national inventory of interiors. (Added July 2021)

name: The Fox & Hounds
description:
City: Barnston
description: Homely, genteel and slightly twee decor. A series of characterful rooms including a smoke room. On CAMRA's inventory of interiors. Looks pretty good though some of it has been taken up with food, inevitably. Good reviews. (Added July 2021)

name: The Wheatsheaf Inn
description:
City: Raby
description: Converted cattleshed/barn with timber beams and thatched roof. While there is a large and not particularly characterful atrium area for dining, they appear to have preserved the bar area and snug rooms nicely. On CAMRA's national inventory of interiors. Well reviewed. (Added July 2021)

name: The Fox & Hounds
description:
City: Dalehouse
description: An almost caricature village pub set in a dell by the riverside, with the rustic and genteel surroundings you'd expect. Instant comfort and cosiness, some local life. Looks to be a little gem. Visit before these disappear for good. (Added July 2021)

name: The Lamplighter
description:
City: St Helier
description: Charming old city pub with attractive red frontage with greenery, and hops fixed above the bar inside, tankards fixed to the beams. Not messed around with, clearly to the delight of locals who give this good reviews. On CAMRA's national inventory of interiors. (Added July 2021)

name: Ye Olde Cider Bar
description:
City: Newton Abbot
description: Rustic charm, real cider 'from the wood', traditional historic fittings. Sheer simplicity in its construction. Occasional live music and simple snacks + sandwiches offered. Very well loved and one of the few true original cider houses left. On CAMRA's national inventory of interiors. (Added July 2021)

name: Teign Cellars
description:
City: Newton Abbot
description: Very nice looking ale house with some homely touches and strong selection of beers. Pool table, basic meals, occasional live music. Well reviewed. (Added July 2021)

name: British Lion
description:
City: Devizes
description: A well kept town pub that's a good example of keeping with the times while preserving its history. Low beams, some personal touches to the decor, and decent looking spots to sit in. On CAMRA's national inventory of interiors. Well reviewed. (Added July 2021)

name: The Weavers Bar
description:
City: Strathaven
description: By Scottish standards a reasonably well preserved town pub with attractive bar area, low beams etc. Clearly a community hub and most likely atmospheric for it. Very well reviewed. (Added July 2021)

name: The Berry
description:
City: Walmer
description: Unmistakably brightly painted exterior. Real ale heaven inside. Hops pinned above the bar, fireplace, overall genteel alehouse that receives rave reviews. On CAMRA's national inventory of interiors. (Added July 2021)

name: The Final Whistle
description:
City: Southwell
description: A terrific 'station pub' , albeit the trains have long gone and the route turned into a nature trail. The building is magnificent with some of the original station features intact. Inside it is spacious yet still somehow intimate with exposed brickwork, wood fittings, tiled corridors and some side rooms. On CAMRA's national inventory of interiors and wins local awards for real ale offerings. Well reviewed. (Added July 2021)

name: Hostinec Hlučál
description:
City: Pusta Rybna
description: The epitome of a throwback country pub that has decided to stick in the 1970s. In Czechia that means oddly twee decor, sparse surroundings, great beer and a folk community of people. Could be good. Well reviewed, at least. (Added July 2021)

name: The Black Lion
description:
City: High Roding
description: A timberframe pub that has tried to both modernise with signage and food options while remaining a personalised boozer. Never the most easy mix, but it looks to have been executed well. The reviews seem to agree. On CAMRA's national inventory of interiors. We shall see... (Added July 2021)

name: The Cross Keys
description:
City: Harpenden
description: Unspoilt pub with a bit of a local town atmosphere. Fireplace, aged bench seats, stripped back and rustic by modern standards. On CAMRA's national inventory of interiors. We shall see. (Added July 2021)

name: The Farriers Arms
description:
City: St Albans
description: Lovely genteel alehouse with attractive midbrown wood. The panels both on the floor, bench and sealings give a slightly cabin like feel, with the lamp lights. The more negative reviews appear to be from quite some time ago. On CAMRA's national inventory of interiors. (Added July 2021)

name: The Miners Standard
description:
City: Winster
description: 17th century stone pub. Large fireplace, exposed beams and gnarled edges. Dartboard, pool table, low ceiling. On CAMRA's national inventory of interiors. Decent reviews. Worth a look. (Added July 2021)

name: The Redoubt
description:
City: Wakefield
description: Very old fashioned pub which will probably be a love or hate it affair. Several individual rooms (4 snugs) so a fair chance of escaping from any idiots. Mixed reviews so will need to suck it and see. On CAMRA's national inventory of interiors. (Added July 2021)

name: The White Horse Inn
description:
City: Friendly
description: Attractive and unspoilt homely interior with distinctive layout. On CAMRA's national inventory. Must be worth a look. (Added July 2021)

name: Duke of Wellington
description:
City: Heywood
description: While the main bar area is not unattractive, the main event is the baronial lounge room opposite with carved wood interior, fitted curved bench seats, fireplace, lamp lights and stained glass that looks magnificent. On CAMRA's national inventory of interiors. (Added July 2021)

name: Rodinny Pivovar 713
description:
City: Hradec Kralove
description: A dinky but cosy little taproom for this local family brewery. Looks decent. (July 2021)

name: The Brushmakers Arms
description:
City: Oulton
description: Promising stripped back ale house that's been freehold owned for 35+ years by the same landlord. Distinctive lived-in decor, and all about drinks not meals. Relatively homely decor and furniture, all about local life and conversation. Sounds promising.

name: Sir Robert Peel
description:
City: Tamworth
description: Well reputed alehouse with intimate surroundings and stripped back wood panel format. Characterful bar area.

name: Bodega Montferry
description:
City: Barcelona
description: Well reviewed traditional bar, still relatively close to the city centre and not yet extinguished. Some character behind the bar, with barrels, ceiling fans and the classic aluminium counter.

name: Cusack's
description:
City: Dublin
description: A decent looking all rounder with wood panelled ceiling, some stained glass, walls covered with artwork and crests.

name: The Doric
description:
City: Edinburgh
description: Wood panelled bar with bistro upstairs, pub downstairs, Looks to still have character. Real ale and whiskies available.

name: The Dog House
description:
City: Edinburgh
description: A quirky and funky cluttered setting with offbeat decor and highly personalised.

name: The Who'd Ha' Thought It
description:
City: Rochester
description: Excellent looking corner neighbourhood pub with original signage outside and preserved interior on CAMRA's national inventory. Reviews tell of a friendly old-school pub with good range of ales.

name: The All Nations Inn
description:
City: Madeley
description: Long-standing home-brewer pub with rustic feel inside and out. Farmhouse type interior with old tiled floor, beams and simple seating. Fireplace warming genteel welcoming and social surroundings. Excellent reviews and it looks lovely.

name: Royds arms
description:
City: Spotland
description: Traditional riverside boozer on CAMRA's national inventory of interiors. Information thin on the ground but seems promising.

name: Flower Of The Valley
description:
City: Buckley
description: Stripped back traditional pub that is on CAMRA's national inventory of interiors but information is thin on the ground. Believed to be a Sam Smith's pub so that comes with a clear WARNING that it will not be everyone's cup of tea.

name: Half Moon Inn Belchamp
description:
City: Belchamp St Paul
description: A classic English pub of yore, an idyllic, beautiful thatched cottage leads into an ancient rustic inn with timber frames and beams, cosy corners, carpet, fireplace. The sort of venue that has been turned into bland dining rooms across England, but still here appears to serve drinkers too.

name: The Rifle Volunteers
description:
City: Maidstone
description: Excellently well reviewed town tavern with cask ales on rotation, dart board, music nights and a great sense of community about it. Looks very nice.

name: La Cebada
description:
City: Zaragoza
description: Lovely looking pub with rustic wooden seating, homely and personalised with Belgian beer.

name: The Griffin Inn
description:
City: Shustoke
description: Excellent looking country inn with large outdoor area and rural views. Inside, blackened beams and traditional pub ephemera hold sway. Stone bar and fireplace. Tiled floor. Cushioned bench seats. Looks good and very well reviewed.

name: Crown Inn
description:
City: Oakengates
description: Splendid-looking community pub with enhanced outdoor area, space for live music and comedy nights. Rotating range of real ales and decent European bottles in the fridge. Decor simple and homely inside. Very well reviewed.

name: King Edward VII
description:
City: Guide
description: A 'locals' pub that is friendly and community led. Standout features are the Edwardian pub layout with separate rooms, tiles. Dartboard and fireplace, all a bit of a throwback, seemingly in a good way.

name: The Glen View Inn
description:
City: Cornholme
description: Seems to be an unpretentious classic Lancashire village pub with cosy homely interior, pub grub, friendly welcome. Outstanding reviews.

name: Crooked Billet Worsthorne
description:
City: Worsthorne
description: Looks to be a dynamic community pub with attractive hatched windows and stone frontage, homely interior with beams and nice bar area. Lots of events. Very well reviewed.

name: The Cannon
description:
City: Brompton
description: Excellent looking neighbourhood pub that seems very homely with attractive beer garden and intimate interior. Frontage has green faienced brick and Truman brewery signage. Looks to be at the heart of the community and drinks focused.

name: Carpenters Arms
description:
City: Eastling
description: Excellent looking village pub with low beams and greenery. Some food focus inevitably, but some community interaction and live events too. Genteel brick exterior with attractive signage.

name: The Three Chimneys
description:
City: Biddenden
description: 15th century pub with sympathetic wooden refurb inside, lamp lights and real fire. Harvey's beers, Inevitably much is taken up with dining, sadly, but explore the pub to find lovely off-centre door frames and nice crackled bits of history. Worth a look. (Added August 2021)

name: The King's Head
description:
City: Leicester
description: Attractive black beamed narrow pub with comfortable seating and local life. Perhaps a little bit lacking in distinctive character to stand out but an enjoyable and reliable option. Some nice snack food available for pennies such as samosas and bhajis. Black Country ales.

name: The Two-Tailed Lion
description:
City: Leicester
description: An attractive little pub with hanging baskets outfront and characterful branding, however on our visit it felt a bit plain and lacking character in the absence of customers. With some more attention paid to the decor we may find ourselves won over. Check out the upstairs room as well.

name: The Rose & Crown Inn (Eli’s)
description:
City: Huish Episcopi

description: Absolutely cracking looking country pub, untampered with, comfortable homely boozer in a stone building. Popular with bikers occasionally. A lovely warm pub of old that we look forward to visiting - potential 9/10. (Added August 2021)

name: The Cock Inn
description:
City: Brent Eleigh

description: Lovely looking homely country pub of relatively modest size. Personalised exterior and interior. A beautiful throwback with smoke from the chimney and classic pub interior with tiled floor, worn furniture, dartboard, fireplace. Not a dining room, and actual pub. We would love to visit to verify. (Added August 2021)

name: The Red Lion
description:
City: Sedburgh
description: Pleasantly stolid Northern town tavern with stone grimness offset by roaring hearth and homely surroundings. Looks reasonably nice and unspoilt, Jennings brewery associated. (Added August 2021)

name: The Gryphon
description:
City: Bristol
description: Warning: Metal pub. Just a very good looking well reviewed metal pub, in a stark wedge shaped building. Beer clips on walls and ceiling, and of course you will either love or hate the music, there's no getting away from it. (Added August 2021)

name: The Gypsy Rover
description:
City: Redcar
description: A reason to come to Redcar? But please, really. Well, yes, it seems pretty convincing on the evidence of this well put together micropub full of personal touches, homely decor and that uncanny valley effect you get with DIY efforts on a budget. Adds to the charm. Bags of local life on offer. Whether that's your - or our - thing remains to be scene. (Added August 2021)

name: The Strawberry Hall
description:
City: Dublin
description: Cracking riverside inn that still has its historic unspoilt dark brown interior. (Added August 2021)

name: Bodega Sa Xarxa
description:
City: Lloret de Mar

description: Looks like an enjoyably trad drinks-focused boozer with wooden barrels lining the walls and a stripped back old-school format. (Added August 2021)

name: Hospůdka Na Vyhlídce
description:
City: Hrčava
description: A classic unspoilt country Czech pub known for its good views, hearty cooking and hint of Polish influence. (added August 2021)

name: The Borough Arms
description:
City: Crewe
description: Traditional low-ceilinged ale house that has a wide range of cask + keg options with Belgian beers available, in relatively cosy wooden, carpeted surroundings. A free house. (Added August 2021)

name: The Colmore
description:
City: Birmingham
description: Opulent restored/refurbished modern classical pub by Thornbridge/Pivovar joint venture, in the similar standard of The Banker's Cat and The Market Cat in Leeds and York respectively. On our first visit it was pleasant but not conclusive in terms of deserving a place on our guide. (Added August 2021)

name: The Lamp Tavern
description:
City: Birmingham
description: Excellent looking traditional little pub with Irish leanings but focusing on the basics well rather than just sticking Guinness and Irish flags everywhere. Plenty of character and great reviews about Landlord Eddy. Folk music and singing, 'like being invited into someone's living room for a beer'. (Added August 2021)

name: Restaurant Na Brezance
description:
City: Prague
description: A local's place in the heart of the action in between Nove Mesto and Vinohrady. Affordable food but perhaps a little too plain to stand out on the guide. Anyway, it came close on a first try and we are willing to try it again.

name: Captains Bar
description:
City: Edinburgh
description: Intimate little pub with folk leanings and performances. The space of the room doesn't really lend itself to a communal experience however, while the decor is a little bland and touristy (not awful though by any means). Still well worth a look if it's music you're after. (Added February 2024)

name: Outro Lado
description:
City: Lisbon
description: Intimate beer bar in the Alfama with large selection in the Fridge. While the decor doesn't leap out, the general environment and atmosphere looks good, worth a try. Well reviewed. (added August 2021)

name: Courtney's Bar
description:
City: Killarney
description: Absolutely superb looking pub with an intimate and dark interior stylishly but sympathetically designed. Take us there tomorrow please. Very well reviewed. (Added August 2021)

name: Swan Bar
description:
City: Dublin
description: On Dublin's Victorian pub crawl, here is an attractive boozer with mosaic floor, mirror panels and dark wood, but more importantly a degree of character, comfortable seating space and local life. (Added August 2021)

name: Uva e Menta Café
description:
City: Trento
description: A reasonably attractive informal bar focused on artisan beers. Looks decent. Worth a try. (Added August 2021)

name: Sandy Bell's
description:
City: Edinburgh
description: A renowned music pub that may be firmly on the circuit, in terms of notoriety and traffic but nevertheless deserves a look. Excellent Reviews. (added August 2021)

name: The Magdala
description:
City: London
description: Impressive exampler of a tasteful refurb. Wood strip bar with lamplights, stained/leaded hatched windows, wooden floors. While food is clearly evident there appears enough space for drinkers too. (Added August 2021)

name: Queens Head
description:
City: Boreham
description: Characterful village pub with Gray & Sons link, brick bar, low ceilings and beams, pewter jugs, dartboard, and drinks focused rather than meals-focused. Attractive outdoor area with view of an old stone church. (Added August 2021)

name: Ma Murphys bar
description:
City: Bantry
description: One of those pubs in small town Ireland that operates or at least used to operate as a newsagents, so interesting shopfront and bar area. Some outdoor seating. Rave reviews. (Added August 2021)

name: MacCarthy's Bar
description:
City: Castletownbere
description: Excellent looking old Irish pub and shop with preserved features and a lot of character to the place. Cluttered bar with counter and what appears to be an old deli shelf. (Added August 2021)

name: Hand In Hand
description:
City: Brighton
description: A diamond, seemingly. Cosy little bunker with distinctive features and personal touches. For the area, quite unpretentious too and reasonably priced. Highly rated. (Added August 2021)

name: The Spotted Dog
description:
City: Birmingham
description: Excellent-looking Digbeth boozer with some nicely preserved features and distinctive character. As yet, not overly gentrified. Well reviewed. (Added August 2021)

name: The Old Contemptibles
description:
City: Birmingham
description: Nicholson's, so expect chain grind and bad prices, however a bit of charm remains in this high-ceilinged city tavern with war-themed paintings behind the bar (not in a Gammon Help For Heroes way). Not necessarily conclusive but a possible fallback option. (added August 2021)

name: Lottas Krog & Pub
description:
City: Umea
description: A well designed English style pub (including several cask ales on handpump) with some nautical touches to the decor, and a nice cosy interior. (Added August 2021)

name: Gröna Älgen
description:
City: Umea
description: A nice blend of modern and traditional keeping some cosy touches while also being quite sleek. It looks warm and welcoming. Good reviews and a big fridge of ales on offer. (Added August 2021)

name: De 12 apostels
description:
City: Ypres
description: Very attractive classic Belgian bar. While not the true evocative 'brown café', there is much to enjoy from the religious iconography on the walls, parquet floor and great range of Belgian ales. Well reviewed. (Added August 2021)

name: Fishguard Arms
description:
City: Fishguard
description: Excellent looking quirky little alehouse set up primarily for drinking. Personalised and cabin like with woodstrip ceiling, old furniture and tasteful decor. Looks excellent and the reviews seem to agree. (Added August 2021)

name: The Three Horseshoes
description:
City: Duton Hill
description: Really excellent looking homely pub with a collection of memorabilia bordering on a museum and an ungentrified personalised feel a far cry from the template dining rooms many country pubs have become. Great reviews. (added September 2021)

name: The Bell Inn
description:
City: Wendens Ambo
description: Looks an unspoilt village pub with a handsome outdoor area but beams and wooden furniture inside. Decent reviews and a sense of community to it. (added September 2021)

name: Hark To Bounty Inn
description:
City: Slaidburn
description: Unspoilt Northern village boozer in a 16th century coaching inn. Fireplace, low beams. Not dramatic but cosy and friendly looking, homely. Very well reviewed. (added September 2021)

name: Cross Guns Avoncliff
description:
City: Avoncliff
description: Classic country pub with riverside beer garden and blackened beams with brasses inside. Some grumbles on the reviews appear to relate to an isolated incident some time ago. Looks really nice. (Added September 2021)

name: The Village Freehouse
description:
City: Salisbury
description: Freehouse with train station ephemera and real ales. Very well reviewed with some personal touches, even if not all successful, certainly distinctive enough. (Added September 2021)

name: The Snug Micropub
description:
City: Carnforth
description: A rare station pub, and this is a little one. A real mishmash with office style ceiling tiles, lime green paint, curtains and attracting little wooden bar. But it seems to work really nicely. Very popular and brilliant reviews. Range of real ales. (Added September 2021)

name: The Beer Engine
description:
City: Newton St Cyres
description: Fantastic looking pub which serves both gastro and social needs. Railwayside inn with outdoor seating, homely interior with a mixture of local art and train based decor. Own brews. Incredible reviews. (added September 2021)

name: Ratty Arms
description:
City: Ravenglass
description: A station pub, really. Views of the the railway, informal atmosphere (though some food), fairly nice looking carpeted interior with beams and historical train ephemera on the wall. (added September 2021)

name: Codsall Station Pub
description:
City: Codsall
description: An excellent-looking, almost dreamlike station bar that is the kind of thing you'd desire at almost any station in the country. Warm and homely interior rooms with the usual station/railway ephemera but interesting other aspects like a gabled conservatory style section. Local beers, books, and a sense of community. This looks great. (added September 2021)

name: Charters Bar
description:
City: Peterborough
description: A decent Peterborough option, you say? Apparently yes! Charismatic ship setting and attractive riverside surroundings. Pleasant beamed interior, decent selection of ales and bottles. Occasional live events. (added September 2021)

name: Crown Wharf
description:
City: Stone
description: A new pub, although with Joule's at the helm you can expect a very careful makeover. It looks big and traditional with a refurbished warehouse type building, but sympathetic decor, Joules beers, canalside setting. Looks worth a try. (added September 2021)

name: Swan Inn Stone
description:
City: Stone
description: Yuk to the blue paint on the bar but yes to the fireplace, brickwork, exposed beams, live music, communal atmosphere and social buzz. The reviews tell it all. (added September 2021)

name: Ye Olde Albion
description:
City: Rowhedge
description: Unspoilt riverside pub which retains its rustic feel through authenticity rather than conceit. Some beer and cider delivered direct from the box, belgian ales, blackened beams. It does rather look magnificent. (add September 2021)

name: Café Lugosi's
description:
City: Haarlem
description: Vampiric dive bar that seems down and dirty enough to avoid being that kitsch. Great reviews. (Added September 2021)

name: Jack C's Bar
description:
City: Killarney
description: Local life and authentic characters to be found here at a well-rated Irish pub. (Added September 2021)

name: Curran's
description:
City: Dingle
description: Exceptionally well rated Irish pub. We visited and while it is a very interesting venue - a shop cum bar with locals gathered around the shop counter, we didn't feel especially welcome and were treated to some really unfunny craic about mask wearing despite that being the actual law and adhered to everywhere else at the time of the visit. Prepared to give it another few goes though. (added September 2021)

name: The Swan
description:
City: Bushey
description: A traditional worn in pub without pretensions or bland refits. Low ceilings, beams, wooden fixtures, looks very nice. Well reviewed (Added September 2021)

name: bar Konirna
description:
City: Prague
description: Hiding in plain sight, a fair priced well-reviewed cellar bar that's been an institution in Prague for a while.

name: Tigh an tSaorsaigh
description:
City: Ballyferriter
description: A homely pub with attractive bar area, jugs on hooks, etc, and simple wooden seating. Excellent reviews.

name: SAXENBERG
description:
City: Český Těšín
description: Minibrewery with a lovely garden and some shelter. Looks by far the most interesting venue this side of the river. Be careful to check opening hours. Wasn't open on our visit in October 2021, but was clearly there (Added September 2021)

name: Stolarnia. Pub
description:
City: Bielsko-Biała
description: Beautiful garden and relatively hidden away spot for summer drinks, while also cosy and homely inside (though nothing dramatic). Worth a look. (added September 2021)

name: Chmielowe podcienia
description:
City: Bielsko-Biała
description: Craft beer, underground/cellar style surroundings and lots of pickle jars at the bar, providing a slight twist. Worth a look. (Added September 2021)

name: Środek
description:
City: Bielsko-Biała
description: Craft beer in a low-ceilinged bar with  modern decor, perhaps not the standout feature. Remains to be seen if the company and the beers can compensate for the more impersonal surroundings. (added September 2021)

name: Sádrový ježek
description:
City: Ostrava
description: Bookish café leanings. Decent crowd and well reviewed. We enjoyed our visits in October 2021 but it didn't quite stick out as distinctive enough to make the grade. The same applied on our 2024 visit. It is still worth bearing in mind as offers a decent selection of Svijany beers.  (Updated October 2024)

name: Koldovna
description:
City: Olomouc
description: Characterful looking little corner pub with lots of reviews attesting to the atmosphere being a little different from the norm. Eclectic artwork on the wall. That's enough to get us excited. (added September 2021)

name: Jazz Tibet Club
description:
City: Olomouc
description: Bar with a long row of seats leading to a nicely lit stage for live music performances. Fairly exotic looking decor and overall holds the eye well on pictures. Decent reviews. Probably worth a look. (added September 2021)

name: LOCAL LOCAL PUB Industy
description:
City: Olomouc
description: A potentially useful find this end of the city. A craft beer bar yes, with faux-industrial bits and pieces, yes, but there are some personal touches too. Clearly above the normal standard of this sort of thing in the region. (added September 2021)

name: Pivni bar Azyl
description:
City: Liberec
description: What's this, an independent beer bar in Liberec with a bit of personalised flavour and community support? Quite the one off in a city of largely drab chain restaurants and ugly herna bars. Has to be worth a visit when in town. (Added October 2021)

name: Bohem Tap Room
description:
City: London
description: Tiny but beloved taproom out in the suburbs. Independent flair, almost universally well reviewed. (Added October 2021)

name: The Crooked Billet Free House
description:
City: Colney Heath

description: Homely pub with exposed beams, tiled floor and a genteel rustic appearance with cushioned seats on wooden furniture. Very well reviewed for its drinks and clearly personalised rather than full of chain pub adornments. (added October 2021)

name: The Villiers Arms
description:
City: Oxhey
description: High up in the 'proper pub' stakes, this pub has a personalised community feel with a real fireplace, pump clips, round bar area, traditional homely decor. Beer potentially not as interesting as many places, however it nevertheless achieves great reviews. (added October 2021)

name: The Dove
description:
City: Bury St Edmunds

description: A true neighbourhood pub with local life and community events including occasional live music. Homely and warm looking interior with upholstered seats and communal layout. Ale options look very nice too, of a trad leaning. Exceptionally well reviewed. (Added October 2021)

name: The Firkin Shed
description:
City: Boscombe
description: Cracking looking, highly personalised micropub with musical leanings. Intimate interior with the typical range of independent ales. Exceptionally well reviewed. (added October 2021)

name: The Wykeham Arms, Winchester
description:
City: Winchester
description: Excellent characterful looking interior with pewter jugs lining the walls and wood-fit bar. Personalised and seems to be well worth a look, potentially relatively posh, but this is Winchester. (added October 2021)

name: The British Grenadier
description:
City: Colchester
description: A classic down to earth and friendly neighbourhood pub with a community atmosphere. Ale-focused with exposed kegs and pump clips lining the walls. Communal seating. Looks warm and cosy too. Well reviewed. (added October 2021)

name: Schizofrenia Café
description:
City: Kraków
description: Not an area known for nightlife, this place seems to capture a certain something from different genres. The beer garden looks attractive and on point with plenty of greenery and fairlights. Inside there is the array of antique furniture and nik naks, with cellar brickwork. Some live events and food. On a visit in February 2022 we were taken by some of it but not convincingly enough to add it there and then. Some decorations perhaps a little banal and bland. We will return though. (added October 2021)

name: SPOKO
description:
City: Kraków
description: Contemporary craft beer/street food venue in Podgorze, an area which could use a place like this. On a visit in October we liked the location but the bar itself didn't stand out as being a must-visit. (added October 2021)

name: U Mariánského obrazu
description:
City: Prague
description: Pleasant and fairly pubby looking PU place. Whenever we go past it seems to be people socialising. Formal for Zizkov we suppose, but better than the usual diner options. Didn't wow us on our 1st visit, but like U Veverky, the food is decent, and as a place to have up your sleeve, it's pretty reliable. (Added April 2023)

name: The Orange Tree
description:
City: Baldock
description: Excellent traditional backstreet pub with simple wooden seating and genteel surroundings. Looks very nice. (added November 2021)

name: The Cob & Pen
description:
City: Rhyl
description: Surprisingy nice looking ungentrified but not scary or dilapidated pub. Very good reviews. (added November 2021)

name: The Cock
description:
City: Broom
description: Excellent traditional freehouse country pub with pub skittles, exposed casks behind the bar, community events,  (added November 2021)

name: The Congress Inn
description:
City: Longton
description: Unspoilt corner boozer known for real ale, live music. Looks to have a true community feel. (added November 2021)

name: BCM Craft Ale Bar
description:
City: Evesham
description: A truly uninspiring name obfuscates a terrific looking micropub in a timber frame building. Furnishings are sympathetic to the structure and it is very much a little hub of all things ale. Amazing reviews. (added November 2021)

name: Ya Bard craft beer
description:
City: Stratford-upon-Avon
description: The bar area seems a relatively unsuccessful use of space in this nice Georgian looking brick building, however there appears to be some backroom space with nice leather chairs and recovered signage. Obviously the beer will be terrific due to the micro-pub and craft format. We shall see overall, but tentatively adding this. (added November 2021)

name: Jim O' the Mills
description:
City: Drombane
description: One of the highest rated pubs in Dublin, Family run, essentially a family house and only open one night a week, which is invariably a get together with music, drinks and food. Looks incredible. (added November 2021)

name: Morans Of Mornington
description:
City: Mornington
description: Another well reputed traditional pub with excellent reviews. The interior looks something truly special with its wood panelling and deliberately preserved layout and decor. (added November 2021)

name: Storehouse Tourist Accommodation
description:
City: Rathanna
description: Also known as Osbourne's, this building serves as a pub too, though be wary of opening hours. Great reviews and national press attention for its traditional appeal. (added November 2021)

name: J O'Connell
description:
City: Skreen
description: Famous for its use in a Guinness advert, but time has really stood still in this place, a monument to times past but one that still seems to be keeping the fire burning. Looks excellent. (added November 2021)

name: Coachmakers Arms
description:
City: Hanley
description: A nice looking neighbourhood pub with a homely feel, some nooks and crannies too, piano, array of books and real ales. Looks promising (added November 2021)

Edit - on a 1st visit in January 2023 we thought this was a decent pub but needs another try to make our minds up. It is definitely on the tatty side, deliberately so, and service was friendly.

name: The Good Measure
description:
City: Bristol
description: Neighbourhood modern ale house with nice frontage and warm but relatively humdrum interior. Compensated for by the selection and friendly crowd by the look of it. (added November 2021)

name: Cervecería Vincer
description:
City: Gijon
description: Excellent characterful looking beer house with very good reviews, looks like a local institution. (added November 2021)

name: Cervecería La Abadía
description:
City: Gijon
description: A rather unusual format somewhere between a Spanish bodega and German gaststatte, something reflected in their offerings. A 1970s vibe to the interior. Worth a look for beer fans (added November 2021)

name: The Taggy Man
description:
City: Kirkby Stephen
description: The decor has slightly sterilised the place with a wash of that off-grey paint, but the layout helps keep a real coherence and the strong reviews suggest it is at least worth looking into. Real fire, food available (added November 2021)

name: Pivovar Lobeč
description:
City: Lobec
description: A restored historic brewery with a pub/taproom that displays the architecture well with sympathetic decor. Excellent reviews both for the beer, tours and pub, food available. We shall see. (added November 2021)

name: Nádražní restaurace Braník
description:
City: Branik
description: A real throwback historic station boozer that still has Branik as its tap option and a truly unpretentious down to earth feel, that's old enough to have developed a bit of personality too. All the same, it felt more of a lunch diner than a pub on our visit in 2023. Worth a look if you're around there. (Added 2021)

name: Old Orechovka
description:
City: Prague
description: Nice looking old pub and surprising location in rather grand building. Inside you'll find aged characterful wood panels, some mounted stags heads, piano, Staropramen beer and altogether informal type appearance. On our first visit in 2023 you could see some of the appeal but it didn't quite tip the balance for a full inclusion. Worth a try if you're in the area (added November 2021)

name: Pivní ambasáda
description:
City: Pardubice
description: A nice looking, warm wood, simple layout hospoda with a focus on beer from smaller breweries. Perhaps a touch too clean but has that nice DIY feel some of these Czech pubs have. Worth a look (added November 2021)

name: Cable Cafe
description:
City: London
description: Pleasant looking café bar with a slight bohemian (if hipster) vibe, occasional live music. Warm colours, ramshackle decor and impressive artwork. Possibly best in the evenings? (added November 2021)

name: Bodega Marín
description:
City: Barcelona
description: Another 'go before it's gone' city bodega with history and character. Great reviews, looks very nice. Can't wait to go. (added November 2021)

name: Bodega NADAL
description:
City: Barcelona
description: On our first visit to this family run winery in April 2024 it didn't quite tip the balance, due to a slight lack of atmosphere on account of the space. However, the family operation and history makes it an interesting one we'll return to (added November 2021)

name: Old Crow
description:
City: Zurich
description: Understated little bar with characterful stone arch. Parquet floor, lamplight and focus on the back bar rather than beers. Still, looks good. No doubt expensive. (added November 2021)

name: Kommprobier
description:
City: Langenargen
description: Interesting venue which is a large bottle shop/warehouse but also bar. Tables inside and out, decorated with beer ephemera. Neighbourly vibe according to reviews and clearly most German beers under the sun, in bottles at least. Has to be worth a try (added November 2021)

name: PIVO & SYN
description:
City: Brno
description: Perhaps a little bit modern and on the nose, but the clear simplicity of the format appeals as well, and seems to have a nice intimate space. Very well reviewed too. We shall see. (added November 2021)

name: Gaststätte Kollektiv
description:
City: Leipzig
description: East Germany era decor in this bar-diner Gaststatte, possibly too food oriented but interesting looking and well reviewed.

name: Münzbar GmbH
description:
City: Leipzig
description: Info slightly thin on the ground but looks like a decent well reviewed sports bar with a football theme (added November 2021)

name: Zum Schäufele
description:
City: Leipzig
description: Looks like a must-visit old time lunch Gaststatte with amazing reviews. (November 2021)

name: Synde Bräu
description:
City: Leipzig
description: Brewery and taproom with tables for sampling wares. Well reviewed, looks decent. (November 2021)

name: Zum Wilden Heinz
description:
City: Leipzig
description: Excellent looking cabin type bar with ramshackle garden. Quite quirky and characterful looking. Excellent reviews. (added November 2021)

name: Joseph Pub
description:
City: Leipzig
description: While described as an Irish pub, this seems more like just a Pub. Classical Victorian style decor with green bench seating. Some tap choices are generic Irish pub but the surroundings actually look very pleasant, and this is well reviewed too (added November 2021)

name: Casa Pepe
description:
City: Leipzig
description: Arty multi-floor venue bordering on ruin-bar aesthetic. Bohemian yes, but perhaps not quite a ruin. All the same, looks very good and excellent reviews. (November 2021)

name: Betten Költzsch
description:
City: Leipzig
description: Attractive back garden and corridor with retro signage and recovered items. Inside looks pretty cosy too, simple and homely. Very good reviews. (November 2021)

name: Werk 2 - Kulturfabrik Leipzig
description:
City:
description:

name: Zur 102
description:
City: Leipzig
description: Old style with impressive 70s era exterior, smoking inside, not going to be everybody's thing. May be worth a try. (November 2021)

name: Grüner Brauhaus
description:
City: Furth
description: While the venue didn't do enough to bowl us over first time around, beer halls of this kind always require something special to tip them over the edge. The reviews are great and a lot depends if you can get a seat in the main hall. The beers are certainly more than competent, particular the new Rotbier. Worth a look. (added November 2021)

name: Ratsstube
description:
City: Rothenburg ob der Tauber
description: In a city not stacked with great pubs, the central beer hall is a very reliable fallback option. Warm, cosy and typically impressively cloistered. We would recommend out of the tourist season where it is typically plagued by touristy sorts of problems. (added November 2021)

name: Hospůdka na kopci
description:
City: Zivotice
description: Lovely old wood and lived-in homely surrounds. Rotating offer of both home brewed and standard offerings. (added November 2021)

name: Weinkellerei Dünker
description:
City: Frankfurt
description: Fantastic looking traditional wine bar in a characterful cellar. Exposed brickwork, candlelight and  barrels. Very well reviewed. (added November 2021)

name: George & Dragon
description:
City: Ilfracombe
description: Low beams and very characterful bar area, stone walls and fireplace, carpets and very typical familiar feel. (added November 2021)

name: Alt Berliner Wirtshaus Henne
description:
City: Berlin
description: Fabulously aged wood, stained glass and candelabras at this trad wirtshaus/pub with striking neon signage outside. It all screams 'proper pub'. Very well reviewed (added November 2021)

name: Hackethal's
description:
City: Berlin
description: A fab homely looking Gaststatte with retro signage, wooden seats and candles. Clearly room for drinking as well as eating. (added November 2021)

name: Lokobar, Nádražní restaurace
description:
City: Vsetaty
description: A classic Czech station pub, no b.s straightforward boozer here. Lived in and a bit raw with it. (added November 2021)

name: Zelenáčova Šopa
description:
City: Zlin
description: Multitap offerings in a homely wooden cabin with live music and a clear social vibe. 
UPDATE - on a first visit in 2023 there was live music and nice beers, but the overall space as a pub didn't quite cut it for a full inscription. However, it is well worth knowing about. (Added November 2021)

name: HogMod
description:
City: Kaunas
description: Modern but well executed pub with greenery, food and a stage for live music. Well reviewed and looks at least a little notch above the stale Scandi rip-offs that Lithuania is increasingly into. (added November 2021)

name: Ye Olde Red Lion Hotel
description:
City: Market Bosworth
description: A little dog-eared, perhaps, but the low-slung beams and unspoilt nature of this pub are an increasingly rare find. One for fans of traditional pubs. (Added December 2021)

name: Cherry Red's Cafe Bar
description:
City: Birmingham
description: A café diner early on that turns more into a Belgian type café bar as the day progresses. Reasonably offbeat and popular locally. We thought it was OK but needs a few more tries before we can reach a firm decision. (added December 2021)

name: The Eagle Ale House
description:
City: London
description: Homely and authentic looking pub/ale house which has been decorated and personalised in a non-pretentious way. Very popular for its drinks selection and well reviewed. (Added December 2021)

name: Metronome Jazz Bar
description:
City: Chester
description: Excellent reviews for this fairly lively and atmospheric looking Jazz Bar. While it has a modern look, there is some style and personality with it. Has to be worth a look. (added December 2021)

name: Waters Green Tavern
description:
City: Macclesfield
description: Town centre boozer with a real ale focus and decidedly pointed refusal to modernise, which is often a good decision for a pub. Mock tudor exterior with wood panelled bar, pump clips on the wall. (added December 2021)

name: The Unicorn Inn
description:
City: Canterbury
description: Tudor style inn with beamed exterior and cosy historic interior with fire, snug, pub billiards. A fairly unspoilt bunker, but need to see if there is an atmosphere. Well reviewed. (added December 2021)

name: Taberna Rikitri
description:
City: Vigo
description: A Celta Vigo supporters bar with live music and a cult following. Worth a look! (added December 2021)

name: Cobweb Inn
description:
City: Boscastle
description: Genuinely lovely looking pub with settles, pool table, bottles, tankards and fairy lights stuck to the ceiling. Rickety with off-centre frames and character. (added December 2021)

name: The Fountain Head
description:
City: Branscombe
description: Country inn with some of its original features intact with space for drinking, despite the encroachment of dinners. Flagstone flooring, fireplaces. Very well reviewed. (added December 2021)

name: The Blue Bell Inn
description:
City: Tattershall Thorpe

description: Country inn with some of its genteel quality intact, with artwork from the nearby RAF base. Exposed beams, real fire and fairly unshowy in terms of modernisation. (added December 2021)

name: Restaurace Zastávka Nižbor
description:
City: Nizbor
description: Cult railway pub with cheap Zubr, and cast of die-hards, with all that entails in Czechia. Rustic interior. We tried to visit here in March 2025 but it was packed out for a screening of a film. Some famous faces present. It looked excellent. (added 2021)

name: The Prince of Wales
description:
City: Green Tye

description: Country inn and free house with whitewashed exterior and some preserved features. Evidence of community involvement too. Recommended by BRAPA (added December 2021)

name: The Chequers Inn
description:
City: Wareside
description: Review scores dragged down by some issues several years ago, but from the evidence available this seems a classic country inn with handwritten menues on the blackboard, carpets, exposed beams and low ceiling. Worth a look, surely? (added December 2021)

name: Red Lion Inn
description:
City: Litton
description: A classic hikers pub, stone inn on the village green with fire, hearty pub grub and ales.  (added December 2021)

name: Luppolo Station Roma
description:
City: Rome
description: A good looking beer bar with wooden furniture and excellent selection. (Added December 2021)

name: St Bernard's Bar
description:
City: Edinburgh
description: Excellent mix of traditional and individual here at this quirky little pub. Very well reviewed and a bit of a cult audience. (added December 2021)

name: 3 Små Rum
description:
City: Gothenburg
description: 3 small rooms, a cosy, homely and unflashy beer bar specialising in...well...you guessed it! (added December 2021)

name: Café des Étangs de Saint-Denis
description:
City: Mons
description: A truly beautiful looking lakeside pub with all the homely appeal and rustic farmhouse charm you would look for. Very well reviewed. (added December 2021)

name: La Taverne Ardennaise
description:
City: Vresse-sur-Semois
description: A small town on the river hosts this central market town style bar/tabac with a Belgian beer focus and reasonably rustic surroundings, enough to stand out from the norm at least, but warrants closer inspection. (added December 2021)

name: Kings Arms
description:
City: Sutton-in-Craven
description: A small town Yorkshire pub serving a local community. Lived in interior with homely decor. Piano, fire, live events, cask ales. Very well reviewed, looks nice. (added December 2021)

name: Cryan's Teach Ceoil
description:
City: Carrick-On-Shannon
description: Regarded as one of the places in Ireland one can enjoy true traditional Irish folk performances, as the reviews and pictures attest. The pub itself looks friendly and traditional enough with a familiar layout. Very well reviewed (added January 2022)

name: Kavárna Na Šumavě
description:
City: Prague
description: A twee, rustic cabin like café with effusive owner and good beer selection. Overall while a little pubby the café nature of it was dominant, meaning it doesn't quite qualify. (added January 2022)

name: The King & Queen, Caterham on the Hill
description:
City: Caterham On The Hill

description: While it has enjoyed a degree of gentrification this has largely been sympathetic, with the beams and siderooms intact, and furnishings in keeping with rustic country surroundings. The signage also looks homespun and down to earth which makes a change in this area. (added January 2022)

name: The Plimsoll
description:
City: London
description: Formerly a sports pub, the Auld Triangle, the new decor as of end of 2021 has a stripped back retro look with a touch of class to the wood fittings and finish. Still seems light on good beer options however, but must be worth a look. (added January 2022)

name: The Royal Oak
description:
City: Eccleshall
description: A classy looking traditional market town tavern in the typical rustic revivalist style favoured by Joule's brewery. Well reviewed (added January 2022)

name: The Abdication
description:
City: Daybrook
description: Pleasingly homespun and personal micropub with a degree of taste and thought in the decor and usual array of local ales served by enthusiasts. Terrific reviews...which we expect will be deserved! (added January 2022)

name: Tap & Bottles
description:
City: Southport
description: A contemporary and familiar shabby-chic casual micropub/bottleshop set in an attractive arcade. (added January 2022)

name: The Vine Inn
description:
City: Rugeley
description: Well reputed Free House with rustic stripped back tiled floor and wooden furniture, brewery connection and community events. Looks great. (added January 2022)

name: Hospoda u Zemanů
description:
City: Popelin
description: Beautiful rural pub connected to a brewery. Simple communal hospoda decor that looks to have been fitted relatively recently, but in a sympathetic and homely fashion. Exceptional reviews. (added January 2022)

name: The Ship Inn
description:
City: Deal
description: Attractive unspoilt tavern with dark green paint, predictable nautical artwork and photography as decor and range of real ales. Excellent reviews. (added January 2022)

name: White Horse Inn Edwardstone
description:
City: Edwardstone
description: Rural pub that has kept its farmhouse appeal and not gone full into gentrified dining room territory. There is food available, however an old fashioned country pub with excellent range of ales both traditional and modern can be found. Great reviews too. (added January 2022)

name: Mellett's Emporium
description:
City: Swinford
description: Antiques and olde world signage + decor abound in this traditional Irish village pub trading on its history as a multipurpose venue. Excellent reviews. (added January 2022)

name: The Windmill
description:
City: Sevenoaks Weald
description: A truly fabulous looking pub with hanging hops, dark wooden settles and cosy rooms. The ensemble overall looks to create a warm welcoming and distinctive establishment. Locally brewed ales, log burning stove, etched windows. Can't wait to try it. (added January 2022)

name: The Albion
description:
City: Ampthill
description: Attractive alehouse with warm wooden strip fittings, pump clips and historic decor. Simple furniture. Looks effective, routinely award winning for ales. (added January 2022)

name: The Burnaby Arms
description:
City: Bedford
description: Neighbourhood corner local with piano, homely fittings, slightly spoilt by greywashing and sterile lighting at the bar, but could be compensated for on music nights. Several real ales on offer. (added January 2022)

name: The Stone Jug
description:
City: Clophill
description: Excellent reviews, this pub comprises 3 16th century cottages, with exposed beams and brinkwork inside, brick flooring and dart board, community events. Food available but a proper village pub, not a dining room. (added January 2022)

name: The March Hare
description:
City: Dunton
description: Traditional pub in the good beer guide. Relaxed village stylings and renowned for well kept ales. Community shop, folk music nights, but aside of the guide information is thin on the ground other than some traditional homely looking pictures of the interior. (added January 2022)

name: The Engineers Arms
description:
City: Henlow
description: Free house with at least 8 real ales on cask, occasionally straight from the barrel. Ciders also feature prominently. The venue itself looks excellent with breweriana lining the beer garden and historic photos in the interior. Some room for pub games and live sports, occasional community events. Excellent reviews, no wonder. (added January 2022)

name: Brewery Tap
description:
City: Shefford
description: Beautiful trad pub run by Banks & Taylor brewery. The historic ensemble appears intact with warm yellows and reds and a homely appearance. Darts, dominoes and cribbage teams supported, patio area to the rear. Excellent reviews, looks great. (added January 2022)

name: The Six Bells
description:
City: Beenham
description: The core of the pub is the central appeal here with two cosy bars decorated with eclectic items and furnished in a homely unpretentious style that's distinctive. Love to go. (added January 2022)

name: The Bounty
description:
City: Cockmarsh
description: A truly eccentric establishment accessible only on foot or by boat. Quirky and characterful with nik naks and memorabilia wherever you look. (added January 2022)

name: The Alehouse
description:
City: Reading
description: Distinctly revivalist feel here with pump clips covering all available wall and ceiling space, and the venue sticking to good microbrew beers, ciders and perry. Looks like a classic, though one that won't be to everyone's tastes. (added January 2022)

name: Hop Leaf
description:
City: Reading
description: Staunchly low key unfashionable revivalist venue with Hop Back beers and traditional pub games. Looks very nice. (added January 2022)

name: The Bell Inn
description:
City: Waltham St Lawrence
description: Very attractive bar area with true centuries old feeling ensemble. Blackened beams and sympathetic furnishings. Wide selection of ales and log fires in winter. Looks like a gem. (added January 2022)

name: The Alma
description:
City: Windsor
description: Street corner local with a personalised touch, antiques and some bohemian stylings. Large beer garden and overall informal feel. Relatively distinctive, worth a look. (added January 2022)

name: The Perseverance
description:
City: Wraysbury
description: Attractive village/country pub with some homely features and well designed space. Piano and inglenook fireplace are complimentary as are the bookshelves. Guest ales and regular beer festivals. Looks nice. (added January 2022)

name: The Crown Inn
description:
City: Little Missenden
description: A lovely throwback village pub. Idyllic rustic setting with beautiful garden. Continuous Good Beer Guide inclusion run by the same family for over a centre. Genteel and rustic interior that appears unchanged, probably through tasteful, sympathetic choices. Looks very nice. (added January 2022)

name: The General Havelock
description:
City: Loudwater
