description: A Fuller's pub that seems to be a successful all-rounder. Cosy with bric-a-brac inside and a lovely beer garden. Several ales on show and longstanding Good Beer Guide inscription. Credit where it's due. (added January 2022)

name: The Two Brewers
description:
City: Thornborough
description: Drinks-focused thatched village pub in tranquil settings. Inglenook fireplace and woodburning stove create a cosy environment helped by exposed beams. Looks simple and effective, and distinctive from the usual modernised large coaching inn gastropubs of Buckinghamshire. (added January 2022)

name: The Stratton Arms
description:
City: Turweston
description: A rarity around this area. Unspoilt and ungentrified village pub with local flavour. Some original features such as a horseshoe bar, also with large beer garden. (added January 2022)

name: King and Queen
description:
City: Wendover
description: Sometimes it isn't just about the style but the layout and space that makes a pub effective. This appears to be the case here. Refurbished without losing its character, huddle around a fire and cosy bar area after a walk and enjoy some impressive map displays on the wall. Looks great. (added January 2022)

name: Prince Of Wales Feathers
description:
City: Castor
description: Free house in a stone inn. Looks a decent down to earth all-rounder with beer garden and occasional live music. The overall ensemble seems effective and should provide a nice stop for walkers or on a summer's day. (added January 2022)

name: Green Man
description:
City: Colne (Peterborough)
description: An attractive country inn with unspoilt familiar interior with exposed beams and carpet, fireplace and social lounge area. Now a free house. A local ale on tap guaranteed (supposedly) - (Added January 2022)

name: King of the Belgians
description:
City: Hartford
description: Excellent looking traditional in which has a degree of personalisation, distinctive and welcoming looking. Oak beams, copper-topped bar. Looks to be a genuine community-centre pub as well. Can't wait to try it. (added January 2022)

name: The Plough Inn
description:
City: Little Downham
description: A Grade II listed Victorian pub with attractive and historic wood-strip bar area and cosy space. Known for Thai food which is an odd juxtaposition but probably a welcome one for now. Let's hope it doesn't turn into a dining room. (added January 2022)

name: Blue Bell
description:
City: Maxey
description: Interior shots a little tricky to find. Longstanding Landlord runs this converted barn decorated in a sympathetic rural fashion. Paraphernalia of countryside life on the walls and shelves. Many ales on tap. Popular meeting place with community groups. (added January 2022)

name: The Queens Head
description:
City: Newton
description: Perennial inclusion on the Good Beer Guide, this pub has seen generations of long serving landlords and what refurbishments have taken places have been done gently and sympathetically to the surroundings. The cosy lounge area looks particularly social and homely with hops hanging from the bar. Cask ales straight from the barrel. Looks excellent. (added January 2022)

name: Coalheavers Arms
description:
City: Peterborough
description: A stripped back and distinctly ungentrified yet relatively contemporary alehouse worthy of a try. One room back street community boozer. (added January 2022)

name: Palmerston Arms
description:
City: Woodston
description: Bateman's pub with genteel East Midlands rustic feel inside. Looks nice with a clear cast of locals, guaranteed good beer and extensive range of whiskies. (added January 2022)

name: PIG n FALCON
description:
City: St Neots
description: Ale house with a lived in feel. 8 ales and 4 ciders, good range of bottles. Occasional live music. Distinctive and with a reasonably well designed layout that it seems worth a try to us. (added January 2022)

name: The Reindeer
description:
City: Saxon Street
description: Watch out for very limited open hours. Friday and Saturday evenings in winter, weekday evenings in summer and afternoons Saturday Sunday in summer. Why the fuss? A large selection of pub memorabilia and breweriana from cigarette cards to pub signs. Information is thin on the ground but ignore the handful of reviews if you're in the area, give it a try. In the Good Beer Guide. (added January 2022)

name: The Bank Micropub
description:
City: Willingham
description: Effective looking micropub with exposed brick, host of ales and some community events. Compact space yet high ceilings creates a degree of atmosphere. Almost universally well reviewed. (added January 2022)

name: The Mere Inn
description:
City: Alsager
description: A Joule's pub which means traditional rustic/but quite upright decor, and a drinks focus. Sounds good to us. Warm wooden fittings and red upholstery, some interesting corners and spaces. Worth a look. (Added January 2022)

name: Bhurtpore Inn
description:
City: Aston
description: A large pub with several rooms, some of which look excellent, unspoilt and traditional. Great reviews attest to its quality. An ever-present in the good beer guide too. (added January 2022)

name: The Poachers Inn
description:
City: Bollington
description: An unspoilt village pub near hiking trails and with the audience to match. Family run freehouse with guest ales, fireplace and comfortable unfussy surroundings. Looks good and very well reviewed. (Added January 2022)

name: Hops Belgian Style Cafe Bar
description:
City: Crewe
description: Choice of paint notwithstanding, there is a hint of the Belgian café about the arrangement, while the beers certainly compensate for those shortcomings. Worth a look at least. (added January 2022)

name: The White Lion
description:
City: Disley
description: Just enough personalisation to stand out as worth a look. Some community events and good range of cask ales tip the balance. Worth a look, at least. (added January 2022)

name: Helter Skelter
description:
City: Frodsham
description: Modern, friendly looking micropub with 8 handpumps, occasional live music upstairs. Great reviews. Could be worth a look. (added January 2022)

name: Swan with Two Nicks
description:
City: Little Bollington
description: Looks to have just enough of interest. Idllyic rural setting and large brick building, the bar area and surrounding space looks homely and communal with unspoilt table. Food available but the places aren't set, if that gives you some idea. (added January 2022)

name: The Wharf
description:
City: Macclesfield
description: A distinctive bar area with red paint and details, and thoroughbred simple communal and social Northern pub with cosy space aside it. On the Good Beer Guide, multi-award winning, looks great. (added January 2022)

name: The Black Lion
description:
City: Nantwich
description: Traditional pub with half-timberframing, wattle-and-daub walls among Nantwich's equally historic Welsh Row. Creaking floorboards and uneven surfaces. Heating stove adds to the character. Looks interesting and worth a try. Well Reviewed. (added January 2022)

name: The Ferry Tavern
description:
City: Penketh
description: Interesting river and canalside setting, find black beams and a market town type trade inside. Looks OK, with a huge whisky selection and large range of real ales to fallback on if not. (added January 2022)

name: The Beer Emporium
description:
City: Sandbach
description: The typical micropub/alehouse with pump clips and beer mats festooned everywhere, but pleasant paint and furniture choices offer warm hues. Product is of course vastly superior to most. Looks good, well reviewed. (added January 2022)

name: Willeymoor Lock Tavern
description:
City: Willeymoor Lock
description: Pleasingly unspoilt simple and familiar canalside pub popular with walkers and boaters. Good beer guide inclusion. (added January 2022)

name: The Foresters Arms
description:
City: Winterley
description: Not every pub should be listed just through having blackened beams, low ceilings and horse brasses. The shape of the rooms and general ambience plays arguably a bigger role. Information is incomplete about this place, but the Good Beer Guide inclusion and more rural setting tilts us towards thinking this is worth a look. (added January 2022)

name: The Fat Pig
description:
City: Exeter
description: A decent looking all-rounder with a personal and homely touch, seemingly good food along with an up to date range of ales covering most bases. (added February 2022)

name: Rising Sun Inn Launceston
description:
City: Altarnun
description: Rural Cornish pub that has nevertheless been modernised. Slate floors and exposed bricks, a shame about the dining areas which looks stark and unhomely. No reason to go then? Far from it, the low ceilings, wood strips and cosy bar area still give the impression of a pub well worth visiting with a space for a drink. Has featured in the Good Pub Guide. Excellent reviews too. (added February 2022)

name: The Old Ferry Inn
description:
City: Fowey
description: 400 year old inn with slate floor and unspoilt interior, whitewashed brick and nautical nik naks. Works as an inn and proper hostelry. Well reviewed with some local cider as well as ales. (added February 2022)

name: Bolingey Inn
description:
City: Perranporth
description: An unspoilt country in with a familiar homely feel, wooden furniture and carpets. Popular with locals for the food and social connection. Generally looks a good'un. (added February 2022)

name: The Queen's Arms
description:
City: Botallack
description: One-room traditional pub with blackened beams, stone walls and central bar, popular with walkers. A familiar feel. In the Good Beer Guide and well reviewed.(added February 2022)

name: Masons Arms
description:
City: Camelford
description: Poor reviews about food drag the place down but it does looks an interesting place with tin mining artfacts, tankards and collection of nik naks. Highly personalised and distinctive. Has to be worth trying for a beer. (added February 2022)

name: Star Inn
description:
City: Crowlas
description: Award winning roadside freehouse with a brewhouse, beers served directly from cask. A long bar with adjoining rooms. Relatively traditional and 'lived in'. Exceptionally well reviewed. (Added February 2022)

name: The Fountain Inn
description:
City: Mevagissey
description: Drinks-focused inn with slate floors, stone walls and low beamed ceiling. Historic photos on the wall, somewhat gentrified but tastefully. Smugglers history. Excellent reviews. Looks worth a try. (February 2022)

name: Lamp & Whistle
description:
City: Penzance
description: Must-visit pub/bar with one off decor, a labour of love. Be warned, landlord has an attitude problem. (added February 2022)

name: Countryman Inn
description:
City: Piece
description: Nice to see a rural pub still focused on its community and socialising, not just dragging in rich people from the towns for Sunday lunch. Traditional decor with stone fireplace. Cast iron cooking range. Live events. (added February 2022)

name: Blue Peter Inn
description:
City: Polperro
description: Up a steep flight of steps and overlooking the sea, this cosy low beamed pub is improved with its unusual souvenirs, local artwork and cast of regulars. Exceptionally well reviewed. Looks a must visit. (added February 2022)

name: The Castle Inn
description:
City: St Ives
description: Characterful wooden bar with character pouring from the walls, even with busy town trade it has retained a historic patina. Decent ale range and well reviewed. (added February 2022)

name: Mediensis
description:
City: Medias
description: City wall setting with plenty of wood on show, very interesting terrace besides the stone and wooden walls, and looks to have enough going on inside too. (added March 2022)

name: Queens Hotel
description:
City: Gosport
description: A local neighbourhood feel to a pub that retains a bit of character and a bit of an institution. (added March 2022)

name: Anglers Retreat
description:
City: Wintersett
description: A true tucked out of the way pub run in a distinctive and personal way, great reviews. (added March 2022)

name: Staff Of Life Inn
description:
City: Lydgate
description: Famous roadside pub with a history. Stone walled in with local ales, great reviews. (added March 2022)

name: B148 - The Place to Beer
description:
City: Lille
description: Beer mecca, modern but with some warm wood and ephemera on the walls, well reviewed and looks like a decent shout for beer lovers. (added March 2022)

name: Le Yéti
description:
City: Lille
description: Alt/rock/punk little hangout bar with table football and informal lived-in surroundings. Better value than some bars nearby too, apparently. (added March 2022)

name: Hostinec U Štamgastů
description:
City: Hukvaldy
description: One of those brewpubs where the pub looks really nice, cosy, personalised and welcoming? Seemingly so! (added March 2022)

name: The Plasterers Arms
description:
City: Norwich
description: Although the greywashing has stripped some of the character from the place, very good ales, local life and community feel leave this venue a tentative recommendation that nearly tipped the balance for us. (added March 2022)

name: La Pâte Brisée
description:
City: Lille
description: Exposed brick in this 2-floor estaminet with pub features and relatively informal layout. (added March 2022)

name: Le Chat qui Fume
description:
City: Lille
description: Cosy looking pub-restaurant, 'Estaminet' with wooden bar and informal setup. (added March 2022)

name: Estaminet de la Maison Commune 't Oude Wethuys
description:
City: Hondeghem
description: Excellent looking country pub restaurant with enough space to drink or eat. Exposed walls, warm lighting, historic features and an elegant bar area. Very well reviewed. (added March 2022)

name: Estaminet Kasteelhof
description:
City: Cassel
description: Attractive Estaminet pub restaurant, informal enough for either food or drink, pleasingly rustic and homely in appearance. Well reviewed. (added March 2022)

name: L'Absurde
description:
City: Lille
description: Information thin on the ground, formerly 'Au Tord-Boyard', but excellent reviews and tales of old Lille come into focus. (added March 2022)

name: Kunstkroeg De Doedelzak
description:
City: Kortrijk
description: Amazing looking art café with brooding lighting and antique furniture. Open 5-11 Friday + Saturday, 3.30-11PM Sunday. (added March 2022)

name: cafe wielsbeke
description:
City: Kortrijk
description: Very much a locals bar with interesting out-of-date Stella signage and fittings. Still, some cosy signs and in a town that's low on brown café options, this comes closer to the top than it would in other cities. (added March 2022)

name: Cassimir
description:
City: Kortrijk
description: Fun-looking café bar with some funky design, very well reviewed and excellent beer. (added March 2022)

name: Café Dudu
description:
City: Heule
description: A legitimate brown café albeit with a large bar area. Most of the elements are on show, good reviews too. (added March 2022)

name: La Ducasse
description:
City: Lille
description: Belgian café style corner bar with iconic blue neon sign. Some of the typical features on show in the bar, and space for a drink, not just food. Next time, we'll go! (added March 2022)

name: Planet Bar
description:
City: Tirana
description: Another tastefully decorated courtyard bar with some ambience, worth a look. (Added March 2022)

name: Libraria Bar
description:
City: Tirana
description: Reasonably eclectic looking all-rounder with high shelves for books, a large well-stocked bar and some personal touches too. Very well reviewed. (added March 2022)

name: Whiskey Irish Alley
description:
City: Shkoder
description: Attractive looking whisky bar with wood and warm colours. Information thin on the ground but should be worth a go. (added March 2022)

name: Pub For Sale Podgorica
description:
City: Podgorica
description: A much more pubby appearance here with barrel ends, wooden furniture and rustic decor. Wasn't open on our visit though. Please try and report back. (added March 2022)

name: Gradska pivnica
description:
City: Podgorica
description: A proper pub with Czech beer, classic furniture. Looks small. Unfortunately closed on our visit. (April 2022)

name: Bulevar Džada
description:
City: Podgorica
description: Reasonably personalised Caffe Bar with good lagers available and bric a brac inside. Well rated. (added March 2022)

name: Klub Bocara
description:
City: Podgorica
description: By the forests around the back of the stadium, a leafy terrace which hosts occasional events and eclectic decor inside provides instant appeal, when twinned with the positive reviews. (added March 2022)

name: Beertija Pub
description:
City: Skopje
description: Play on words, 'Birtija' being an old coffee bar. Looks decent with shady lighting and music memorabilia. Neighbourhood pub with occasional bands. Seems to still be local. (added March 2022)

name: Van Gogh Bar
description:
City: Skopje
description: A shady late bar with nice patio out front and fairylights inside. Well reviewed. (added March 2022)

name: Brauerei + Gaststätte Alte Mühle
description:
City: Muhlendorf
description: Attractive old fashioned brewpub with tile steam heater in the centre of the room, simple pub-like surroundings. (added April 2022)

name: The Coronation
description:
City: Bedminster
description: Old fashioned ale house with a hint of boho personalisation. Extremely well reviewed and looks to be a must visit in the area. (Added April 2022)

name: Broomfield Tavern
description:
City: Coventry
description: Award-winning real ale pub with multiple handpumps, hops above the bar, dark wood and leather fittings. Looks very nice. (Added April 2022)

name: The Flask
description:
City: London
description: Beautified to fit the discerning needs of the wealthy residents of this neighbourhood, but nevertheless the core charm and appeal is retained in the layout and slightly dusky atmosphere of the interior. (Added April 2022)

name: The Glasshouse Stores
description:
City: London
description: Warning: SAM SMITH'S PUB
A classic boozer by appearance, with lacquered brown wood fittings and simple ale house layout. Historic with the usual throwback appeal. Love it or hate it. (Added April 2022)

name: IMPRFCTO
description:
City: Barcelona
description: Quirky and slightly artsy/experimental bar with some Belgian themes. Well rated and looks like a change from the norm. (added April 2022)

name: Le Kremlin
description:
City: Lille
description: Whether a Soviet/Russia themed bar can survive in a Western country after the Ukraine war is anyone's guess, but the fact is this does look really good. (Added April 2022)

name: Cock Hotel
description:
City: Wellington
description: A fully refurbed (in rustic alehouse style) pub run by Joule's that do a similar operation to Sam Smiths in terms of bringing back the old times, but without the draconian rules and whiff of desperation. This one looks like a tidily put together pub that over time will become even more lived in and characterful (added April 2022)

name: Hlucha Zmije
description:
City: Brno
description: 'Deaf Adder', this is a basement bar of some renown, very well reviewed, noted for good beer too. It was fine on our first visit but didn't quite have enough going on to justify an inclusion. (Added April 2022)

name: Hluchá zmije
description:
City: Brno
description: The other 'Deaf Adder' pub in Brno, again look out for a personalised dive bar with great beer options. (Added April 2022)

name: Ye Olde Bell and Steelyard
description:
City: Woodbridge
description: Oak beams, fireplaces, a generally historic tavern. Unfortunately received a lick of grey/blue paint but looks to still be intact enough. Decent selection of beers for a trad pub. (Added April 2022)

name: The Ill Repute
description:
City: Bristol
description: Adventurous boho-y cocktails and craft beer location with vintage furniture and retro stylings. Very well reviewed. (added April 2022)

name: The Hole in The Wall
description:
City: Brighton
description: Micropub with a striking exterior and compact, well-curated interior. Simple but warm and homely, familiar without falling into the generic/bland trap. Extremely well rate. (added April 2022)

name: Doctor Inks Curiosities
description:
City: Exeter
description: Cocktail bar with antiquey interior, verdant with hanging plants and lush hedonistic vibe. Well rated. (Added April 2022)

name: Old Timers Bar
description:
City: Exeter
description: A labour of love, beautiful little pub with recovered pub fittings and signage. Uncanny valley but in a quirky way. Looks good, and the reviews back that up. (Added April 2022)

name: Krčma - Nositeľ radu práce
description:
City: Kosice
description: Information thin on the ground but seems to be a Soviet themed pub? Got to be worth a look given the options in the city are limited. (Added April 2022)

name: Krcma pod Orechom
description:
City: Kosice
description: Log cabin cosiness and a degree of homely personalised pubgoing that Kosice is largely free of. (Added April 2022)

name: The Butchers Dog
description:
City: Driffield
description: Excellent looking micropub with jolly looking red and yellow signage outside. Inside more personalised and ad hoc, exposed brick and slanted ceiling. Very well rated. (added April 2022)

name: Galerie piva
description:
City: Prague
description: Bottleshop + bar with some tap options and wealth of options in the fridge. A few tables for sitting and drinking, and some street activity too.

While it was fairly enjoyable the threshold hasn't quite been met on our two visits.

We may give it another try.  (Added April 2022)

name: Church Inn
description:
City: Saddleworth
description: Very well put together country pub. While there is food the balance is struck well, remaining a pub not a dining room. Characterful bar area. Good reviews. (April 2022)

name: Hospůdka u Oráče
description:
City: Ostrava
description: A surprisingly rustic, countrified pub to be by a motorway close to an industrial city, but all the better for it, it would seem. Excellent reviews and it's not difficult to see why. (Added April 2022)

name: Hops Bar Tirana
description:
City: Tirana
description: Overall vibe was a little too lounge-bar for us, while the value for money here is poor, but nevertheless, it wasn't bad overall and could be worth a look if you want some superior beers. (added April 2022)

name: Irish Pub Five
description:
City: Ohrid
description: Your mileage with Irish pubs may vary, but the thematic elements are relatively ignorable here (particularly if you face your back to the Irish flag) which leaves a decent enough little pub with upholstered leather seats, an intimate interior with a bit of atmosphere and good range of beers in the fridge from German lagers to Balkan craft styles. Be warned the place has a markup for tourists in order that locals can afford it. You may find that the bill comes to more like Western prices. Overall, we didn't think this place warranted a position on our guide, but it is one to try when in the area. (added April 2022)

name: The Victoria
description:
City: Walsall
description: Characterful looking ale house with a lived in appearance, well-reviewed with a good reputation, clear local life on show too. (added April 2022)

name: Sawley Junction
description:
City: Long Eaton
description: Characterful venue with exceptionally good reviews, must be worth a look. (added April 2022)

name: Minibrowar Reden
description:
City: Chorzów
description: Characterful brewpub with visible brewkit, wood fittings and exposed brick. Looks really good. (added April 2022)

name: Ironbrush Pub Tirana
description:
City: Tirana
description: We passed by and this one looked an interesting option, differing from the usual conservatory lounge bar selection in the city. Well reviewed, worth a look! (Added April 2022)

name: Bar-Kafe " Albert " Vila "Shani" rr. e Durrësit
description:
City: Tirana
description: Down as temporarily closed on Google but was open as we passed by on April 2022. Looks interesting and different from the typical Tirana conservatory lounge bars. (added April 2022)

name: Craftbeer Lodge
description:
City: Freiburg
description: Modern craft bottle shop and bar with exceptionally good reviews. (added April 2022)

name: Spricc Romkocsma
description:
City: Szombathely
description: A provincial ruin bar, we tried to visit but it was unusually quiet and when we tried later on it closed, presumably due to lack of custom. The ruin bar aesthetic was minimal and it more resembled a lounge bar. Perhaps one day we'll try it again. With limited options in the town you may wish to take a closer look (added May 2022)

name: Kétmedve Söröző
description:
City: Szombathely
description: Looks like a decent beer focused pub with amenities and games, some wood fittings, decent reviews. (added May 2022)

name: Sörpatika Pub és Pizzéria
description:
City: Szombathely
description: A very pubby pub, with bench seating, typical wooden seating, great reviews, not too foodie despite the pizza in the title. Looks fairly cosy too. (added May 2022)

name: Jobb Mint Otthon Söröző/Borozó
description:
City: Szombathely
description: Excellent looking traditional pub/wine-bar intact with kind service and a range of bottles. (added May 2022)

name: Mona Lisa
description:
City: Komárom
description: A pub worth seeking out in this border town which appears to have secured piles of Pilsner Urquell merchandise to decorate (and stock) a small bar. Very well reviewed with few complaints, seems fairly 'pubby' inside. Worth a look? (added May 2022)

name: Vinyl & Cafebar K
description:
City: České Budějovice
description: Homely bar decorated with musical nik naks. Looks refurbished with typical Czech arches, but some personalisation. Very well reviewed. (added May 2022)

name: Hostinec Na Šumavě
description:
City: České Budějovice
description: Images in short supply but what there is looks interesting. Unspoilt true Czech pub with some decoration and character. Good reviews (Added May 2022)

name: Restaurace U Podkovy
description:
City: České Budějovice
description: A throwback pivnice with familiar wood strip fittings renowned for its steaks and old time atmosphere. On a first visit in May 2022 it certainly was authentic but didn't blow us away. Worth another try though. (added May 2022)

name: Barell bar
description:
City: Cesky Krumlov
description: It's a small town, so choose wisely, this may be one of the more active, atmospheric bars in town, it seems to be fairly informal and rocky which makes sense from previous experience. Good reviews too. (Added May 2022)

name: The Blue Bell Inn
description:
City: Kettlewell
description: A historic Yorkshire 'hikers pub' that has retained its social character and rural charm despite the decades of churn and is one of the better pubs in a village with otherwise more gentrified and bland options. (Added May 2022)

name: Peadar O'Donnell's
description:
City: Derry
description: Superb looking Irish pub with an appearance you could almost conjure without seeing a single actual picture of the pub. Very well reviewed, looks great. (added May 2022)

name: six d.o.g.s
description:
City: Athens
description: Atmospheric courtyard bar with high walls and festooned lighting. (Added May 2022)

name: Zum Franziskaner
description:
City: Stockholm
description: More towards a restaurant, however this place specialises in tapped Franconian beers with a selection that would make any pub even in Franconia blush. The bar area and surroundings look pleasantly pubby but we hope it isn't too formal. (added May 2022)

name: U Lasíků
description:
City: Unetice
description: Highly rated pub serving the village's local beers with a genteel, timeless look. Clean but pleasant warm shades and personalised elements. Known for its quiches - if you like that sort of thing (yuck) (Added May 2022)

name: The Gas Lamp
description:
City: Manchester
description: Basement bar with well-reputed beer selection and some atmosphere with tiled brickwork and lamp lights. On a first visit we weren't totally sold but prepared to give this another try (Added May 2022)

name: Frau Dietrich
description:
City: Linz
description: Reasonable looking cocktail bar with brick interior, shady with vaulted ceiling. Well reviewed. (Added May 2022)

name: Badcafe Linz
description:
City: Linz
description: Basement vaults with exposed brickwork and small stage for jazz and piano. Looks small, but well reviewed. (Added May 2022)

name: Freizeitstüberl Asten
description:
City: Linz
description: An incredible looking cabin type bar stacked with personalised nik naks and character. The reviews tell all. Have to go. (Added May 2022)

name: Kilele Music Cafe
description:
City: Kecskemét
description: An atmospheric looking venue with exposed brick and live music acts, pretty well reviewed and in a town like this, has to be worth a look in the evening. (added June 2022)

name: U Dragouna
description:
City: Prague
description: Visited in October 2024. Wood strip panelled old-time drinking den, even Branik fronted. Compact and a social focus - some musicians, groups of friends. Entirely locals and fairly priced. Overall it wasn't far off an inclusion, as it represents a dying breed of pubs, but didn't quite stand out enough.

name: Green Devil's Absinth Bar & Shop
description:
City: Prague
description: As advertised, expect green lights and the shady Alchemist lab type interior. Very well reviewed. Very likely to be touristy but that doesn't always mean it's a bad thing. (added June 2022)

name: Taberna Basaras
description:
City: Bilbao
description: Cracking looking Taberna Characterful, homely, plenty of room for socialising and drinking . Personalised with worn in wooden decor. (added June 2022)

name: Pod Šimlem
description:
City: Sviadnov
description: Kocsma type rustic roadside pub with a village atmosphere. Big beams, football scarves and an all-purpose feel. Almost made the cut on our visit but I think it would be best visited on a busy winter evening. Worth popping to if you're in the area. (Added October 2024)

name: Obester Winery
description:
City: Budapest
description: Locally known well reviewed Borozo, these weird hybrids of wine bars and pubs. Space for all here, it seems. Honest and simple but with a fair choice too. Very well reviewed. (added June 2022)

name: The Stanley Arms Hotel
description:
City: Wildboarclough
description: Isolated characterful looking rural Inn with rooms and classic country pub. Well reviewed. (added June 2022)

name: Naštartované retro
description:
City: Bratislava
description: Retro Kavarna in crumbling but stylish building. The old days are preserved here, and it looks pretty funky. Very well reviewed.

UPDATE - On our first visit we enjoyed some of the retro decor, decent beers too but wasn't enough going on, particularly in atmosphere to deserve an inclusion (Added June 2022)

name: Spinners Arms
description:
City: Adlington
description: Two pubs called Spinners in such a small town is a perverse way of trying to drive a pub researcher mad. This does appear to be the one worthy of interest, however why not pop up the road to Top Spinners too? (Added June 2022)

name: Blakes of the Hollow
description:
City: Enniskillen
description: An exciting looking pub. Deep brown wood panels, tiled floor, simple seating. Cosy corners. (Added June 2022)

name: The Wheatsheaf
description:
City: Falkirk
description: Wood panelled intimate boozer that looks to be a standout for the region, very well reviewed. (Added June 2022)

name: Stormbird
description:
City: London
description: Personalised, fairly unpretentious beer specialist pub adorned with Belgian brewery signage and a nice warm glow to the place. (added June 2022)

name: White Lion
description:
City: Westhoughton
description: A preserved interior with curved bar and tiled floor. Decent reviews too, local life to be found no doubt even if it may not be to everyone's tastes. (added June 2022)

name: The Pigs Nose Inn
description:
City: East Prawle
description: A big budget concept pub by normal standards, particularly rural standards. Very atmospheric looking with an open space stuffed with decorations supported by blackened beams and a characterful bar area with oak barrels. A must-see if in the area. (added June 2022)

name: Mansel Arms
description:
City: Porthrhyd
description: Roadside pub with a distinctly local crowd and homely appearance set up for some events and gigs. Extremely well reviewed. (added June 2022)

name: The Holy Inadequate
description:
City: Stoke-on-Trent
description: Excellent looking ale house by the railway and main-road, but outside the centre of town. Classic appearance and instantly welcoming look. Excellent reviews. Silly name. (added June 2022)

name: The Greyhound
description:
City: Newcastle-under-Lyme
description: Cosy cask ale pub with cushioned seats, some live events, social space, welcoming. (added June 2022)

name: The Albert
description:
City: Newcastle-under-Lyme
description: Really lovely looking homely neighbourhood pub with cushioned seating and intimate social space. The sort that should be so common yet more infrequent to find. (added June 2022)

name: The Baker's Arms
description:
City: Cheadle
description: Great looking pub with warm appearance, leather upholstered niches and chequered tile floor. (added June 2022)

name: Gitane
description:
City: Ghent
description: Belgian café with strong brown café vibes, exposed beams, browns and blacks, traditional interior and lots of Belgian ales. (added June 2022)

name: Held-Bräu Robert Polster
description:
City: Ahorntal
description: Classic Franconian gasthof with glazed tile floor, communal seating space and beer garden. Genteel and social. (added June 2022)

name: RÖSLA - Marktplatz Kneipe
description:
City: Burgkunstadt
description: A proper Kneipe. Market town pub that's unspoilt and hasn't been given over to the usual games, fruit machines and sport totally either. The reviews attest to that. Looking forward to visiting. (added June 2022)

name: Red Lion
description:
City: Cotherstone
description: Information thin on the ground but all we have indicates an unspoilt village pub with a passionate following. (added June 2022)

name: The Sekforde
description:
City: London
description: Understated but stylish traditional pub refit that looks well worth a look.  On our first visit we enjoyed it but needed a bit more of a personal appearance to compliment the great raw materials (added June 2022)

name: Špunka Old Barrel Pub
description:
City: Panevėžys 
description: Unpretentious drinking den for craft beer and socialising. Great reviews. Looks good. (added June 2022)

name: Herkus Kantas
description:
City: Klaipėda
description: Artsy bar with huge impressive lights and space, bikes on the wall. Courtyard and archway leading to the pub. Great reviews. (Added June 2022)

name: Seklyčia prie uosio
description:
City: Panevėžys
description: Intriguing cabin for Kvass and ales, key theme with keys nailed into tree trunks, cosy wooden space and attractive bar area. Nice reviews. (Added June 2022)

name: U Báby
description:
City: Prague
description: A decent looking lived-in fourth grade boozer. Unpretentious with a little cult following. Branik on tap which tells you what you need to know. A love or hate place, we suppose. (added June 2022)

name: Restaurace U Bohemky
description:
City: Prague
description: 4th grade pajzl/putyka Staropramen dive bar which acts as a Bohemians pub, big kangaroo print on the wall. A smoky, intimidating typical time-stood-still drinking hole with a cult following. A love or hate place but no denying it offers a slice of the 1980s/90s.
(Added June 2022)

name: Hospůdka Parukářka
description:
City: Prague
description: Nice looking lived-in, pubby Krcma type park pub with indoor and outdoor attractions. Looks good, decent reviews too. (added June 2022)

name: Café Gijs de Rooy
description:
City: Amsterdam
description: Characterful corner pub that shows a bit more versatility and pubbyness than the usual brown cafe while still having some interesting characterful interior features. (Added July 2022)

name: De Drie Dorstige Herten
description:
City: Utrecht
description: Revivalist little beer café with a stripped back appearance, almost like a Dutch answer to a micropub. (added July 2022)

name: The Shipwright's Arms
description:
City: Hollowshore
description: Truly characterful cosy, lived in shoreside Inn with blackened beams, cushioned seats and old time character. Very well reviewed, no surprise. (Added July 2022)

name: Yew Tree Inn (Cauldon)
description:
City: Cauldon
description: A truly special looking pub, something of a one-off with its antiques and layout. A must-visit one day. (Added July 2022)

name: The Crumplehorn Inn & Mill
description:
City: Polperro
description: Picturesque pub with a watermill and unspoiled, relatively ungentrified characterful interior that looks charming and cosy. Well reviewed. (Added July 2022)

name: Gaststätte Wochinger Brauhaus
description:
City: Traunstein
description: Picturesque brauhaus/pub-restaurant with warm interior and classic Wirtshaus type decor. (Added July 2022)

name: THE FROGGY BLUES - Café bar
description:
City: Boulogne-sur-Mer
description: A typically bizarre theme for this pub lends it a surreal frivolity while at the same time moving dangerously close to seaside tat. However, overall it looks like there's enough here to be excited about including the community events and drinks selection. (added July 2022)

name: Cafe the Minds
description:
City: Amsterdam
description: Interesting looking and well reviewed alternative bar which is popular with punks and metalheads - as far as that contingent exists in central Amsterdam. Looks fun either way. (Added July 2022)

name: Beer Temple
description:
City: Amsterdam
description: On the craft-beer end of the bar going spectrum, this is worth marking down when in Amsterdam if you've had enough of brown cafés and Belgian beers (although why on earth you ever would is anyone's guess). (Added July 2022)

name: CAFE WOLF
description:
City: Graz
description: Cult live music venue which sits curiously with a more elegant, refined classic café bar interior. The great reviews are intriguing and it should be place to check out. (Added July 2022)

name: 15.000 Hops
description:
City: Barakaldo
description: Narrow beer café with wide choice of craft and classics, personalised alternative/punky decor, clearly worth a look and well reviewed. (Added July 2022)

name: Mendi taberna
description:
City: Barakaldo
description: Long running pintxos bar with classic wooden bar top historic tiling and framed photographs. (added July 2022)

name: The White Swan
description:
City: Stokesley
description: Fab-looking unspoilt Yorkshire village pub with attracting beams, bar area and social spaces. Unpretentious and very well reviewed. Looks good. (added July 2022)

name: The Green Man
description:
City: Stokesley
description: Micropub with reddish brown interior somewhere between café, alehouse and pub taking in local ales and a good range of Belgian options with it. Well reviewed. (Added July 2022)

name: Café De Pieper
description:
City: Broek op Langedijk
description: Attractive exterior as this corner hut leads to a typical brown café interior with rustic seating and historic character. (added July 2022)

name: Café de Stad
description:
City: Utrecht
description: A simple brown café with familiar, if not totally outstanding decor, however the promise of live music could elevate it, and reviews suggest that is the case. Worth a look. (added July 2022)

name: The Goodmanham Arms
description:
City: Goodmanham
description: Fab 'East England' rural pub with original tiling and rustic furniture complimented with sympathetic farm decor. Really outstanding looking venue as reviews appear to confirm. (added July 2022)

name: Tandle Hill Tavern
description:
City: Tandle Hill
description: Attractive unspoilt country boozer with a social look to it, not all consigned to dining by any means. Well reviewed too. (Added July 2022)

name: St John Inn
description:
City: St John
description: Lovely homely inn with a traditional rustic feel, unspoilt and characterful. Attractive garden with a lovely setting. Great reviews. (added July 2022)

name: The Gladstone Arms
description:
City: Combs Ford
description: A truly cracking looking village pub with more beer choices than normal, attractive beer garden and cosy, personalised and unpretentious interior. Looks like a must-visit and reviews attest to that. (Added July 2022)

name: The Nook
description:
City: Holmfirth
description: An on-site brewery in a tall stone townhouse, with basic but charming looking interior with tiled flooring. Looks like a community pub with plenty of amenities. A must visit. (added July 2022)

name: The Hut
description:
City: Dublin
description: An unspoilt classic Victoriana pub with partions, fine wood carvings and cosy, social drinking den feel. Outside the centre so more local life to be found. (added July 2022)

name: The Hermit Inn
description:
City: Burley Woodhead
description: A traditional inn with some stripped back unchanged appeal, that seems to be worth a look. Located high up near Ilkley Moor. (Added July 2022)

name: The Salutation Inn
description:
City: Ham
description: All-round excellent looking country inn with lovely garden, basic genteel interior with exposed stone, and very good range of ales and ciders. A must visit. (Added July 2022)

name: The Railway Inn, Ketton
description:
City: Ketton
description: Almost exclusively adored village pub with rustic wooden interior and simple decoration. (added July 2022)

name: Jakes Ale House
description:
City: Romiley
description: Micro-pub with a warm social feel, newly built but seems to be adequately cosy. Ale choices clearly superior and great reviews are convincing. (Added July 2022)

name: Cerveseria Vaso de Oro
description:
City: Barcelona
description: Touristy but popular and not unlikable institution. A long bar for tapas dishes and own brewed beer. City prices and a patrician type setup that will appeal to some people. Worth a look but didn't quite tip the balance for us. (added July 2022)

name: The Criterion Bar
description:
City: Stornoway
description: Local life and folk nights are the key appeal to the place. If intimate socialising in a locals pub doesn't sound your thing, steer clear. (Added July 2022)

name: The Wonky Pear
description:
City: Congleton
description: Micropub/cafe with slightly affected shabby chic with faux-antique design, may split opinions. Good reviews and great drinks options on the other hand look to be in its favour. (added July 2022)

name: Prince Of Wales
description:
City: Congleton
description: Another beautiful Joule's pub with labour of love olde-world interior. Looks genuinely great. (Added July 2022)

name: The Cheshire Ring
description:
City: Hyde
description: Appearances may be deceptive. Run-down exterior but a cosy lived-in interior offering a wider range of ales on cask, keg and bottled. Well reviewed with a clear community value. Go with an open mind I suppose! (Added July 2022)

name: The Angel
description:
City: London
description: A compact Sam Smiths pub with some attractive interior features including original partition, Art Deco area styling and seafaring artwork. Views of the Thames. (Added July 2022)

name: Turner's Old Star
description:
City: London
description: Attractive corner boozer with original wooden bar, stained glass and attractive Edwardian styling. A little opened out and airy, but seems worth a look. (Added July 2022)

name: Café Pardaf - craft beer & traditionals
description:
City: Antwerp
description: Colourful Deco-influenced bar with curved bar area and a more upbeat look, complimented by a modern selection of beers to go with the usual. Well recommended, but let's see. (Added July 2022)

name: Pivo Västergatan - en tjeckisk ölbar
description:
City: Malmö,
description: A seriously impressive looking Czech style pivnice that has gone for authenticity over tourist tattyness. A great selection of beers from Czechia properly pulled. Dedication to the art. (Added July 2022)

name: The Fish Market Cafe
description:
City: Antwerp
description: While not totally convinced from what we've seen, continual recommendations have kept us interested to find out what this is like. (Added July 2022)

name: Biercafe De Jordaan
description:
City: Antwerp
description: Very well reviewed beer café and locals pub a little off the tourist centre. Along with contemporary beer options there's a nice homely looking space with attractive bar area facing the entrance. (Added July 2022)

name: Clock (The Cafe)
description:
City: Antwerp
description: Simple brown café with leather backed bench seats and parquet floor. Something straightforwardly appealling about it without being flashy. Obviously local rather than touristy, also. (Added July 2022)

name: Café Boekowski
description:
City: Antwerp
description: Moving away from the awful pun, this bookish café bar has a charming appearance - and no shortage of books - piano, sofa and lampshades provide a loungey feel, but this is supplemented by some typically nice beers. Not a brown café, but a bar of contemporary relevance that has a bit of character to it (Added July 2022)

name: den Tripel
description:
City: Antwerp
description: Brand new 'old style' brown café in a well-to-do district of Antwerp, well financed with tank Stella and quite clearly a few Tripels. Looks fairly classy as well as traditional and worth a look. Closed on weekends and opens mid-afternoon onwards. (Added July 2022)

name: Café Bezemsteeltje
description:
City: Antwerp
description: Witch-themed with dozens of little witch models strewn about the place. Characterful with exposed brick and little niches. Perhaps spoilt by games machines and loud music? We'll have to see. (Added July 2022)

name: Cfou
description:
City: Antwerp
description: A change of speed, this bohemian bar is more shabby chic than brown cafe, but with its greenery and some preserved tiling it does seem intriguing, further still with the excellent reviews. (Added July 2022)

name: Kropsburg
description:
City: Karlsruhe
description: A 'lokal', that is to say an unpretentious but fairly characterful venue with genteel decor and neighbourhood life. Very well reviewed. (added July 2022)

name: Old Chapel Pub
description:
City: Karlsruhe
description: Looks a fairly solid bet with dark wood fittings and a familiar saloon bar feel with stools and leaning posts. Well reviewed too. (added July 2022)

name: Le Coin du Diable
description:
City: Brussels
description: Classic corner Belgian café with some traditional stylings but an international flavour. Well reviewed (Added July 2022)

name: Le Wappers
description:
City: Brussels
description: A nice white/light brown traditional bar area and good reviews regarding atmosphere and beer options make this appealing. Let's see... (Added July 2022)

name: The Hacienda Bar
description:
City: Dublin
description: Worth a look, very well reviewed cosy hangout with pool and darts, seemingly more local life. (Added August 2022)

name: Cafe Den Benghel
description:
City: Hamme
description: All the classic features of the typical Belgian brown café are on show, with great reviews attesting to the beer options as well. Cosy and gezellig, with small town type environment. (added August 2022)

name: Plume of Feathers
description:
City: Castlemorton
description: Rural setting with large garden overlooking fields, cosy interior with exposed beams and rustic bar area, which appears to have been modernised to an extent. Overall though, worth a look. (Added August 2022)

name: Elephant Cafe
description:
City: Mechelen
description: Conveniently located brown café that has survived despite the tumultuous times. Tiled floor, greens and browns provide a familiar yet still individually distinctive setting for Belgian beer enjoyment. (Added August 2022)

name: Artillery Arms
description:
City: Ramsgate
description: A little neighbourhood boozer with two distinctive features, firstly its stained glass and secondly the military theme, which may be cloying to some, but is nevertheless a different pitch. Very well reviewed with several cask ale options. (added August 2022)

name: The Golden Lion
description:
City: Padstow
description: Superb reviews for this whitewashed stone inn with attractive wooden bar area and rustic feel inside, looks like a must visit if in the area. (Added August 2022)

name: Hagglers Corner
description:
City: Sheffield
description: Charming little art space and bar with attractive courtyard and niches to enjoy. Very well reviewed and a change from the usual offering in the city. (Added August 2022)

name: Le Perroquet
description:
City: Brussels
description: Corner café with tropical bird theme including interesting stained glass elements. Arcadey feel which didn't fully convince first time around, but is worth another look. Useful location if combining a bar crawl. (added August 2022)

name: Cafe St Hubert
description:
City: Ghent
description: A must visit brown café opening mid-afternoons which has great reviews. All images of the place make it look personalised, homely and distinctive, which could make an ideal winter months stop off. Breaks up a walk into Ghent from the station too. (Added August 2022)

name: Bar Belien
description:
City: Ghent
description: Candlelit late bar with a younger crowd, decent drinks options across the range, good reviews. Seems to be occasional music sessions, a brooding hangout without being overly pretentious. (Added August 2022)

name: Moca Vintage Cafè & Hairdresser
description:
City: Ghent
description: Hidden down an arcade, we got a look at it but didn't stay. Tables sit aside stalls of antique goods, a maze of routes, cluttered and certainly nothing if not distinctive. The hairdresser to the back adds another typically Belgian quirk. We will need to take a closer look at this. Very well reviewed. (Added August 2022)

name: Café Backdoor
description:
City: Ghent
description: Beautiful arty, music focused pub with warm hues and cosy looking niches. Very interested to go here, with local life and excellent reviews. (Added August 2022)

name: The New Inn
description:
City: Clitheroe
description: Unspoilt Lancashire pub with communal bench seating and traditional surroundings. Well reviewed and looks a good bet with real ales. (Added September 2022)

name: The Alma Inn
description:
City: Scarborough
description: Quirky throwback looking pub, unspoilt and rather lost in time. Seemingly in a good way. (Added September 2022)

name: SCHOLAR BRAUEREI Craft Beer
description:
City: Göttingen
description: Aka 'Nautibar', we won't dignify that rubbish name and will use Scholar Brauerei instead. Personalised interior with lampshades, tiles and a living room type appearance, very unusual for this sort of thing in Germany. Very well reviewed. (Added September 2022)

name: The Jolly Drayman Pub and Hotel
description:
City: Gravesend
description: Charming traditional pub downstairs at this hostelry with low-slung ceiling, wooden beams and unspoilt communal areas. Well reviewed which seems unsurprising. (Added September 2022)

name: The Little Pack Horse
description:
City: Bewdley
description: A traditional pub with impressively chunky bar, niches and exposed beams. Something of a classic seemingly. Ale selection seems good too. (Added September 2022)

name: Giełda Piw Pub
description:
City: Wroclaw
description: Modern but quite tasteful and sympathetic pub focusing on good craft beers in warm and fairly homely surroundings. Sounds good to us, and reviews appear to agree. (Added September 2022)

name: Na Blbým Místě
description:
City: Brno
description: Have walked past many times without going in, but it honestly seems like a nice hideyhole, particularly if busier. Proper pub with social space, telly, games and unpretentious surroundings. Position by a staircase is quite memorable too. (Added September 2022)

name: Nálevna U Leona
description:
City: Brno
description: File under down n dirty dive bar. Visit for informal and unpretentious late drinks and fun. Personalised decor, exposed brick, decent pace to things. Has to be worth a look if you like that. (Added September 2022)

name: Eisgrub-Bräu
description:
City: Mainz
description: Brewpub with exposed brick vaults and shiny brewkit that looks quite inviting. Reviews are mixed as these places tend to be, but it is worth a look. (Added September 2022)

name: Tram 3
description:
City: Antwerp
description: Fun-looking bar exploiting an old townhouse to make a bohemian versatile bar with roof terrace and high-ceilinged bright bar space. Have had a peek and it seemed worth a try to us! (Added September 2022)

name: Szamos kocsma
description:
City: Szeged
description: Chunky cabin-like pub in true kocsma fashion with large beer garden. Seems a decent all-rounder and quite homely. (Added September 2022)

name: Pivaren Lemon - Craft Beer
description:
City: Bratislava
description: Nice looking homely craft beer bar which has a balance of small brewed lager and ales. Did we see a picture of a pub parrot too? (Added September 2022)

name: Chip N Ern Ale House
description:
City: Bingley
description: Cosy and well-reviewed micropub with traditional pub type charms on a smaller scale of course. On a first visit it was good but the clientele dragged it down substantially. Hopefully a one-off and we will try it another time. (Added September 2022)

name: Utopia
description:
City: Paris
description: Simple intimate space for live music and evening bar going. Surroundings warm, brown, low key and simple. Looks good and well reviewed. (Added September 2022)

name: Ton Air de Brest
description:
City: Paris
description: Less typical late-bar with a music focus and informal scuzzy dive quality that appeals. Breton focused with Brittany beers and wares. Some pirate decor in that spirit. (Added September 2022)

name: La Folie en Tête
description:
City: Paris
description: Music themed bar focused on drinks with a fair bit of memorabilia and clutter giving it a distinctive enough appearance. (Added September 2022)

name: Le Requin Chagrin
description:
City: Paris
description: A rather pubby looking Parisian bar with wood fitting and shuffleboards. Seems worth a look. (Added September 2022)

name: Teddy's Bar
description:
City: Paris
description: Characterful bar with wood fittings, teddy bears (seems to work somehow) and warm lights. Well reviewed. (Added September 2022)

name: La Pomme D'eve
description:
City: Paris
description: Characterful little late night cocktail bar with live music cramped between a cloistered ceiling and vaults which are a very striking feature (Added September 202")

name: Le Piano Vache
description:
City: Paris
description: Characterful and clearly well loved, lived-in institution with live music, music posters and niches. (Added September 2022)

name: Le Piston Pélican
description:
City: Paris
description: Grand café styling with ornate fittings, pillars, lanterns and sweeping seating arrangement. At the same time, looks small enough to be intimate. Well reviewed, we would take a trip here. (Added September 2022)

name: La Ruée vers l'Orge
description:
City: Paris
description: Famed beer mecca with shelves of bottles and exposed brick vaults. Furniture disappointingly ho-hum but most other basis seem to be well covered. (added September 2022)

name: La Taverne de l'Olympia
description:
City: Paris
description: Local institution with exposed beams, classical setup, beer and social focus with some food available. International bank notes decorating the bar. Not everyone's cup of tea apparently but surely worth a try.  (added September 2022)

name: N U M B E R • F I F T E E N
description:
City: Lytham St Annes
description: Unusual venue with plush decor, raised area. Victorian gin palace vibes mixed with slight carnival style hysteria to the colour. Live music, cask ales. Looks well worth a look. (Added September 2022)

name: The Commercial Inn
description:
City: Dunfirmline
description: An unusually friendly looking 'pubby pub' that could be more at home in an English market town, but nevertheless welcome here with more real ales than usual too. (Added September 2022)

name: Jolly Brewmaster
description:
City: Cheltenham
description: Dramatic curved bar decorate with hops in otherwise cosy and familiar lived-in neighbourhood pub, excellent reviews for ales and social quality. Looks pretty good. (Added September 2022)

name: National Trust - The Fleece Inn
description:
City: Bretforton
description: Extremely beautiful rustic heritage inn with genteel appeal, lovingly kept for decades on the Good Beer Guide. However, question mark over its succession when the owner retires? (Added September 2022)

name: The Wrong Bar
description:
City: Sofia
description: Popular looking down to earth pub with a nice garden. (Added September 2022)

name: Motor City Sofia
description:
City: Sofia
description: Well reviewed beer-focused drop in bar with some style, informal and a bit moody, looks worth a try anyway. (Added September 2022)

name: The Flying Dog Bar in Sofia
description:
City: Sofia
description: Beer-focused bar with excellent reviews, a little DIY in appearance. Not very well lit from how photos display the place, that may be an advantage. (Added September 2022)

name: Patches Blues Bar
description:
City: Sofia
description: Live music with personalised interior strewn with picture frames. Great reviews. Looks well worth a look. (Added September 2022)

name: Ретроспекция/Retrospection
description:
City: Sofia
description: Informal and slightly twee hangout spot with music, board games, computer games, books, niches and artwork. Very well reviewed and seems superior. (Added September 2022)

name: Vitamin B - Craft Beer Bar
description:
City: Sofia
description: Typical craft beer interior with plenty of drinks options, supplemented with what seems to be an atmospheric courtyard. (Added September 2022)

name: Bar Me
description:
City: Sofia
description: High ceilinged bar that looks refined and characterful without being plastic and pretentious. Most likely cocktail focused. (Added September 2022)

name: White Magic
description:
City: Borovets
description: Krcma type country cabin with wood-strip walls, personalised and very down to earth from appearances. Hockey memorabilia on the wall. Be warned this place will only open when it is tourist season. (Added September 2022)

name: L'âne sans queue
description:
City: Lyon
description: Quirky bar with artwork on an arched ceiling, modern and scuzzy touches too. Aperitivo, craft beer etc. Well reviewed. (Added October 2022)

name: The Star
description:
City: Oxford
description: Cracking looking neighbourhood pub with personalised decor and distinct identity. Decent looking beer choice, pool table, beer garden. (Added October 2022)

name: Kroegske ('t) Scheer
description:
City: Ostend
description: Difficult to know what to make of this place. Quirky and colourful, perhaps too foodie, too tacky, but at the same time looks very distinctive, and reviews are convincing enough. We'll see... (Added October 2022)

name: The New Inn
description:
City: Wilsden
description: A village pub that has maintained its pubby quality, a boozer rather than a dining room. Personalised with several hanging mirrors and signs. Well reviewed. (Added October 2022)

name: Království
description:
City: Prague
description: Attractively out of time 1970s hospoda diner that has a good reputation and whose name pops up too regularly to pass over. We're going here. (Added October 2022)

name: La Plata
description:
City: Barcelona
description: Classical tapas bar with tiled walls and barrels, great reviews. (Added October 2022)

name: The Cherub Inn
description:
City: Darmouth
description: Wattle-and-daub timber frame 3-storey pub restaurant with enough drinking and social space to be a candidate here, well reviewed. (Added October 2022)

name: Phil Carrolls Bar
description:
City: Clonmel
description: Seems to be an absolutely classic looking old Irish bar with superb reviews. (Added October 2022)

name: TWO SCHMUCKS
description:
City: Barcelona
description: Award winning cocktails in a casual bar with a host of framed artwork and photographs on the walls. (Added October 2022)

name: Locale Firenze
description:
City: Florence
description: Dramatic, lush and opulent award winning cocktail bar where the surroundings are as impressive as the cocktails themselves. Well reviewed. (Added October 2022)

name: The Cellars Alehouse
description:
City: Maidstone
description: Vaulted cellars host this very well reviewed alehouse that is surely worth a visit if in the area. (Added October 2022)

name: The Half Moon
description:
City: Oxford
description: Interesting mixed reviews but the place seems to be a well preserved stripped back ale house with a reassuringly old-school appearance. Has to be worth a look. (Added October 2022)

name: The Black Lion
description:
City: Hereford
description: Unsure how we missed this but a pleasant pub with preserved heritage features. May be slightly on the foody side but looks like there's plenty to enjoy. (Added October 2022)

name: The Flowing Tide
description:
City: Dublin
description: Very pleasant looking pub with some original niches, partitions and bench seating, personalised with nice decor, not too tacky either. Reviews are good rather than great which may be due to its central location - but surely worth a look. (Added October 2022)

name: The Lamb Inn
description:
City: Eastbourne
description: Historic low ceilinged pub with timber frame, large fireplace and heritage feel. Good reviews. Perhaps foody but still surely worth a try. Good reviews. (Added October 2022)

name: The Masons Arms
description:
City: Billinge
description: Truly lovely looking pub with plush upholstered seating, real ales, personalised interior and pleasant garden. Superb reviews. (Added October 2022)

name: Brasserie Thiriez
description:
City: Esquelbecq
description: Reportedly one of France's true beer and pub highlights. It looks the part with a superbly personalised and cosy looking interior. Amazing reviews. (Added October 2022)

name: The Magnet Freehouse
description:
City: Stockport
description: Ale house with some homely rooms and quite quirky arty personalisation which could work either way.  Good ales and ciders available. Overall, worth a try. (Added October 2022)

name: The Paper Mill Micropub
description:
City: Milton Regis
description: Very pleasant micropub with intimate space, red walls and rustic furniture. Good ales and cider, of course. Very good reviews. Has to be worth a try. (Added October 2022)

name: The Old Bookbinders Ale House
description:
City: Oxford
description: Stylised countryfied pub with musical and diner leanings while also rustic with tiles, a long bar and many real ales. Quite the curio. Very well reviewed. Looks a must visit. (Added October 2022)

name: Little 3
description:
City: Thirsk
description: Worn-in pub with attractive exposed beams, carpet and informal appearance. Live music, real ales and a bit of a golden glow to the place. May err a little bit to the tacky but worth a try at least. (Added October 2022)

name: The Bell & Jorrocks
description:
City: Frittenden
description: Superb looking village pub with an easy relaxed appearance, a pair of comfy worn in old shoes in pub form. Simple seating, hops above the bar, black beams and local artwork. Excellent reviews. (Added November 2022)

name: The Black Boy
description:
City: Winchester
description: Amazing looking rustic pub with antiques shop. Terrific reviews, very characterful. Looks a probable 9/10 (Added November 2022)

name: The Kenton Pub
description:
City: London
description: Well reviewed off-beat redecoration of a classic corner pub, a little wacky but nothing too over the top. Still relevant and well reviewed. (Added November 2022)

name: The New Inn
description:
City: Pembridge
description: Looks an excellent traditional ale house with red paint, tankards, settles, looks potentially fairly small. Excellent reviews. (Added November 2022)

name: Craven Brew Co Tap Room
description:
City: Cross Hills
description: A taproom that takes a leave out of Kirkstall Brewery's book with recovered signage and tasteful worn in furniture. Check opening hours before visiting. (Added November 2022)

name: Pivovar a Hospoda Medlešice
description:
City: Medlešice
description: Excellent looking rustic village hospoda that is the taproom for the local brewery. Characterful and classically Czech. Worth a visit. (Added November 2022)

name: The Cellar Bar
description:
City: Batley
description: While on the towny side there seems to be some appeal to this classical market town tavern with some Victoriana/gin palace elements. Well reviewed and worth a look at least. (Added November 2022)

name: The Cornish Ancestor Micro Pub
description:
City: Callington
description: A very minimalist micropub with excellent reviews. (Added November 2022)

name: The Star Inn, Vogue
description:
City: Vogue
description: A pub with some remaining character around the bar, a typical trad appearance with beams and pewter jugs, etc. Expanded elsewhere for functions, etc. (Added November 2022)

name: Cerveceria César
description:
City: Jaen
description: Popular local tapas bar with cheap plentiful portions of good classic food and typical beers. Looks casual and authentic. (Added November 2022)

name: The Garrison: Craft Beer House
description:
City: Jaen
description: Beer specialists in a little drinking den decked in beer ephemera. Perhaps a little on the ex-pat/theme pub side but also not so much that seems a problem. Worth a look. (Added November 2022)

name: The King William
description:
City: Milford
description: Riverside pub with a very traditional look. Exposed stone, low beams and several cask ales. Looks reasonably small and unspoilt too. Must return to try this out. (Added November 2022)

name: Krüger Eck
description:
City: Berlin
description: Magnificent looking corner kneipe with great reviews. Looks welcoming and diverse enough too. (Added November 2022)

name: P.EGAN Bar
description:
City: Moate
description: Highly rated and locally famous pub with a partly refurbished but still characterful look, most likely to be known for local life and social value. (Added November 2022)

name: Coach and Horses Inn
description:
City: Weatheroak Hill
description: A country inn which still seems to have retained some character, with attractive surroundings and a brick and beamed bar area, tiled flooring. Worth a try? (Added November 2022)

name: Jackson Stops Inn
description:
City: Stretton
description: A really super looking ale house of some character with tiled floor, rafters and homely decor, with some brighter concessions. Very well rated. (Added November 2022)

name: Zum Silbersack
description:
City: Hamburg
description: A cult kneipe from the late 1940s with wooden furniture, sporting memorabilia and preserved fixtures. Looks great and very well reviewed. (Added November 2022)

name: VINTAGE BAR - Rhumerie & Pub
description:
City: Bordeaux
description: A character retro-chic pub with cocktails and craft beers, looks relevant but characterful with it. Well rated. (Added November 2022)

name: Café Koops B.V.
description:
City: Haarlem
description: Attractive brown café that still seems relevant rather than a museum piece. Small and cosy, mid-brown with classic leaded windows and rustic seats. Well reviewed. (Added November 2022)

name: The White Swan
description:
City: Birmingham
description: Victorian heritage pub of great local renown. Looks great. Go before it closes, as there are rumours it may close for building works! (Added November 2022)

name: La Destilería
description:
City: Malaga
description: One of the city's foremost cocktail bars with a higher concept than most. Excellent reviews. (Added November 2022)

name: Speakeasy “The Pharmacy”
description:
City: Malaga
description: One of the city's premier cocktail spots with a higher concept than most. Excellent reviews. (Added November 2022)

name: Road House
description:
City: Malaga
description: Intriguing looking venue with a bit of a saloon type vibe from appearances. Only a visit will reveal all! (November 2022)

name: Bar los Mosquitos
description:
City: Cordoba
description: Authentic tapas bar with tiled walls, local life. Very well reviewed. (Added November 2022)

name: Taberna San Miguel Casa El Pisto
description:
City: Cordoba
description: Perhaps more pub-restaurant than bar, nevertheless, this authentic Taberna is stocked with bullfighting memorabilia and lived in character. (November 2022)

name: Café-Bar Casa Curioso
description:
City: Cordoba
description: A tapas bar with a difference, this one has gone the extra mile to add quirkyness and curiosity to the decor, otherwise looks like a pub-diner, fairly informal though. (Added November 2022)

name: Loop Bar & Records
description:
City: Granada
description: Late bar with vinyls and a vaguely alternative leaning. Well reviewed. (Added November 2022)

name: La Taberna de Kafka
description:
City: Granada
description: Tapas bar with the menu divided up by Kafka books. Quirky, but underneath the gimmick there appears to be a legitimate venue with good quality food and drink. (Added November 2022)

name: Bodeguilla "Casa Fuensanta”
description:
City: Granada
description: A wine focus to this Bodega style venue which looks reasonably informal too. (Added November 2022)

name: Bar Poë
description:
City: Granada
description: Ignore the yellow signage outside, come on in to this warm looking vibrant bar with a cosmopolitan flavour. Well reviewed. (Added November 2022)

name: Bar El Albergue
description:
City: Granada
description: Authentic very pubby tapas bar with wooden seating around a central bar area. Well known and well reviewed. (November 2022)

name: Taberna La Tana
description:
City: Granada
description: One of the city's authentic and well reputed tapas bars, this one with a bit more of a bodega/wine bar feel. (Added November 2022)

name: Bar Casa Julio 1947
description:
City: Granada
description: A must visit authentic tapas bar with tiled walls, exposed beams and typical service. Well reviewed given the location. (Added November 2022)

name: Bodegas La Mancha
description:
City: Granada
description: Wood-fronted heritage Bodega with classic interior and good reviews. (Added November 2022)

name: Cafe Múnich
description:
City: Granada
description: Very well reviewed beer bar that branches out past the usual lager staples. Information thin on the ground but could be worth a look. (Added November 2022)

name: Pub Convent
description:
City: Almunecar
description: Very attractive taberna with a pubby bar area, leafy courtyard and plenty of money spent. Excellent reviews. (Added November 2022)

name: Ducks Inn
description:
City: Aberlady
description: Ignoring the drab hotel trappings (dining room/function suit etc), the bar seems a particular highlight with a cosy and personalised space that retains its social function. However, only a visit will confirm one way or another! (Added December 2022)

name: The Greyhound Inn
description:
City: Sutton Stop
description: Excellent looking well reviewed canalside pub. Personalised and lived in interior in an 1800s era stone building. Wood fittings, views of the canal, good cask ales. (Added December 2022)

name: Cleary's Pub
description:
City: Dublin
description: Unspoilt very well reviewed classic tavern with red paint, preserved signage and heritage artwork. Looks an absolute must-visit. (Added November 2022)

name: Šestajovický pivovar
description:
City: Sestajovice
description: Always nice to see a town brewery put as much attention into the venue as well. Quite pubby and clearly of community value. Worth a look. (Added December 2022)

name: Bira Ood
description:
City: Varna
description: A beer mecca with black bar area and walls of bottles, exceptional reviews for produce, and looks personalised enough. But is it good enough as a bar? We shall see. (Added December 2022)

name: Hospoda Kyčerka
description:
City: Velke Karlovice
description: Pub Restaurant with a wooden cabin feel (new rather than old) and lots of nik naks and mounted hunting ephemera up in the rafters. Seems worth a look. (Added December 2022)

name: The Old Bookshop
description:
City: Bedminster
description: Modern but quirky café bar with a piano fitted at the bar, broad range of beer. Will it break out of the generic? Looks like it has a fighting chance. Well reviewed. Worth a try? (Added December 2022)

name: Bank of Friendship
description:
City: London
description: A pleasingly well preserved boozer with sweeping angular wood-fit bar, personalised and lived-in interior. Seems well loved by locals. Worth a look? We'll try to get there. (Added December 2022)

name: Taberna Rincón del Cofrade
description:
City: Granada
description: Superb looking Taberna we unfortunately missed on our visit. Easter parade type decor, wonderful interior and great reviews. One to try! (Added December 2022)

name: The Waverley Bar
description:
City: Edinburgh
description: A local institution, small traditional bar with 60s posters, live music and communal seating. Great reviews, looks a classic. (Added December 2022)

name: El Jabali
description:
City: Martorell
description: A traditional bodega/taberna with a folky, rustic charm. Reviews are mixed but if you're in the area surely worth checking out for its distinctive features. (Added December 2022)

name: Taproom 27: A Hoppy Place
description:
City: Chisinau
description: Craft beer bar set in a large standalone building with a high roof, impressive beams and fairy lights. At ground level a hut-style aesthetic blends with the industrial chic ambience. 24+ taps covering craft and European classics. (Added December 2022)

name: Pub U Komárků
description:
City: Rohov
description: A super-looking village brewery, pub and social space in one. Very well reviewed. (Added December 2022)

name: Minipivovar VLČEK Horažďovice
description:
City: Horazdovice
description: A minibrewery with some home spun charm and intimate cabin like interior. Chunky wood and stone. Worth a look? (Added December 2022)

name: The Vine Inn
description:
City: Manchester
description: Modernised but perhaps a worth a look. Not only for the attractive faienced signage that's been preserved, but for its own merit. (Added December 2022)

name: Peter Tavy Inn
description:
City: Tavistock
description: Traditional and relatively unspoilt country in with the usual low hanging beams, brasses and wooden settles. A hint of sprucing up here and there but not ruining the overall effect. A typical looking West Country rural pub with excellent reviews for atmosphere and meals. (Added December 2022)

name: Angel In The Fields
description:
City: London
description: Another super looking heritage pub with stained glass and preserved fixtures. It is a Sam Smiths pub however so bear in mind their usual draconian rules. (Added December 2022)

name: El Xampanyet
description:
City: Barcelona
description: Authentic and characterful tapas bar with the usual warm wood, cream walls and colourful tiles. Excellent reviews too. Worth a look! (December 2022)

name: Dr Stravinsky
description:
City: Barcelona
description: A pharmacy theme to this cocktail bar. It appears it stays just the right side of curiosity rather than cookie cutter. Well reviewed. (Added December 2022)

name: Občerstvení KUFR
description:
City: Smrzovka
description: With virtually no online presence other than intrepid bar bloggers, this is a throwback station pub-restaurant with dartboard and social focus complimenting the food. Seems homely and unpretentious which is a major plus. Konrad beers available currently. (Added December 2022)

name: Petr Hauskrecht - Steam Brewery
description:
City: Brno
description: Their taproom, the Salanda only opens as part of the brewery tour but it looks beautiful, with a fond nostalgic design, and very well reviewed. (Added December 2022)

name: Gallery Senk
description:
City: Bratislava
description: The reported new location for Hostinec Richtar Jakub. Lacks the atmosphere of the previous venue but the beers are there, and there is a gallery of artwork in a reasonably pubby setting (Added December 2022)

name: Station Inn
description:
City: Hull
description: A revamped traditional pub that is still suffering from poor legacy reviews but is now very well thought of for ales and atmosphere. We shall see... (Added December 2022)

name: Chase Inn
description:
City: Upper Wyche
description: An attractive homely looking country inn with low beams, warm wood, side rooms and cushioning. Decent range of ales, well reviewed. Worth a try! (Added December 2022)

name: Hospůdka U Černé kočky
description:
City: Teplice
description: An attractively unspoilt krcma type pub with chunky outdoor seating and wood strip interior. Seems unpretentious and splits opinion in that typical way. Worth a look? (Added December 2022)

name: Thirsty Scholar
description:
City: Manchester
description: Cult venue, ramshackle haven for ales and live events, check opening hours carefully before visiting and know what you're letting yourself in for to avoid disappointment. (Added December 2022)

name: Wheatsheaf Inn Llanhennock
description:
City: Llanhennock
description: Super reviews for this unspoilt rural Welsh pub. Personalised homely interior with a distinctive identity. Go before it's gone! (Added December 2022)

name: Princess of Prussia
description:
City: London
description: Classic old time boozer with wood fittings, large detailed mirrors and a simple boozer style bar with lounge to the rear. Well worth a look, and by London standards highly reviewed. (Added December 2022)

name: The Champion
description:
City: London
description: Sam Smiths boozer, however looks worth visiting for its beautiful interior. (Added December 2022)

name: The Anchor Inn, High Offley
description:
City: High Offley
description: Looks like a must visit simple rural, rustic country pub. Fishermen, bargegoers and caravaners use the pub frequently. Opening hours erratic but looks brilliant. (Added December 2022)

name: Tomney's Bar
description:
City: Moy
description: A cult favourite in the area, beautiful pub inside and out with a traditional heritage appearance, distinctive identity and very positive reviews. (Added December 2022)

name: Alexandra Vaults
description:
City: Saltburn
description: On a first visit we found this curious back alley pub with distinctive decor from the old tea sacks decorating a hatched ceiling, real fire roaring away to the left of the bar, pub dog, cinema/golden era ephemera in the bars side room and two pool tables (2 more than most pubs have these days). Zero cask ales which will not attract beer enthusiasts. If the drinks selection improves this will be worth adding to the guide. (Added January 2023)

name: The Roebuck
description:
City: London
description: Clutterful and personalised pub, unlike many in the area. Looks characterful with a fire by the bar area. Focus on real ales, excellent reviews. A must visit! (Added January 2023)

name: Peyton Arms
description:
City: Stoke Lyne
