City: Hedley on the Hill
description: While a gastropub, the original character of the place hasn't yet been extinguished and there appears to be a good balance of cosy pubbiness to enjoy alongside the good food. (Added December 2023)

name: Red Lion
description:
City: Sennybridge
description: A characterful 'basic boozer' village pub with red panels, beams and low ceilings. Excellent reviews. (Added December 2023)

name: The Duke William
description:
City: Stourbridge
description: Craddocks brewery tap, in effect. Traditional interior dating from the Edwardian period. As expected, good range of ales. Probably needs a visit to get a better idea of atmosphere and welcome, but well reviewed. (Added December 2023)

name: The Creaky Floorboard
description:
City: Derby
description: Bohemian, shabby-chic ale house that seems distinctly un-Derby in some ways, but is tastefully executed. Great reviews. Refreshing to see something different out there. (Added December 2023)

name: Balkan Academy of Music - BAM Belgrade
description:
City: Belgrade
description: Alternative, eclectic cultural centre with local acts and hangout space that seems well worth a look. Based in the increasingly popular Dorcol district. (Added December 2023)

name: Bar San Juan
description:
City: Chorlton
description: Attractive looking tapas bar which takes a leaf out of the Seville style. Superb reviews too. (Added December 2023)

name: Hospoda U Léni
description:
City: Úštěk
description: Charmingly stuck in time train station pub that has a fanbase through its honest clapped out character. (Added December 2023)

name: MIQT pub
description:
City: Prishtina
description: Pub in ' English style' with wood fittings and green walls, without being an over-done homage, ie a theme pub. It has its own flair and identity by the look of things and is very well rated. (Added January 2024)

name: The Gait Inn
description:
City: Millington
description: Splendid looking country pub combining a homely social interior with good grub, doesn't look like it has become a dining room just yet. (Added January 2024)

name: Le Garde Fou
description:
City: Strasbourg
description: Very typical Scandi-influenced craft beer bar. (Added January 2024)

name: Le Local
description:
City: Strasbourg
description: Colourful funky bar, well reviewed, good selection. Low-key steampunk theme. (Added January 2024)

name: La Mandragore
description:
City: Strasbourg
description: Atmospheric looking taxidermy strewn eclectic bar. Looks well worth a try. (Added January 2024)

name: Les Tricheurs - Bar à Jeux
description:
City: Strasbourg
description: Board game pub, intimate and cosy, down-to-earth with several beers on tap. (Added January 2024)

name: Le Schluch
description:
City: Strasbourg
description: Surviving old timer bierstub with wood strip walls and traditional Alsace offerings. Looks like a proper bar not a restaurant. (Added January 2024)

name: L'Alchimiste
description:
City: Strasbourg
description: Intriguing cocktail bar with a foresty, druid like theme, overall well-rated and certainly seems distinctive. (Added January 2024)

name: Bar Barberousse Strasbourg
description:
City: Strasbourg
description: Pirate themed cocktail bar with wood strip panelling and atmospheric surroundings. Mixed reviews but possibly worth having up your sleeve. (Added January 2024)

name: Maison citoyenne
description:
City: Strasbourg
description: Volunteer-led cultural centre that also provides a bar and outdoor seating, along with the usual events. Looks colourful and worth a try. (Added January 2024)

name: Brasserie Roue Libre - Brewpub
description:
City: Strasbourg
description: Brewpub with wide array of offerings and happy hour deals. Very well reviewed. Looks tastefully decorated. (Added January 2024)

name: Grow Bar
description:
City: Prague
description: A classic alternative cellar bar in brick vaults - casual hangout. Looks worth a try. (Added January 2024)

name: El Refugio café art nature - arte - bar
description:
City: Alicante
description: Poetry readings and live music at this popular cultural institution, low key and informal. Good reviews. (Added January 2024)

name: Birreria Art. 17
description:
City: Florence
description: Atmospheric beer specialists in live-in surroundings. Well reviewed and well worth a look. (Added January 2024)

name: Brauerei Hoh
description:
City: Köttensdorf
description: Old-school Franconian Brauereigaststatte with simple charms. Well reviewed. (Added January 2024)

name: Rose Of England
description:
City: Ramsgate
description: Interesting personalised High St pub with a hint of Victoriana about it. Decent ales, very well reviewed. (Added January 2024)

name: Lower Royal George Inn
description:
City: Pole Moor
description: Unspoilt pub with quite some appeal to it. Good reviews and on a bus route. (Added January 2024)

name: Malatesta
description:
City: Alicante
description: A city institution, worn in boozer/kneipe with plenty of characterful appeal. Still well reviewed. (Added January 2024)

name: House of Ales
description:
City: Pontefract
description: Bottle shop and micro-bar with some draft options which have popped up. Need to visit to see how viable it is as a drinking venue (Added January 2024)

name: The Red Cow
description:
City: Sandwich
description: Traditional beamed pub with a market town trade. Looks decent, but will need to try it to be sure. (Added January 2024)

name: The Swan
description:
City: Darlaston
description: Simple, social set up with a proper bar room in intimate space. Good ale selection. (Added January 2024)

name: Black Horse
description:
City: Thetford
description: A well rated traditional pub with usual low beams and familiar interior that does not look overly altered. Worth a try. (Added January 2024)

name: Alexandra Arms
description:
City: Kettering
description: Looks like a potential 9 or 10 out of 10 pub with a hugely characterful interior. Traditional in style but highly personalised. (Added January 2024)

name: The Banshee Labyrinth
description:
City: Edinburgh
description: A now famous bar with notable interior, still well rated today. Worth a look (Added January 2024)

name: Rosenauer Hofbräu
description:
City: Marktgraitz
description: Very pleasant brewpub in a cabin-like space, looks warm and social, opening hours are probably one to watch though. (Added January 2024)

name: U2 přátel
description:
City: Brno
description: Casual multi-tap hangout we enjoyed but not enough to tip the balance.

name: The Wally Dug
description:
City: Edinburgh
description: Set in a half-step basement in a mews, an interesting looking bar, classical in style but minimalist in approach. Strong reviews. (Added February 2024)

name: Old Bell Inn
description:
City: Edinburgh
description: Wooden boozer with exposed beams, studded leather bench seats and a 'proper boozer' character. Worth a look (Added February 2024)

name: The Butchers Arms
description:
City: Herne 
description: One of the original micropubs, highly personalised interior, good selection and brilliant reviews. (Added February 2024)

name: Les Sans Culottes
description:
City: Paris
description: Famous aging bar with a classical fin de siecle look. Foody but space for drinking. (Added February 2024)

name: The Chequers
description:
City: Swinford
description: Light brown wood panelling with old fashioned pub games and bench seating in a barn like space. (Added February 2024)

name: Country Bar
description:
City: Zermatt
description: Saloon bar with bunker-like interior and pub games, easily the closest to a pub you'll find around this area. (Added February 2024)

name: The Bricklayers Arms
description:
City: Hersham
description: Dressy heritage pub with Victorian prints and classical interior. Good ales. Well rated. (Added February 2024)

name: Royal Oak
description:
City: Whatlington
description: Old fashioned pub with inglenook fireplace, low beams and rustic surroundings, a little foody of course, but seems to be space for socialising. Highly rated. (Added February 2024)

name: Teuchters
description:
City: Edinburgh
description: It didn't quite do enough on our visit however it's a pleasant traditional local in a quieter neighbourhood, with fireplace and candle light. (Added February 2024)

name: The Bowlers Rest
description:
City: Leith
description: Free House. Traditional neighbourhood pub with red cushioned upholstered seats, pool and darts, with some interesting drinks too - large Bourbon selection, Ayinger on tap and affordable snacks and pub grub. Excellent reviews (Added February 2024)

name: The Tourmalet
description:
City: Edinburgh
description: Sister pub to the Ventoux, Tour de France themed bar with selection of European beers. (Added February 2024)

name: Cloisters Bar
description:
City: Edinburgh
description: Part of a former church, repurposed into a nice looking bar with dark wood, beams, stained glass along with a good selection of beers. (Added February 2024)

name: Kerttulin Kievari
description:
City: Turku
description: Whisky specialists with some beer alternatives in an intimate space. It was an interesting place with a neighbourly feel, but didn't quite cut it on our visit. Worth keeping in mind though. (Added February 2024)

name: Pub Sirdie
description:
City: Helsinki
description: Looks like a brilliant knackered out old boozer with worn wood booths and highly personalised interior, a mixed crowd including younger audience. (Added February 2024)

name: Pub Magneetti Vallila
description:
City: Helsinki
description: Fun-looking colourful affair, well reviewed. (Added February 2024)

name: Bar Molotow
description:
City: Helsinki
description: Decent enough looking eclectic spot. (Added February 2024)

name: Majava Baari
description:
City: Helsinki
description: Characterful punky hangout, The Beaver Bar. (Added February 2024)

name: John Scott's Arkadia
description:
City: Helsinki
description: Happy hour Mon-Fri 2-6 – English themed pub. (Added February 2024)

name: Kalevan Krouvi
description:
City: Helsinki
description: old fashioned, warm glowing little bunker, looks alright! (Added February 2024)

name: Pub Heinähattu
description:
City: Helsinki
description: Small crustpunk bar, looks worth a try. (Added February 2024)

name: Pyynikin Brewhouse
description:
City: Tampere
description: A decent enough option for those into brewpubs, with a fairly pubby bar room. (Added March 2024)

name: Majava Baari Beaver Bar
description:
City: Tampere
description: Punk/rock pub - we were too early to sample when it is most likely at its best, but some decent raw materials. (Added March 2024)

name: Pub Golden Monkey
description:
City: Hervanta
description: Multitap neighbourhood pub combining good beer with a casual, dive bar type hangout with TV, games, etc. It was decent but didn't blow us away. (Added March 2024)

name: Patschifig
description:
City: Basel
description: Aka Hafechas. Funky repurposed space with sprawling semi-ruin bar type vibes. (Added March 2024)

name: Rio
description:
City: Basel
description: Presszo style funky bar with a continental European flavour and sense of institution to it. A bit café like during the day but seems to work later on too. Didn't quite push into an inscription but it wasn't far off, and we'll be back (Added March 2024)

name: The Hop Poles
description:
City: Brighton
description: Effective looking pub with superior beer selection and breweriana on the walls. Well reviewed. (Added March 2024)

name: Tokaj Wine Bar
description:
City: Budapest
description: Surviving Borozo, working class wine bar. No beer available - but that fact is a good thing, and shows the complete commitment to the style. Superb reviews. (Added March 2024)

name: Zeiglhaus Parkstein e.V.
description:
City: Parkstein
description: Zoigl brewing revival along with food preparation and baking. A rare venture, one that is also membership based. Extremely limited opening hours. Open Thursdays 6-10pm (Added March 2024)

name: Pivovarská hospůdka
description:
City: Kounice
description: Traditional brewery restaurant pub with a hint of First Republic 'Hostinec' about it. Brewkit visible from the hatch. (Added March 2024)

name: Cafe Metro Bar
description:
City: Bilston
description: A town full of nice surprises, or at least, containing more than one nice surprise, it seems. Very well rated micro with the typical hanging hops and strong selection. (Added March 2024)

name: The Jenny Wren
description:
City: Beal
description: Some potential to this beamed old pub with fireplace, high backed benches and drinks focus. Live music, lunches. Some great reviews. (Added March 2024)

name: Irrsinn Bar
description:
City: Basel
description: Well-reviewed gloomy low-lit bar. Live music, table football, pinball, cocktails etc. Intriguing spot. (Added March 2024)

name: Zum Urigen Raucherkneipe
description:
City: Freiburg
description: Backstreet kneipe in unlikely house with a pleasant garden and rustic interior, very well review. Raucher indicates smoking, so be warned. (Added March 2024)

name: Alt Freiburg
description:
City: Freiburg
description: No-frills local life in a pubby interior. (Added March 2024)

name: BAR am Funkeneck - Freiburg im Breisgau
description:
City: Freiburg
description: Craft beers in a neighbourhood hangout, looks a bit of a kiezkneipe type thing, smoking allowed - be warned. (Added March 2024)

name: Alter Simon
description:
City: Freiburg
description: Corner wood-fit raucherkneipe with Kolsch on tap. Closed Sundays. (Added March 2024)

name: Brasserie Zum Braunen Mutz
description:
City: Basel
description: Central beer hall with familiar interior tarted up with a striking ceiling panel, bears and Carnival themes. 8 Feldschlosschen beers on tap, a good Schwemme although the Ausschenk is a wasted opportunity, overly bland. (Added March 2024)

name: Sauerbratenpalast
description:
City: Aachen
description: Old fashioned Gaststatte specialising in Sauerbraten, wood-strip interior, women-owned and run, careful with the opening hours. All signs point to the fact there is space to turn up just for a drink. (Added March 2024)

name: The Crafty Baa Keswick
description:
City: Keswick
description: Bric-a-brac strewn micro with a good reputation. (Added March 2024)

name: Fungo's Bar
description:
City: Salzburg
description: Intimate bar with great reviews, looks pretty cosy. Worth a peek through the door at least. (Added March 2024)

name: Wahn´s Inn 2.0
description:
City: Passau
description: Finally somewhere of interest in Passau that isn't a pub-restaurant. Proper hangout. CLOSED SUNDAY :( (Added March 2024)

name: Batavia Pilsstube
description:
City: Passau
description: Extraordinary kitsch here, but be aware opening hours are unusual. Excellent reviews. (Added March 2024)

name: Pub U Johanna
description:
City: Jihlava
description: A nice lived in, unspoilt old hospoda, well reviewed. (Added March 2024)

name: Bambus Bar
description:
City: Znojmo
description: Basement cocktail bar with a lively crowd, nothing too pretentious, just nice brick vaults, relaxed surroundings and town life. For a provincial place we were quite impressed. Bordering on an inclusion. (April 2024)

name: Hospůdka za pecí
description:
City: Sedlec-Prčice
description: Popular rural pub with some home-spun charms, very well rated and comes highly recommended. (Added April 2024)

name: Pivnice U Míče
description:
City: Brno
description: A persistently well-rated pub known for its Czech tapas and good beers. Interior didn't seem all that much to us but it must be about the social atmosphere when it gets going. We'll try next time. (Added April 2024)

name: turandot bar
description:
City: Berlin
description: Superb looking characterful battered old kiezkneipe decorated with local art. Well rated too. (Added April 2024)

name: Le Palais Du Houblon
description:
City: Nivelles
description: Characterful looking basement complex with curved and arched ceilings and different rooms to explore, beer selection looks, of course, superior. (Added April 2024)

name: Wachtel söröző
description:
City: Ófalu
description: Iconic old time village pub highly recommend by Kocsma tourist (Hungarian pub specialists) - well rated. (Added April 2024)

name: Két Korsó
description:
City: Budapest
description: Battered old corner hangout with attractive bar. Appearance and vibe of a Berlin corner kneipe. Worth a look. (Added April 2024)

name: Egri Borozó Borbarát Bár Galéria
description:
City: Debrecen
description: Fantastic homely, unchanged pub focusing on wine and homecooked food. Superb reviews and it's easy to see why. (Added April 2024)

name: Zsír (Fővárosi Kulipintyó)
description:
City: Budapest
description: Seems well worth a try - battered bunker with wood strip curved ceiling, exceptional reviews. (Added April 2024)

name: Giero Pub
description:
City: Budapest
description: Cult pub with Hungarian folk music and spartan, alternative surroundings. Be aware that this is seen as a tourist trap because the prices are hidden/high but you are in effect paying for the live music performance and in that context the prices seem entirely acceptable. (Added April 2024)

name: Aranyeső espresso
description:
City: Budapest
description: Super looking worn-in, battered old pub.  Pool table and very retro surroundings. (Added April 2024)

name: Villány-Siklósi borozó
description:
City: Budapest
description: Fantastic looking place, a down-to-earth, lived-in drop in bar, unpretentious and right in the heart of the action. Well reviewed too. (Added April 2024)

name: Kis Kurt Borozo
description:
City: Budapest
description: One of the few surviving Budapest borozos. Retro atmosphere, highly personalised and very well reviewed. (Added April 2024)

name: Magán vasút gyűjtemény
description:
City: Pusztakettős
description: A near legendary village pub by a lake with extraordinary labour of love interior featuring train heritage. (Added April 2024)

name: Hintaló Iszoda
description:
City: Budapest
description: Popular antiquey style bar with a versatility - cocktails but decent fridge of beers and relaxed atmosphere. Very well rated. (Added April 2024)

name: Petz Söröző
description:
City: Székesfehérvár
description: Instantly superb looking pub with personalised interior, great social scene and nice terrace too. Reviews are exceptional. (Added April 2024)

name: The Wheatsheaf Inn
description:
City: Borrowby
description: Lovely classical village pub with big fireplace, low ceilings, homely interior and all that you're looking for from such a venue. Exceptional reviews too. (Added April 2024)

name: The Goyt Inn
description:
City: Whaley Bridge
description: Rustic Pennines pub with attractive homely interior, fireplace, the works. The reviews would seem to suggest this is well worth visiting. (Added April 2024)

name: Czeska Baszta
description:
City: Warsaw
description: Traditional pub with Czech beers - not just the usual ones. (Added April 2024)

name: Na Mlýnku
description:
City: Humpolec
description: The best of Humpolec's otherwise rather drab bar options. Modern and overly brightly lit, which drags down what is otherwise a really atmospheric place with a vibrant social scene, with top class Bernard beer on tap. If we lived here we'd be here all the time due to an absence of good alternatives, but as we don't, it is only a tentative suggestion at this stage. Perhaps it may win us over on our return. (Added April 2024)

name: Bar Pub LITTLE BASTARDD
description:
City: Prague
description: Late bar (verging on Herna bar) with a dive bar/scuzz feel, motorbike decorations, pinball machine US ephemera, possibly a little like Bondy Bar in Holesovice. Worth a look for sure. (Added April 2024)

name: Za větrem
description:
City: Prague
description: Surviving "Fourth grade" pub, a very well rated one too on account for how they look after the beer and the good service. Looks reasonably characterful and a bit of a throwback with socialist-era and football decor. Reportedly very cheap prices. As of 2024, 33kc for Staropramen 10. (Added April 2024)

name: Bar Celler La Massana
description:
City: Barcelona
description: An authentic neighbourhood Bodega that's super popular for its democratic prices, good hearty cooking and local character as yet undimmed, owing to being located slightly further off the beaten path. We enjoyed the visit, especially the food, but perhaps the interior itself could do more to win us over, a little plain in the main room, but there is a characterful row of barrels in the entrance. (Added April 2024)

name: Bodega La Palma
description:
City: Barcelona
description: Classic patrician Bodega with high ceilings, big vats, tiles, hanging meat, etc. Still very popular and well rated for the area. (Added April 2024)

name: Rispa Cervesers
description:
City: Girona
description: Microbrewery open Fridays & Saturdays. (Added May 2024)

name: Eksperyment
description:
City: Lublin
description: Funky, colourful hangout with something distinctive to offer. Well reviewed. (Added May 2024)

name: Szalon kocsma
description:
City: Makó
description: A cute little chalet staffed irregularly by an elderly team. Looks quite unusual and information is thin on the ground, but surely worth a try if you're in the area! (Added May 2024)

name: Mini Oázis Söröző
description:
City: Budapest
description: Characterful roadside boozer with a personalised touch and very good reviews. (Added May 2024)

name: Casa Agustín
description:
City: Zaragoza
description: Characterful 'institution' bodega with all the typical features you'd come to expect. (Added May 2024)

name: The Hyde Park
description:
City: Plymouth
description: Extremely characterful, personalised neighbourhood boozer that looks worth a try! (Added May 2024)

name: Kazoo Art Pub
description:
City: Szada
description: A lovely, homely and artful hangout with a Presszo vibe, with some live music too. Uniformly well reviewed. (Added May 2024)

name: The Hop Monkey Music Bar @ Dean Clough
description:
City: Halifax 
description: Open later in the week, a down to earth venue offering craft beer, live music and evening hangouts. (Added May 2024)

name: "A kocsma" Hangulat bortár,sörtár, könyvtár
description:
City: Budapest
description: Personalised woodstrip saloon bar with heavy decoration and atmospheric evening interior. Exceptional reviews. (Added May 2024)

name: Antic Teatre
description:
City: Barcelona
description: Cultural event space and bar that looks quite interesting, although very centrally located. (Added May 2024)

name: La Masia
description:
City: Barcelona
description: Classic unspoilt Bodega, dating back to the 1950s. Very well rated, surely worth a try. (Added May 2024)

name: Resolis
description:
City: Barcelona
description: Historic bar that has been given a very tasteful, if upmarket facelift. There is still casual space and it looked vibrant when we passed. Well rated too. (Added May 2024)

name: Mülä Baar
description:
City: Tartu
description: Off-beat wine bar with an eclectic interior, perhaps a little towards towny but interesting enough to be atmospheric at least. Worth a try. Excellent reviews. (Added May 2024)

name: Barlova
description:
City: Tartu
description: Among the near extinct breed of suburban pubs, this is a characterful, social and down-to-earth drinking hole attracting a range of ages, well-lived. Looks a must-visit. (Added May 2024)

name: Pivnice u Ryby
description:
City: Bystřice pod Hostýnem 
description: Characterful and almost off-the-map village pub worth a look for unspoilt charm. (Added May 2024)

name: Blues tanya
description:
City: Érd
description: Superb looking wooden tavern with pleasant garden for live music and casual hangouts, Superb reviews attest to that. (Added May 2024)

name: Szent János Retro szórakozóhely söröző és közösségi ház
description:
City: Velence
description: A surprising find, almost a museum with collection of retro artefacts decorating the pub. Well reviewed. (Added May 2024)

name: Bodega Cal Pep
description:
City: Barcelona
description: Not to be mistaken with Bodegueta Cal Pep in Sants. A historic Bodega with a personal character and plenty of identity. Fabulous reviews too. Looks unmissable - shame we missed it! (Added May 2024)

name: BAR BODEGA MONTSE
description:
City: Barcelona
description: Incredible looking historic Bodega on Barcelona's protected cultural heritage list. How we missed it, I'll never know. Great reviews. Go for it! (Added May 2024)

name: Bar Del Toro
description:
City: Barcelona
description: Characterful, well-reviewed Bodega on Barcelona's protected cultural heritage list. Seems worth a look! (Added May 2024)

name: Moll de Rebaix
description:
City: Barcelona
description: Friendly, characterful, homely and personalised bodega with good reviews. Seems well worth a try. (Added May 2024)

name: Bodega Celler Miquel - Vermut, vino y tapas en Barcelona
description:
City: Barcelona
description: Very characterful and well reviewed historic bodega on Barcelona's list of protected cultural heritage. Worth a look! (Added May 2024)

name: Bodega Casas
description:
City: Barcelona
description: Although the interior falls into good rather than great the fact this is on Barcelona's list of protected Bodegas as part of cultural heritage, and the superb reviews, give much encouragement to visit. (Added May 2024)

name: Bar Bodega Quimet
description:
City: Barcelona
description: Not to be confused with 'Quimet + Quimet' in Poble-Sec district. On Barcelona's list of protected cultural heritage. Superb characterful and historic interior with great reviews. (Added May 2024)

name: BODEGA LLUÍS
description:
City: Barcelona
description: Listed as protected cultural heritage, a historic Bodega with some remaining character and ritual to the operation. Looks worth a try with a personalised bar area and wall of wines. (Added May 2024)

name: Bodega Sopena
description:
City: Barcelona
description: Fantastic looking little bodega, a one room set up with upturned barrels and straightforward operation. On Barcelona's protected cultural heritage list. A must visit. (Added May 2024)

name: Bodega J. Cala
description:
City: Barcelona
description: An utter classic by the look of it. Traditional bodega with character, personality and history, inscribed on Barcelona's protected cultural heritage list. Very enthusiastic and positive reviews. Unmissable. (Added May 2024)

name: Jungle Taverne
description:
City: Carcassonne
description: Funky, lively and tiny bar with craft beer and a small terrace on the street. Let down by unnecessary disco lighting during the day, a green strobe effect you really don't want. It crams a lot in a small space, and worked better in the evening, but was really just off the cusp of an inclusion. Still, if you're in town you'll find this is pretty much the only place to go that isn't an Irish pub. (Added June 2024)

name: Radio City
description:
City: Valencia
description: From 1979, this is a well-known and very popular place, so it remains to be seen if that has taken the edge off the experience somewhat. However, a colourful interior and cultural program suggests there is plenty still to explore. (Added May 2024)

name: La Rovira
description:
City: Barcelona
description: Popular low key drop in bar in Gracia which has a good line in craft beer, but manages to be likeably informal and neighbourly by the looks of things. Decorated with retro 50s and 60s fittings in places, but a light touch. (Added May 2024)

name: Bar Vinil
description:
City: Barcelona
description: A fairly warm, cosy, homely and personalised low key, casual hangout bar. Looks worth a try! (Added May 2024)

name: 14 De La Rosa
description:
City: Barcelona
description: Stunning looking bar, modern but warmly lit, fittings influenced by 1970s modernism, a hint of retro. Extremely good reviews. (Added May 2024)

name: Café 1900
description:
City: Maastricht
description: Characterful café with some classic retro lighting and bruin kroege setup, Very well reviewed. Seems worth a try! (Added May 2024)

name: Café 't Haantje
description:
City: Maastricht
description: As yet unspoilt bruine kroege, good reviews and clearly worth a look for its characterful interior with classic signage. (Added May 2024)

name: Café 't Rozenhoedje
description:
City: Maastricht
description: A fairly unspoilt looking bruine kroege with typical characterful interior, maybe worth a look in. (Added May 2024)

name: Maison blanche
description:
City: Toulouse
description: Jazz bar with atmospheric, intimate interior. (Added May 2024)

name: The Hopscotch Pub & Brewery
description:
City: Toulouse
description: Scottish pub but fairly muted on the tacky theme stuff, looks a decent trad tavern. Open every day from 4pm. It didn't quite tip the balance on our visit, but the beer selection was good and it's one of the best bars around the Capitole. (Added May 2024)

name: Le Ravelin
description:
City: Toulouse
description: Bar for live music, punk type aesthetic, cheap prices, in-the-know kind of place. (Added May 2024)

name: La Passerelle Negreneys
description:
City: Toulouse
description: Culture/community café for good causes and social projects, looks interesting enough to pop by. Acts as a de facto brewery tap for Aviateur nearby. Our visit went as expected. On events nights this will be a cool place to go, but during the day it's simply a friendly café run by good people. Fair prices. (Added June 2024)

name: Le Grabuge
description:
City: Perpignan
description: Microbrewery with a certain ad-hoc appeal and loungey furniture. Very well reviewed. (Added May 2024)

name: Hospůdka Radioklub
description:
City: Havirov
description: Estate pub with rotating guest craft beers and super-low prices, with a throwback atmosphere. Hence not for everyone. (Added May 2024)

name: Bar Pelikán
description:
City: Ostrava
description: Intriguing venue, very small little pajzl with incredible reviews, rustic interior. Opens 4pm til late. (Added May 2024)

name: Décapsule Club
description:
City: Toulouse
description: Bottleshop bar with 10+ taps and walls of specialist beers. It didn't quite tip the balance as a bar experience but it deserves a side-recommendation, particularly if you're looking for a beer near the main station. (Added June 2024)

name: La Houblonnière
description:
City: Toulouse
description: Craft beer and cider bottle shop, narrow with a bar room to the rear making it a full bar rather than a shop. It didn't quite tip the balance overall for a full guide recommendation but it's worth bearing in mind, particularly if you're crossing Pont Neuf and fancy somewhere to hangout. (Added June 2024)

name: Pivní klub U Dobráků
description:
City: Ostrava
description: For those who enjoy a rough and ready experience, almost a museum to the old times. Weird ramshackle dive with primary school style murals, masked dummy in the front window, Ostravar on tap for not much money, and a cast of unabashed regulars who may be surprised to see you but you may find yourself having a greater welcome than you first expect. Don't bother going here if the idea of this is intimidating. It isn't a guide entry but as a curio, and a conveniently located pub near the station, it's worth keeping in mind (Added October 2024)

name: Café de la Ostrava
description:
City: Ostrava
description: Must visit venue for interior design, steampunk influence. A bar/club with some weed for sale, but regular drinks available. Closed when we tried to visit in October 2024 but at that point there were recent reviews, so who knows?

(Added June 2024)

name: Club Music Bazar
description:
City: Ostrava
description: Locally famous events venue, live music and radio station coming at things from a less commercial angle. Looks lived in and characterful, but how much is a bar and how much is a performance space is something we'll have to explore first hand. (Added June 2024)

name: The Globe
description:
City: Liverpool
description: Compact traditional boozer known for its sloping floor. Didn't quite make the cut due to a lack of distinctiveness otherwise but it is cosy and social. (Added June 2024)

name: Forgó Söröző
description:
City: Dunabogdány
description: A pleasantly pubby looking kocsma type cabin hangout, with a local cult reputation. (Added June 2024)

name: Sarki kocsma
description:
City: Madocsa
description: Something of a shrine to a Hungarian footballer. A culture club with some wood fittings. Info thin on the ground but reportedly a cult venue. (Added June 2024)

name: The Crows Nest
description:
City: Crosby
description: Unspoilt side-street boozer that seems to have retained its character. Good reviews. (Added June 2024)

name: The Circ
description:
City: Burnley
description: Retro-nostalgic bar with interesting decor and furnishing. Very well reviewed. (Added June 2024)

name: The Bridge Bier Huis
description:
City: Burnley
description: Continental beer, craft keg and real ales at this decent looking ale house, slightly modernised but offset with some personalised decor. Well reviewed, looks worth a try at least. (Added June 2024)

name: The Lamb Inn
description:
City: Holymoorside
description: A very pleasant, rustic country pub with unspoilt interior, very good reviews. Real ales. (Added June 2024)

name: La Pécora
description:
City: Burgos
description: Looks like an absolute classic. Bunker drinking den with wood fittings, highly personalised and 'lived-in', huge record collection. Very well reviewed. (Added June 2024)

name: Old Royal Oak
description:
City: Dublin
description: Popular and extremely well reviewed traditional pub with comfy seating and personalised exterior. Looks well worth a try. (Added June 2024)

name: Diófa söröző
description:
City: Nagymaros
description: Looks like a stunning rustic saloon bar with collection of old radios and farming equipment, certainly well off the radar, but worth a look if in the area. Exceptional reviews. (Added June 2024)

name: Bar Maurizio
description:
City: Bologna
description: Classic old-timer bar, highly personalised and lived in, set under the porticos. Looks superb. (Added June 2024)

name: Sezon
description:
City: Lublin
description: Courtyard bar overshadowed by tall trees and galleried historic buildings. Looks very nice. (Added June 2024)

name: The Live and Let Live, Neen Sollars
description:
City: Neen Sollars
description: Traditional unspoilt rural pub with lots of the typical classic features, bolstered by its good reviews. (Added June 2024)

name: The Cherry Tree
description:
City: Leicester
description: Mixed reviews but it looks worth popping by. A traditional backstreet ale house, still family-run. (Added June 2024)

name: Shakespeare's Head
description:
City: London
description: An unspoilt must-visit, with traditional characterful interior and lived-in feel. Highly rated too. (Added June 2024)

name: Малкия Интер
description:
City: Veliko Tarnovo
description: Malkia Inter, by Bulgaria's standards a quirky highly personalised venue that seems well worth a look. Good reviews. (Added June 2024)

name: Cabardouche
description:
City: Antwerp
description: Brewery with pleasant leafy looking venue, very popular and well reviewed. (Added June 2024)

name: The Store
description:
City: Luxembourg
description: Friendly and cosy looking bottleshop with warm hues and a loungey feel. Excellent reviews. (Added June 2024)

name: The Salisbury Hotel (Harringay)
description:
City: London
description: Restored art nouveau interior makes this one worth heading out to. (Added June 2024)

name: Vinotéka Výčep Jihomoravských vín
description:
City: Prague
description: One of the few remaining family-run Vinárnas in the city, looks personalised and worth a look. (Added June 2024)

name: Hanspaulský bar U Hřebíka
description:
City: Prague
description: A little half-basement low key rustic hangout in a supposedly posh area. Very well reviewed. (Added June 2024)

name: Hospoda ,Hajzlík'
description:
City: Prague
description: By all accounts a completely unreconstructed dive bar, which, if that is your thing, may be of interest! (Added June 2024)

name: Pivnice V Zápolí
description:
City: Prague
description: Tucked away little boozer with a lightly farm/rustic based decoration, drinks focused. (Added June 2024)

name: Sala Gestalguinos
description:
City: Valencia
description: Very appealing looking venue, a traditional taberna layout with niches and original fittings, but these days a performance venue too. (Added June 2024)

name: Kaf Cafè
description:
City: Valencia
description: Personalised friendly hangout, bookish café with events and live music, worth a try if in the area. (Added June 2024)

name: Cervecería Aquarium
description:
City: Valencia
description: Boat themed tapas bar with some original fittings by the look of it, seems worth a look for the novelty factor. Reviews for food, service, etc vary. On our first visit it was very much the institution venue but didn't quite make the cut. Still, some of you may wish to give it a try. (Added June 2024)

name: Pub Down Monkey Business
description:
City: Valencia
description: One for fans of cocktails and quirky décor, reviews vary on account of indifferent service and expense, but overall looks worth passing by, particularly given it is in the market hall. (Added June 2024)

name: Refugiarte Bar cultural
description:
City: Valencia
description: Live music and some personalised homely decor. Great reviews. Possibly worth dropping by to see what's going on. (Added June 2024)

name: Negresco English Pub
description:
City: Valencia
description: Although ostensibly a theme pub, the tat seems at a respectable minimum and this does look well put together and far more interesting than the 5 million identical corner café bars in the city. Well reviewed. (Added June 2024)

name: Praga Valencia
description:
City: Valencia
description: Slight long shot but a pubby bar that can't seem to decide if it's Irish or Prague themed, but serves European beers anyway. Looks fairly social and a change from the norm. (Added June 2024)

name: Tŷ Coch Inn
description:
City: Morfa Nefyn
description: Special coastal pub with homely interior. Popular venue but not spoilt yet. (Added July 2024)

name: Czeska Piviarnia
description:
City: Warsaw
description: Tidy and homely little holdout for Czech beers poured Czech style. Well reviewed. (Added July 2024)

name: Tafarn Y Glôb
description:
City: Bangor
description: Characterful and homely backstreet boozer that won't be to everyone's taste but is distinctive, personalised and worth a look. Well reviewed. (Added July 2024)

name: The Swan
description:
City: Huntington
description: Information online thin on the ground but there have been recent visits on social media. Throwback rural inn with eccentric operation, supposedly. (Added July 2024)

name: The Railway
description:
City: North Tawton
description: Must-visit traditional ex-station pub with wood fittings and traditional furnishings. Superb reviews. (Added July 2024)

name: Jan Pavlík - Restaurace Na Nádraží
description:
City: České Velenice
description: Iconic heritage station pub with grand interior from the inter-war period, while in typically Czech fashion, everything from the eye level down is post-war. Well reviewed, a pilgrimage site for train station enthusiasts and station pub tickers. (Added July 2024)

name: Gaststätte Willi Mangler
description:
City: Berlin
description: Looks like a quality pub and meeting spot, very well reviewed. Dark, cosy interior, tactically lit. (Added July 2024)

name: Badenscher Hof
description:
City: Berlin
description: Interesting, atmospheric looking bar with occasional live gigs, a communal feel. Homely rather than traditional or modern. Well reviewed. (Added July 2024)

name: Fasanen 47
description:
City: Berlin
description: Superbly atmospheric looking old timer cocktail + whiskey bar with muted lighting, wood and leather. Traditional rather than modern. Exceptionally well reviewed. (Added July 2024)

name: Menta
description:
City: Berlin
description: Atmospheric, shady, candlelit venue straddling both a bohemian antique hangout spot and a true boozer. Well reviewed. (Added July 2024)

name: Academia Club Ghetto
description:
City: Split
description: A casual knockabout pub with live music, courtyard, bohemian atmosphere, relaxed crowd. (Added July 2024)

name: BackStage Bar Pub Zadar
description:
City: Zadar
description: Neighbourhood pub with atmospheric terrace in the evening, some music (piano/guitar leanings) inside and friendly service. Interior a little trite overall on our first visit but in a city short on options such as Zadar well worth considering. (Added August 2024)

name: Brlog craft beer bar & shop
description:
City: Zadar
description: Craft beer taproom with atmospheric terrace, sit in familiar industrial estate surroundings. Closed on our one and only attempt to visit. (Added August 2024)

name: Muro bar
description:
City: Zadar
description: Cocktail bar with a woodstrip chalet type interior and views of the harbour. A little more going on than the average. Didn't quite reach the threshold on our visit in 2024 but wasn't far off. Worth a look. (Added August 2024)

name: Deja Brew Pub Zadar
description:
City: Zadar
description: A solid option for central Zadar with superior beer selection and a familiar pubby layout. A little samey when compared to Europe's overall offerings but for Croatia, particularly Zadar, quite clearly superior so worth bearing in mind. (Added August 2024)

name: Screws & Beers
description:
City: Split
description: Neighbourhood craft beer bar with a local feel. The interior is too generic sadly (by European standards, by Croatian standards it has some effort applied), but the drinks are good, the atmosphere is friendly and for beer specialists this will be on the list to try. For us, we'd need to go back a few more times to give it a chance to cross the threshold. (Added August 2024)

name: Baraka BBQ & Brew Bar
description:
City: Split
description: Surprisingly pricey bar considering it is nowhere close to the old town, and mainly for locals. Modern, big budget operation with state of the art lines and a broad beer selection. Covers bases well, but perhaps lacks a loveability. Beer specialists will need to pay a visit nevertheless. (Added August 2024)

name: Mieux Ici Qu'en Face
description:
City: Dieppe
description: Agreeable dockside café bar with strong beer selection, retro furnishings, tiled floor and very homely looking. Excellent reviews. (Added August 2024)

name: The Carew Arms
description:
City: Crowcombe
description: Pleasant looking rural Inn with some original features present, skittle alley, rustic furnishings. Odd shaped building and a little foody, so would have to visit to see for sure. (Added August 2024)

name: The Cider House (Monkey house)
description:
City: Defford
description: A legendary venue for cider drinkers. Served from a hatch in a thatched cottage, the real cider is the draw, but a most pleasing rural setting + garden to drink in too. Exceptionally well rated. (Added August 2024)

name: Café De Ooievaar
description:
City: Rotterdam
description: Another old port brown café worth a look. Very well rated and most of the typical Dutch features appear to be in place, if in a larger venue than some. (Added August 2024)

name: Brasserie (Beerhouse)
description:
City: Jūrmala
description: Excellent rustic looking stopoff with hanging hops and a homely setting. Beer specialists. Excellent reviews. (Added August 2024)

name: Hostinec U Koňa
description:
City: Hodonin
description: A typical Czech hospoda with some good beer from Mazak, local life in situ very much from what we can work out. Needs a closer look to be sure though. (Added August 2024)

name: Szimpla
description:
City: Sfântu Gheorghe
description: An absolutely bizarre but committed attempt to recreate the iconic Szimpla Kert in provincial Romania. Worth a look for that alone, I'd have thought. (Added August 2024)

name: Csarnavölgyi Söröző
description:
City: Kemence
description: Excellent ratings for this rustic tavern, more a Kocsma than a Söröző from appearances, but they all count. Farming tools line the walls, the garden area looks pretty too. (Added August 2024)

name: Maki Büfé
description:
City: Tass
description: Excellent looking drop in bar with wood strip walls and dozens of fishing rods attached to the ceiling. Fish is of course on offer to eat here. Well rated too. (Added August 2024)

name: Kripta Söröző
description:
City: Budapest
description: Gothic kitsch, so that depends on your mileage - we love it from time to time, so interested to try this place out. Well rated too. (Added August 2024)

name: Park Presszó
description:
City: Heves
description: Roadside stop off, retro appeal inside with woodstrip walls, personalised interior and unpretentious approach. Very well rated. (Added August 2024)

name: Lipa
description:
City: Rimavská Sobota
description: Local's hangout, so much so it may put off the nervous. Ignore the very small pool of negative reviews as this is clearly going to be a love/hate place. Unmodernised interior, old folk sipping beer, exposed wood and quite a characterful looking interior too. (Added August 2024)

name: Guriga Söröző
description:
City: Budapest
description: A really well done looking pub with bar billiards, darts, warm lighting, wood fittings and personalised interior. Very good reviews. (Added August 2024)

name: The Spyglass Inn
description:
City: Ventnor
description: Essential visit, quirky pub with some distinctive original features and smuggler's cove style nautical nik-naks. (Added August 2024)

name: The Crispin
description:
City: Great Longstone
description: Characterful and homely pub with soft furnishings and distinctive decoration such as the selection of mugs on the ceiling. Well rated too. (Added August 2024)

name: Möku
description:
City: Tartu
description: Alternative bar with artistic interior and appealing courtyard. Good selection of beers here too. (Added August 2024)

name: Hrabal Söröző Békéscsaba
description:
City: Békéscsaba
description: One of a number of such named pubs around the country, it serves good Czech beer in a hospoda-like surrounding. This one is extremely well rated and surely worth a look if in the area. (Added August 2024)

name: Queens Arms
description:
City: Brixham
description: Very appealing ale house with retro signage and homely interior. Looks like a minor classic. Superb reviews. (Added August 2024)

name: Panama Söröző
description:
City: Székesfehérvár
description: Step back in time to this retro boozer next to tower blocks, somewhat unchanged appearance.

Tamás Puska, an intrepid local guide has this much to say:

"The second stop of our Székesfehérvár pub tour. Beyond Bakter, exiting the train station building, among the three-story apartment buildings, a small block with painted walls immediately calls out for attention, and how well it does, because it is also a pub, and a very cozy one at that, where Borsodi on tap is the hit today, despite the close days. , from which it is worth asking - at other times and for others - with pikolo. On the tiny terrace, we ourselves become the characters of the wall painting. Eternal companions here are the five hard-working men standing by the butt-high slatted fence with beer mugs, plus the four sitting on the terrace roof who seem to be eternal and never stop discussing the affairs of the world. However, if they were to cross the threshold beyond the circle of beer lamps of Velkopopvicky Panama, they would see the visceral pub romance, the small press tables in the room paneled from the roof to the stone floor, the smiling old posters on the walls such as "Every house should have Diana salted wine" and "Drown the beer in beer Your Sprite!", and of course the bartender herself, the woman, the host, who seems interested in the stories of travelers like us. Ferenc Czinki mentions it in his book of mini-short stories: A Pub City: "In order to understand Panama and the Railway Region, we must first understand the 1950s." Then he adds: "The Panama mystery is only further complicated by the small addition that the students of the nearby high school, the people of Vasváris, called the three pubs, Hungária, Gomba, and of course the pub tour that includes Panama, not without good reason triangle." Let's say I would be much more interested in why Panama itself was named that way? I didn't get an answer to that. But if I start from the fact that the term "Panamaization" dates back to 1893, when the financial abuses surrounding the construction of the Panama Canal turned into a political scandal and was born in connection with the related lawsuit, as a synonym for corruption and fraud, it suggests something , which I don't see, but if this is true, this place will never disappear from the big Hungarian pub map. Health!"

(Added August 2024)

name: Klub Vittula
description:
City: Budapest
description: Unclear how this bar passed us by after so many years, but it did. Grungy, but colourful cellar hangout with plenty of character and personalisation. (Added August 2024)

name: The Hind
description:
City: Musbury
description: Fairly homely looking village freehouse with real ales. Very well reviewed. A standout in that area, it seems. (Added August 2024)

name: Bar Bohemienne
description:
City: Trieste
description: Traditional tavern with exposed beams and a homely fee, beer focused too. Well reviewed. (Added August 2024)

name: Robin Hood
description:
City: Valencia
description: As far as theme Irish/English pubs go, they have to go the extra mile to reach our radar. After all, you don't travel thousands of miles just to get what you have back home. However, this looks like a pretty good effort with a character of its own too. Well rated. (Added August 2024)

name: Korona Kisvendéglő
description:
City: Budapest
description: A true surviving classic. Dive bar for locals with a personalised interior and link to the past. Be on your best behaviour, learn a few phrases before entering. Very well rated. (Added August 2024)

name: The Mateo's Drink Bar
description:
City: Budapest
description: A superb looking whisky club with booth seating, warm/gold hues. Down to earth also. Exceptional ratings. (Added August 2024)

name: Jaromír '68 Sörbisztró
description:
City: Budapest
description: Czech beer at this half-step basement hangout. Wood strip with a clear hospoda style setup. Dudak and similar beers from that stable (Pivovar Strakonice) available. Excellent reviews. (Added August 2024)

name: Joe's Kneipe
description:
City: Hohn am Berg,
description: Cult local rock pub with very little else to go on other than reviews, seemingly little information they wish to public. Exceptional reviews. The only way to know for sure is to try! (Added August 2024)

name: Konoba - Naša mala klinika
description:
City: Sveti Filip i Jakov,
description: Fantastic looking personalised old school boozer. Village wine and home made brandy. (Added August 2024)

name: Hospůdka a penzion Sauna
description:
City: Ostravice
description: Woodstrip chalet with good food and traditional country interior. Well reviewed. (Added August 2024)

name: Hostinec u Buroně Mexiko
description:
City: Mexiko
description: Village pub from the old school whose distinguishing feature is an alarming number of mounted hunting trophies (antlers, etc), with great reviews for the pub as a whole. (Added August 2024)

name: PIVNICE PODKOVA
description:
City: Karviná
description: Homely looking pub with a big fridge of craft beer available. Excellent reviews and seems to have a good casual atmosphere and social focus. (Added August 2024)

name: Grand Pub Bruntál
description:
City: Bruntál
description: A warm wood-strip pub with a social focus, characterful rooms with communal seating that looks pretty good all told. (Added August 2024)

name: Hospůdka U Dubu
description:
City: Albrechtice
description: A curiosity. Old house with old-timer hospoda but also has spa facilities, a pool, a garden etc. Excellent reviews. Worth a try? (Added August 2024)

name: Dropkick bar
description:
City: Reims
description: Bar with rugby decoration, casual hangout with table football, lounge furniture etc, and a good selection of drinks. Pretty pubby. On our first visit it was a punkier hangout than expected though there were families present too. This isn't the sports bar you may think. It didn't quite hit the mark for a guide entry but is worth keeping in mind if you are looking around for alternative options. (Added August 2024)

name: Old Crown Inn
description:
City: Shardlow
description: Atmospheric traditional pub with mugs hung from the beams, well reviewed. Seems to be worth a try! (Added August 2024)

name: Partizan Tavern
description:
City: Nottingham
description: Curious venture, inspired by a 1990 Notts County youth tournament played in Serbia. Ciders, high quality beers and a simple ale house environment. Charming hospitality and interesting football decorations. Furniture otherwise a bit plain. We'll give it another try soon. (Added August 2024)

name: The Duke Of Wellington
description:
City: Norwich
description: Victorian corner pub with a few alterations but some character. Somewhat of a throwback operation with live music, bbqs and real ale festivals. It didn't quite tick enough boxes to get an inscription but having only been the one time, we feel confident to give it a tentative wider recommendation. (Added August 2024)

name: Bonchurch Inn
description:
City: Ventnor
description: A 3 star listed (top category) Heritage Inn. Excellent reviews and traditional interior. (Added August 2024)

name: The Mountain Daisy
description:
City: Sunderland
description: A 3 star National Heritage pub with extaordinary interior which seems worth venturing to all of itself. (Added August 2024)

name: The American Bar
description:
City: Belfast
description: Appealing looking snug and characterful bar with some typical Irish trappings. Very well reviewed. (Added September 2024)

name: ECO-Bar By Michael
description:
City: Nessebar
description: Highly unusual concept bar - caves, waterways and leafy surroundings, you won't have been anywhere quite like it. Very well reviewed. Not for fans of 'theme bars' probably, but you're only in Nessebar once. (Added September 2024)

name: The Playhouse Bar
description:
City: Norwich
description: Arty/culture centre feel to this riverside bar. Great reviews. Worth a look! (Added September 2024)

name: Harp Bar
description:
City: Belfast
description: Well reviewed popular city centre bar with some of the familiar trappings. (Added September 2024)

name: Jóbarát kiskocsma
description:
City: Szarvas
description: Special village pub with old tools, Soviet kitsch and billiards table. Very well reviewed. (Added September 2024)

name: Babád borozó
description:
City: Gödöllő
description: Famous historic old wine bar with elderly owner, go while it's still going - he promises to keep it alive as long as he's able to. (Added September 2024)

name: Lidocain bár
description:
City: Kiskunfélegyháza
description: Funky courtyard bar with ruin pub styling and similarly designed interior. Well worth a look. (Added September 2024)

name: Corner pub
description:
City: Ljubljana
description: English inspired pub with leather upholstery, gin palace style decor, seems to be focusing on the pub over the theme, which is good, and probably explains the good reviews. (Added September 2024)

name: Levstik Pub
description:
City: Ljubljana
description: An old favourite locally, known for its fair prices. A simple, lived-in looking set up, still well reviewed. On our first visit on 2024 we found a character, cheap locals hangout - not quite hitting the mark but worth bearing in mind as a back-up plan. (Added September 2024)

name: Godec Pub
description:
City: Ljubljana
description: Cosy little rock/punk bunker with decent beer, stone walls and intimate vaults. Very well rated. (Added September 2024)

name: Turmstüberl - Bar Bier Snacks
description:
City: Villach
description: A Villach institution for over 30 years, a tucked away beer bar with good selection in a traditional cosy Beisl/Gaststatte type vaulted room. Super reviews and easy to see why. (Added September 2024)

name: Vinski bar "Zlata Kaplca"
description:
City: Kranjska Gora
description: A locals hangout in a Gostilna - rustic interior and good social atmosphere, more pubby than expected. It didn't quite hit the mark but of the few venues in the town, this is among the better options so worth having down. (Added September 2024)

name: Přístav Na Balkáně
description:
City: Ostrava
description: A cosy looking ramshackle, dock-themed hangout - definitely a boozer, not a restaurant. Decent reviews but not too many from 2024 onwards - need to clarify if this remains open. (Added September 2024)

name: Gasthof Drei Linden
description:
City: Bamberg
description: Very well reviewed Gaststatte with an atmospheric looking evening atmosphere, symphony in wood. Looks worth a try. (Added October 2024)

name: Velký Javorník - chata
description:
City: Velký Javorník
description: Hilltop hut offering basic, but warm and hearty wares in a traditional environment, including tap beer and spirits. Well reviewed, seems worth a try! (Added October 2024)

name: De Knijp Edam
description:
City: Edam
description: A superbly characterful, typically quirky Dutch brown café opened only 2 days a week as a passion project by some hobbyists. Seems essential. (Added October 2024)

name: On the Road Caffè
description:
City: Santa Cristina e Bissone
description: One-off quirky roadside tavern with barn-like interior, upturned barrels and rustic decorations. Very well reviewed, seems well worth a try. (Added October 2024)

name: Die Lücke
description:
City: Villach
description: Quirky little hideaway in vaults in the old town, very well reviewed. Looks decent! (Added October 2024)

name: CIRKUS
description:
City: Stavanger
description: Colourful and fairly distinctive central bar.  (Added October 2024)

name: Bacchus Cafe
description:
City: Stavanger
description: Old fashioned tavern with exposed timber frame and framed photographs on the wall, more a pub/café hybrid. (Added October 2024)

name: Original Bierhäusla
description:
City: Kulmbach
description: A central knajpa, traditional style (though a new fit) which looks a good option for a beer. (Added October 2024)

name: Brady's
description:
City: Dunboyne
description: Looks to be a bonafide classic Irish pub.  Whisky barrel tap fittings at the bar, live music performances, a true boozer. Excellent reviews. (Added October 2024)

name: Café 't Mandje
description:
City: Amsterdam
description: Famous gay-bar whose interior and history has helped give it international renown. An absolute must. (Added October 2024)

name: The Flowing Spring
description:
City: Playhatch
description: Bunker-like throwback pub with every inch of wall space personalised. (Added October 2024)

name: Het Wapen van Roosendaal
description:
City: Roosendaal
description: Lively central pub with musical leanings, typical brown café trappings too, but a higher tempo. (Added October 2024)

name: The Blue Bell Inn
description:
City: Annan
description: Historic 1700s pub with a warm traditional interior and good cheer. Well reviewed. (Added October 2024)

name: The Red Herring
description:
City: Great Yarmouth
description: Traditional lounge bar with familiar features - wood fit bar, red walls, carpet and typical pub furniture. Several cask ales available. (Added October 2024)

name: Bridie's Bar
description:
City: Bridgetown
description: A legendary grocery store and pub with live music and classic Irish character. Exceptional reviews. (Added October 2024)

name: J Beirne
description:
City: Strokestown
description: One of those grocery store/pub hybrids Ireland is known for. Exceptional reviews and local life, typical Irish character. (Added October 2024)

name: Hof Den Tuitelaar
description:
City: Meldert
description: Out of town pub with an antiquey decoration inside, but plenty of typical Flemish pub character too. Well reviewed. (Added October 2024)

name: Heckmeck Kneipe
description:
City: Berlin
description: Pubby kneipe with U-Bahn map on the ceiling but wood fit English style pub fittings. A casual hangout place. (Added October 2024)

name: Stagger Lee
description:
City: Berlin
description: Cosy, popular and very well reviewed boudoir style neighbourhood cocktail bar that looks very much worth visiting. (added October 2024)

name: 6:3 Borozó
description:
City: Budapest
description: A 'proper pub'. Simple borozo with a local crowd, very well reviewed. Popular and doesn't look particularly cliquey. (Added October 2024)

name: Barometar
description:
City: Sarajevo
description: Theme bar with brick vaults, colourful with a chemistry theme and bawdy decor. Well reviewed. (Added October 2024)

name: Borsodi Sorok
description:
City: Alsóörs
description: Popular traditional village kocsma with farming tools pinned to the walls. Simple, basic and local life, looks fantastic and reviews appear to agree. (Added October 2024)

name: Kék Duna borozó
description:
City: Tahitótfalu
description: Magnificent personalised saloon bar with a natural ambience. Warm hues, wood and rustic fittings, an out of time type place. Very well reviewed. (Added October 2024)

name: Metro Bar ("Subway")
description:
City: Ostrava
description: Retro kavárna in a crumbling interchange, a nostalgic classic. (Added October 2024)

name: Hebeda's
description:
City: Dresden
description: Wonderful looking venue - colourful old bar with wood fittings and eclectic decor. Looks to be on the bohemian end of things in terms of clientele and atmosphere. (Added October 2024)

name: Vinotéka Slávů Dvůr
description:
City: Slavonice
description: Popular and well-reviewed wine store with outside seating, tastings and platters, and a well lit cellar interior. (Added October 2024)

name: Cafe Platanos
description:
City: Lourdata
description: Mecca for bottled beers on the island. Cluttered grocery store interior is characterful with a really lovely terrace area. Exceptional reviews. (Added October 2024)

name: The Gwaelod-y-Garth Inn
description:
City: Gwaelod-y-garth
description: Semi=rural pub restaurant, perhaps slightly too foody but the interior looks unspoilt and appealing, and reviews are excellent. (Added October 2024)

name: The Peer Hat
description:
City: Manchester
description: Colourful, eclectic bar that retains a bit of a bohemian vibe despite the rampant commercialising of 'NQ'. (Added October 2024)

name: U Dreváka
description:
City: Bratislava
description: Surviving 'pajzl', cabin type hospoda in an old parking lot, cheap Corgon, seems a bit of a cult venue among that crowd. (Added October 2024)

name: Hostinec U Jelena
description:
City: Hradec Králové
description: Nostalgic interior and 8 taps of beer available, wood-strip walls, local life due to the peripheral location. Seems to be worth a try. (Added October 2024)

name: U Anny Šmejdířky
description:
City: Nymburk
description: A well decorated traditional pub restaurant with personalised fixtures, vaults and exposed beams. (Added October 2024)

name: Pivovarská brána
description:
City: Hradec Králové
description: Popular local multitap pub with a fairly traditional upright fixtures and fittings. Missed this on our 1st visit to the city. (Added October 2024)

name: Hudební klub Doupě
description:
City: Prague
description: Very interesting live music venue that also has a collection of gramophones and radios, looks quite alternative. Excellent reviews. (added October 2024)

name: Hospůdka Do Větru
description:
City: Prague
description: Alternative café bar with a very good beer selection, different from the norm, seemingly popular with students. (Added October 2024)

name: Quodlibet
description:
City: Marburg
description: Good beer selection at this unpretentious, cosy looking pub with popular beer garden. Good reviews. (Added October 2024)

name: Vinárna U sv. Anežky
description:
City: Prague
description: Lovely, homely and intimate looking Vinarna from times past. Excellent ratings. Can't wait to try it. (Added October 2024)

name: Bodega Teglskægget
description:
City: Valby
description: Popular old fashioned brunt vertshus with a pool table, lots of mentions of good service, and supposedly cheap. Popular with young people. (Added October 2024)

name: Hunnia Art Bisztró
description:
City: Budapest
description: Appealing wood-strip basement venue with live events -  apparently fairly quiet outside of those days, so check their calendar. (Added October 2024)

name: U Kajmana
description:
City: Prague
description: IV Grade panelaky pajzl which used to contain a live cayman. Quirky, decorated with beer mats on the ceiling. Small, intimate, worth a try. (Added October 2024)

name: U Tateru
description:
City: Třebenice
description: Famous 'tramping' pub, a cultural institution akin to scouting, a celebration of the great outdoors. Long standing owner. Featured on Czech TV show 'Praha Ozrala'. Superb reviews. A must-visit. (Added October 2024)

name: Šenk Nožíře Dobroty
description:
City: Polička
description: By Czech standards a very English style pub layout with compact bar and seats facing it, rustic interior with low ceilings, exposed beams and window boxes. Very well reviewed. A must visit if in town. (Added October 2024)

name: Bar Andílek
description:
City: Polička
description: Compact bar with red wall and retro plate signage. Looks superior for a small provincial town. Well reviewed. (Added October 2024)

name: La Fontaine
description:
City: Copenhagen
description: Famous small jazz bar with history. Intimate space, red walls, candlelight. Free entry outside of live music hours (9pm-1am on Friday-Saturday-Sunday) (Added October 2024)

name: Kahyt & Kaffe
description:
City: Copenhagen
description: A bar on board an old steamboat, well reviewed and looks well worth trying!  Please note it may keep seasonal hours, as was closed on our November visit (Added October 2024)

name: Cafe Ægir
description:
City: Copenhagen
description: Brunts Vaertshus, a brown pub, traditional with wood fitting, shady atmosphere, old school. (Added October 2024)

name: Haabet Bodega bar
description:
City: Copenhagen
description: Popular brunt vaertshus/brown pub with the typical traditional interior, a bit more dressy with wallpaper, chandeliers and frames, but looks rather atmospheric as an evening venue. Worth a try. (Added October 2024)

name: Tingkroen
description:
City: Copenhagen
description: Friendly, homely traditional bodega, well reviewed. Pool, typical Copenhagen bodega decor inside, and considering the format very well reviewed too. (Added October 2024)

name: Café Halvvejen
description:
City: Copenhagen
description: Superb distinctive brown pub which is positioned on the classier end but without losing its pubby feel by the look of it. Unusually unanimous positive reviews too for a major capital city. (Added October 2024)

name: Brewery of Saint Mars of the Desert
description:
City: Sheffield
description: Limited opening hours but looks like there's plenty to get stuck into here at a superbly reviewed craft brewery tap specialising in European styles. (Added November 2024)

name: Pub La Selle
description:
City: Morlaix
description: A wonderful personalised little bunker of wood, nik-naks, lamplight. Quite a find. Exceptional reviews. (Added November 2024)

name: Točna Dlabačov
description:
City: Prague
description: A tram terminus pub with a difference - the pub is the tram. (Added November 2024)

name: Hospůdka na kolejích
description:
City: Mosty u Jablunkova
description: Unusually personalised and homely mini station pun that looks worth a try. (added November 2024)

name: Hájenka Kersko
description:
City: Hradištko
description: A pleasant rural inn with wood strip walls, the usual mounted hunting trophies, pleasant garden. Set in a nature reserve. (Added November 2024)

name: The Boatmans Rest
description:
City: Worsbrough
description: Well reviewed pub on the edge of the countryside. Mock tudor, some question as to whether the black beams have been ruined by a makeover. (Added November 2024)

name: U Malého Glena Restaurace & Jazz Klub
description:
City: Prague
description: Iconic jazz club with a long history, not sure why we left the place off this guide for so long, but need to pay a visit soon. Featured in the 2024 series "Drunk Prague" on Czech TV. (Added November 2024)

name: Jarda Mayer café
description:
City: Prague
description: Atmospheric and well put together arty café bar in historic vaulted premises. Featured on the 2024 series Drunk Prague on Czech TV. (November 2024)

name: The Cotton Tree
description:
City: Bollington
description: A compact traditional pub known for draught Bass. Railway heritage signage and a cosy looking set up. Excellent reviews. (Added November 2024)

name: Pinkus
description:
City: Lichtenfels
description: A social kneipe and Gaststatte similar to the likes of Keimling in Furth, a good all-rounder that takes life more casually. Traditional and set in a timber framed building. (Added November 2024)

name: Brauerei-Gasthaus-Roppelt Stiebarlimbach
description:
City: Stiebarlimbach
description: A classic Franconian brewery gasthof with one of the best reputed beers in a star studded region. Exceptional reviews. (Added November 2024)

name: De Oude Sint Pieter
description:
City: Izegem
description: The most wonderful looking brown café with all the trappings of the best. Simply a must-visit. (Added November 2024)

name: Balkan Express
description:
City: Sarajevo
description: A characterful and ramshackle lounge bar with great reviews. (Added November 2024)

name: Zum Bierstübchen
description:
City: Mainz
description: A lively old-school kneipe with a casual approach, trad interior seemingly without the same level of tat/chintz of some. (Added November 2024)

name: Hospůdka Ateliér chalupa
description:
City: Morávka
description: A truly distinctive pub, with local artwork, grand views from the terrace and a cosy, homely interior, cabin-in-the-woods style. (added November 2024)

name: Hopkins Bar
description:
City: Enniscrone
description: An unspoilt simple local that ties back to the old days of Irish pubs. Excellent reviews. Worth a try. (Added November 2024)

name: Prince of Wales
description:
City: London
description: A must visit for bric-a-brac fans, highly personalised interior and character, real ales, well reviewed. (added November 2024)

name: Roches Bar & Restaurant
description:
City: Duncannon
description: Characterful pub with different areas. Attractive bar area, nautical theme, wider drinks selection. (added November 2024)

name: Rosengaardens Vinstue
description:
City: Copenhagen
description: Extremely characterful interior at this central Brunt Vaertshus where the old time surroundings and atmosphere are part of the charm. (Added November 2024)

name: The Bay Inn
description:
City: Bowling
description: Cottage c. 1790 housing a traditional pub, with the usual low ceilings, fireplace and intimate lounge. Well reviewed. (Added November 2024)

name: Library Bar
description:
City: Copenhagen
description: Grand century old reading room turned cocktail bar/cigar lounge. Grand piano, occasional jazz, pricey. (Added November 2024)

name: Andy's Bar København
description:
City: Copenhagen
description: Famous old dive bar which has found fame in the last 20 years due to being namechecked by Metallica. However, despite that there seems to be something about it - maybe the unchanged 1960s brown pub interior? Worth a try out perhaps. (Added November 2024)

name: Horseshoe Bar Glasgow
description:
City: Glasgow
description: Recommended central bar with interesting interior. Looks potentially trashy also... not sure about it. (Added December 2024)

name: The Ben Nevis
description:
City: Glasgow
description: Decent looking whisky specialists with a mid-brown interior and slightly baronial appearance. Very well rated. (Added December 2024)

name: Cafe Malmö I / S
description:
City: Copenhagen
description: Characterful candlelit 'brunt vaertshus', a brown pub, historic character and atmospheric interior. Nik-naks on the wall and...seemingly dildos on the ceiling. A shame we missed this place on our first sweep of the city! (Added December 2024)

name: Kelham Island Tavern
description:
City: Sheffield
description: Famous, well known real ale mecca that's always hovered around an inclusion. You may get more mileage from it than us. (Added December 2024)

name: Vivian's Pub Fairy
description:
City: Metz
description: A recreation of a ramshackle tavern, looks fairly effective, well reviewed. (Added January 2025)

name: The Mermaid Tavern
description:
City: Metz
description: A reasonably good looking central bar with good tap options, typical nautical décor but in a modern fitting. Excellent reviews. On our first visit in January 2025 we found a rock pub with a big range of beers, though the interior, aside of a few touches was fairly mainstream. Worth a try if you need a good backup after the main options. (Added January 2025)

name: La Chaouée
description:
City: Metz
description: A co-operative run pub. Ramshackle with local art exhibited and live music. Local beers available and a pretty reasonable happy hour. The venue overall didn't quite make the cut but we're leaving it here to give it another go and in case you'd like an alternative option. (Added January 2025)

name: The Black Cat
description:
City: Metz
description: A recreation of an Irish/British type tavern, but good beers, excellent reviews and amenities mean this might be worth dropping by. (Added January 2025)

name: La Quille
description:
City: Metz
description: Wine bar with communal candlelit tables in cellar vaults by wine shelves. Well reviewed. (Added January 2025)

name: Les Berthom
description:
City: Metz
description: Another branch of this effective chain of multitap beer pubs. (Added January 2025)

name: The Tap Tavern
description:
City: Kinsale
description: A superbly atmospheric looking bar, intimate with ceramic jugs fitted to the ceiling, live music. Excellent reviews. (Added January 2025)

name: The Grey Hound
description:
City: Kinsale
description: Well-preserved pub with partitions, fireplace and highly personalised interior. Well reviewed. (Added January 2025)

name: Srub U Kocoura
description:
City: Lety
description: A personalised wood-strip cabin boozer with river views - very well reviewed. (Added January 2025)

name: V pasti
description:
City: Prague
description: Private members pub (ie, smoking allowed), spend a few crowns for a members card then have at it. A dying breed of pubs, more of a cultural curio. Not for the faint of heart and some Czech pleasantries will be highly recommended. (Added January 2025)

name: Říční lázně nová VESLOVKA
description:
City: Brandýs nad Labem
description: A quite splendid looking little cabin with budget options as well as local craft beers. Highly personalised, not like the average hospoda. (Added January 2025)

name: U Kubelků
description:
City: Čelákovice
description: A village pub with an unreconstructed character - down and dirty boozer but the size and format of a community pub, which adds a certain something. Reviews all tell of dirt cheap prices. Interior has not changed for some time. (Added January 2025)

name: Velvet Bar
description:
City: Malmedy
description: Cocktail bar with a personal touch to the decor and lush furnishings. Well reviewed, fairly unusual to feature in a town of this size. (Added January 2024)

name: Biersalon®️Coburg
description:
City: Coburg
description: Exceptional looking venue with a multitap of Franconian lager options in a beautiful vaulted bar traditionally decorated with oil paintings, furnished with chunky dark wood and candlelight. (Added January 2025)

name: OTTO Schober Gaststätte
description:
City: Deggendorf
description: A classic dark wood Gaststätte with piano and guitar, a fairly casual setup albeit a pub restaurant more than a boozer. Exceptional reviews. (Added January 2025)

name: Theatergaststätte - Heiko Lange
description:
City: Wismar
description: Highly personalised down to earth little kneipe with bags of character, a rare sight. Exceptional reviews. (Added January 2025)

name: St. Vincent Bar AKA "The Vinnie"
description:
City: Edinburgh
description: Well put-together basement bar with classical pub fittings and a fairly intimate interior. Looks worth a try. (Added January 2025)

name: The Volunteer Canteen
description:
City: Liverpool
description: A lovely looking terrace boozer with traditional lounge furniture. Bookshelves and games. Exceptional reviews. Well worth a look. (Added January 2025)

name: Rocas café-théâtre / café-concert
description:
City: Luxembourg
description: Live music venue with Belgian beers. Fairly spartan on gig nights but presumably refurnished at other times. (Added January 2025)

name: Gaststätte Pinkus Müller
description:
City: Münster
description: A characterful, historic brewery tied pub that has modernised but in a way that is coherent with its history and surroundings, at least the time this was written. Looks well worth a try! (Added January 2025)

name: Weinhaus Sittl
description:
City: Vienna
description: A frozen in time wine bar with patina of history.  Excellent reviews. (Added January 2025)

name: Gasthaus Quell
description:
City: Vienna
description: Traditional, well preserved Gasthaus with a pubby feel, if foody. Exceptional reviews. (Added January 2025)

name: Bierakademie
description:
City: Leipzig
description: Intriguing venue, a blend of café, live music venue and courtyard with nostalgic posters and art nouveau antique shop fittings. Seems worth a look given its location. (Added January 2025)

name: dolfijn
description:
City: Ghent
description: Very appealing  bar with retro fittings in a modernist shop front. Minimalist, stylish, candlelit. Worth a look. (Added January 2025)

name: CLASSIQUE
description:
City: Paris
description: Stylish cocktail bar with classical fittings and a sense of elan beyond the usual - this isn't an example of cheap Wayfair instagram tat for once. Very well reviewed. (Added January 2025)

name: Pitcher
description:
City: Esch-sur-Alzette
description: Characterful and popular bar with a busy decor of retro Americana. (Added January 2025)

name: The Coach & Horses, Soho
description:
City: London
description: One of several Soho Coach & Horses, which can be a little confusing. Old time boozer with modernising in some of the right ways. (Added January 2025)

name: The Shepherd & Flock
description:
City: London
description: Classical Victorian corner boozer on the unspoilt side of things. (Added January 2025)

name: The Anchor & Hope
description:
City: Clapton
description: Compact, friendly and neighbourly corner boozer, good reviews. (Added January 2025)

name: The Olde Apple Tree
description:
City: London
description: A surviving unspoilt, ungentrified boozer with a throwback feel. Made TimeOut's 2025 list. (Added January 2025)

name: Little Green Dragon
description:
City: London
description: Essential little ale houses with good beer selection and cosy, green-hued interior. Excellent reviews. (Added January 2025)

name: The Ivy House
description:
City: London
description: The capital's first co-operative pub. A traditional boozer with impressive stage (think Music Hall). A community pub with long roster of events. Excellent reviews. (Added January 2025)

name: The Famous Royal Oak
description:
City: London
